<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-plrul" numref="200713024" wlyear="2007" wlnumber="950361">PLR 200713024, 2007 WL 950361</cite> where the Services examines factual circumstances with an analysis based on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-ruling" numref="2004-112" volref="2004-51" reporter="I.R.B." volpg="985">Rev. Rul. 2004-112, 2004-51 I.R.B. 985</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text>In the first situation, a trade association is a &ldquo;qualifying organization&rdquo;<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="513" subref="(d)" pararef="(3)" spararef="(C)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;513(d)(3)(C)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> because it is an organization described in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3), (4), or (5)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(c)(3), (4), or (5)</cite> and regularly conducts as one of its substantial exempt purposes a show which stimulates interest in, and demand for, the products of a particular industry or segment of such industry or which educates persons in attendance regarding new developments or products and services related to the exempt activities of the organization. The trade association&apos;s semi-annual trade shows include conferences, seminars, and a wide variety of exhibits sponsored by members and suppliers with information useful to those in its industry and take place during a limited time, at one physical location, where its members, suppliers, and potential customers meet together in person and interact face-to-face. Thus, each of its semi-annual trade shows is a &ldquo;show&rdquo; within the meaning of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="513" subref="(d)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;513(d)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text>The activities conducted on the premises of each of the trade association&apos;s semi-annual trade shows and on the special supplementary section of its Internet website during the period that coincides with each semi-annual trade show are of a kind traditionally conducted at trade shows<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="513" subref="(d)" pararef="(3)" spararef="(A)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;513(d)(3)(A)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> because the activities are designed to attract to the show persons in its industry and members of the public to view industry products, to stimulate interest in and demand for such products, and to educate persons in the industry about new products and services. Therefore, these activities are convention and trade show activity.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="513" subref="(d)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;513(d)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text>The supplementary section is no more than ancillary to the trade show. The content of the supplementary section serves to augment and enhance each semi-annual trade show by making available in an alternative medium the same information available at the show. The supplementary section of its Internet website is available to its members and the interested public during essentially the same limited time period that each semi-annual trade show is in operation. Although the supplementary section is available for a slightly longer period than the trade show itself, the additional time is reasonably brief and serves to allow for previewing the show before attending or following up on information gathered at the show. Thus, the supplementary section is merely an extension of each semi-annual trade show.<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-ruling" numref="2004-112" volref="2004-51" reporter="I.R.B." volpg="985">Rev. Rul. 2004-112, 2004-51 I.R.B. 985</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text>In the second situation, a trade association&apos;s operation of a website for a two-week period under the circumstances described is not &ldquo;qualified convention and trade-show activity&rdquo;<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="513" subref="(d)" pararef="(3)" spararef="(B)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;513(d)(3)(B)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> because its Internet activities are not carried out in conjunction with any international, national, regional, state, or local convention, annual meeting, or show conducted by the trade association. The trade association&apos;s website is not itself a convention, annual meeting, or trade show within the meaning of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="513" subref="(d)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;513(d)(3)</cite> because the website is not a specific event at which its members, suppliers, and potential customers gather in person at one physical location during a certain period of time and interact face to face.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text>Moreover, its Internet activities do not coincide with, nor do they augment and enhance, any such specific event conducted by the trade association for one of the purposes described in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="513" subref="(d)" pararef="(3)" spararef="(B)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;513(d)(3)(B)</cite>. Therefore, because the trade association&apos;s website is not qualified convention and trade show activity, the operation of the website, even for a relatively short period of time, is not excepted from the definition of an unrelated trade or business under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="513" subref="(d)" pararef="(1)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;513(d)(1)</cite>.<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|6|30:6"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-ruling" numref="2004-112" volref="2004-51" reporter="I.R.B." volpg="985">Rev. Rul. 2004-112, 2004-51 I.R.B. 985</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:7</designator><name>Deductibility of club expenses</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Internal Revenue" numref="3314.1">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;3314.1</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Internal Revenue" numref="3331">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;3331</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Internal Revenue" numref="3338 to 3346" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;3338 to 3346</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Internal Revenue" numref="3364">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;3364</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|7|30:7"><para.text>Dues, fees, assessments, and similar payments made to a social club are not deductible whether the club is used for personal<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|7|30:7"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="262" subref="(a)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;262(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Nondeductibility of club dues and fees, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="L-2180 to L-2183" parmkrange="y">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &dblpara;L-2180 to L-2183</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> or for business purposes.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|7|30:7"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(a)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Nondeductibility of club dues and fees, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="L-2180 to L-2183" parmkrange="y">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &dblpara;L-2180 to L-2183</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The denial of deductibility covers any club organized for business, pleasure, recreation, or other social purpose.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|7|30:7"><para.text>Donations to a club are not deductible as charitable contributions unless the club can qualify as being devoted to an exempt purpose for which a deduction is allowed.</para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:8</designator><name>Tax returns</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Internal Revenue" numref="4045 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text>With certain exceptions,<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Exemptions from exempt organization annual information return filing requirements, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="S-2813">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &para;S-2813</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> an exempt organization must file an annual federal information return on or before the fifteenth day of the fifth month following the close of the period for which the return is required to be filed.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="1.6033-2" subref="(e)">26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-2(e)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Information returns of exempt organizations, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="S-2800 et seq." parmkrange="y">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &dblpara;S-2800 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> However, if an organization has gross receipts that are normally not more than &dollar;5,000 in each taxable year, a federal information return is not required to be filed.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="1.6033-2" subref="(g)" pararef="(1)" spararef="(iii)">26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-2(g)(1)(iii)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Exemption from requirement to file exempt organization return for organizations with not more than &dollar;5,000 of gross receipts, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="S-2820">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &para;S-2820</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> There is also a discretionary exception from filing for organizations, other than private foundations, with gross receipts of not more than &dollar;50,000.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="6033" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)" spararef="(B)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6033(a)(3)(B)</cite>; <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-proc" numref="2011-15" volref="2011-3" reporter="I.R.B." volpg="322">Rev. Proc. 2011-15, 2011-3 I.R.B. 322</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Exemption from requirement to file information return for exempt organizations with gross receipts of not more than &dollar;50,000, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="S-2820">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &para;S-2820</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> In general, the returns require the disclosure of information concerning the income and expenditures of the organization during the taxable year, and such other information as may be required by the applicable return form.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="1.6033-2" subref="(a)" pararef="(1)">26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-2(a)(1)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="990">IRS Form 990</cite> is the principal federal information return of exempt organizations (except private foundations), and it must be used unless the organization is required to file a special 990 Form. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="1.6033-2" subref="(a)" pararef="(2)" spararef="(i)">26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-2(a)(2)(i)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Information return requirement for certain exempt organizations, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="S-2801">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &para;S-2801</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> For example, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="990-T">IRS Form 990-T</cite> is used by otherwise exempt organizations that have &dollar;1000 or more of unrelated business gross income.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text>See <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:5">&sect;30:5</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> This, too, is really an income tax return because the unrelated business income is taxed on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="990-T">IRS Form 990-T</cite>. If an organization has gross receipts that are normally not more than &dollar;5000 in each taxable year, a federal return is not required to be filed.<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="1.6033-2" subref="(g)" pararef="(1)" spararef="(iii)">26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-2(g)(1)(iii)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> Failure to file returns when due may result in penalties.<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="6652">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6652</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text>An organization claiming exemption before the establishment of its exempt status must indicate that the return is being filed in the belief that the organization is exempt but that the IRS has not yet recognized such exemption.<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="1.6033-2" subref="(c)">26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-2(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Organization claiming exempt status before recognition of exempt status, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="S-2803">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &para;S-2803</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> If, because of a change in activity or method of operation, an organization loses its tax-exempt status, it must file a corporate income tax return showing the amount of tax due. The transition from exempt to nonexempt status has no effect on the organization&apos;s accounting period. If the day on which the organization becomes a taxable entity does not coincide with the first day of its accounting year (whether calendar year or fiscal year), the organization must file a return for a short taxable year that ends with its accounting period year.<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="case">Royal Highlanders v. C. I. R., 1 T.C. 184, 1942 WL 324 (T.C. 1942), decision rev&apos;d on other grounds, 138 F.2d 240 (C.C.A. 8th Cir. 1943)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<feature.para.block><name.block><name>Practice Tip:</name></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text>If there is a change in activity or method of operation, the organization must also inform the state Department of Taxation and Finance of such change.</para.text></para>
</feature.para.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text>The organization may not prorate its income over the 12 months of its accounting year and report as taxable income only the portion applicable to the period during which it was not exempt.<footnote><footnote.reference>11</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="case">Economy Sav. and Loan Co. v. C. I. R., 5 T.C. 543, 1945 WL 43 (T.C. 1945), aff&apos;d in part, 158 F.2d 472 (C.C.A. 6th Cir. 1946) and acq. withdrawn, nonacq., 1959-2 C.B. 3, 1959 WL 65592 (1959)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> After the change in status, income that is derived from contracts issued or assets held while the organization was tax exempt must be included in the taxable income.<footnote><footnote.reference>12</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="case">Royal Highlanders v. C. I. R., 1 T.C. 184, 1942 WL 324 (T.C. 1942), decision rev&apos;d on other grounds, 138 F.2d 240 (C.C.A. 8th Cir. 1943)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> A separate federal return concerning unrelated business income must be filed by an exempt organization that has gross income, included in computing unrelated business taxable income for the taxable year, of &dollar;1000 or more. The federal return is filed on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="990-T">IRS Form 990-T</cite>. The filing of a return of unrelated business income does not relieve the organization of the duty to file other required returns.<footnote><footnote.reference>13</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="1.6012-2" subref="(e)">26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6012-2(e)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Computing unrelated business income tax, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftc2" parmkref="D-6900 et seq." parmkrange="y">RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &dblpara;D-6900 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text>The Code requires an exempt organization to allow public inspection of its application for exemption and its three most recent annual information returns. The exempt organization must furnish copies of these documents on request. The copies must be provided without charge, other than for the reasonable costs of copying and mailing.<footnote><footnote.reference>14</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|8|30:8"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="6104" subref="(d)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6104(d)</cite>; <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="301.6104(d)-1">26 C.F.R. &sect;301.6104(d)-1</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Application disclosure requirements, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="ftglf" secref="10:58">Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:58</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:9</designator><name>Checklist<sep/>Matters to be considered when completing an application for recognition of tax exemption</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CHK</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>Complete all parts of application form (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="1023">IRS Form 1023</cite> or <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="1024">IRS Form 1024</cite>) that apply to the organization.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>Supply the organization&apos;s employer identification number.</para.text></para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>a</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>If the organization has a number, write it in the space provided.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>b</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>If the organization is newly formed and does not have a number, attach completed Form SS-4 if the organization has not previously applied.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>Enclose complete statement of support, revenue, and expenses and the balance sheet.</para.text></para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>a</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>Financial statements required for current year (including the period up to within 60 days of date application is filed) and each of the immediately preceding three years (or the years the organization has existed, if less than four).</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>b</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>Provide a detailed breakdown of support, revenue, and expenses; do not substitute lump sums.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>c</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>If organization has been in existence less than one year, proposed budgets for two years must be submitted, showing the amounts and types of receipts and expenditures anticipated.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>Enclose a conformed copy of the complete organizing instrument.</para.text></para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>a</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>An organizing instrument means:</para.text></para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>(1)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>the certificate of incorporation signed by the directors and accepted by an appropriate government official;</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(2)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>the constitution or articles of association (signed);</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(3)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>a trust instrument.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>b</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>A conformed copy is one that agrees with the original and all amendments to the original.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>c</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>If the organization is a corporation (or an unincorporated organization with bylaws), a copy of the bylaws must also be enclosed.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>d</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>If filing an <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="1023">IRS Form 1023</cite>, the organizing instrument, either expressly or by operation of state law, must limit the organization&apos;s activities to those permitted under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(c)(3)</cite> and must provide for a proper distribution of net assets upon dissolution.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>Signatures by:</para.text></para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>a</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>An officer who is authorized to sign; or</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>b</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>A person authorized by a power of attorney, in which case the power of attorney must be submitted as well.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|9|30:9"><para.text>Provide a telephone number of a person available during business hours to provide additional information, if needed by the IRS.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Internal Revenue" numref="4045 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</check.list>
</section.body>

The appropriate fee, as determined from the type of organization making the request for determination, must be remitted with the application (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="1023">IRS Form 1023</cite> or <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-form" numref="1024">1024</cite>).</para.text></para>

Van Wagenen, 223 A.D.3d 987, 202 N.Y.S.3d 814, 425 Ed. Law Rep. 950 (3d Dep&apos;t 2024), appeal dismissed, 41 N.Y.3d 990, 211 N.Y.S.3d 262, 234 N.E.3d 1054 (2024)</cite>.</para.text></para>
