<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:25</designator><name>Bylaws of association governed by council</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id53839101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>BYLAWS OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF ASSOCIATION&rsqb;</inline.instr></name></form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>1</designator><name>PRINCIPAL OFFICE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The principal office of the association for the transaction of its business is located at <inline.instr>&lsqb;office address of association&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York. The association may have such other offices as may, from time to time, be designated by its members or its executive committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>2</designator><name>THE COUNCIL</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Council as Governing Body.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The association shall be governed by a council of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Composition and Term of Service.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The members of the council first elected shall consist of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of classes&rsqb;</inline.instr> classes of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members each. The first class shall serve for <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years&rsqb;</inline.instr> years, the second class for <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years&rsqb;</inline.instr> years, and the third class for <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years&rsqb;</inline.instr> years from the date of the first annual meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Thereafter, <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members shall be elected to the council by the association each year to serve <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years&rsqb;</inline.instr> years and to take the places of the class retiring. No member of the council will be eligible for reelection until at least one year has expired after the last term of office of such member.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Election to Council.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Election to the council shall be by ballot of the members. A plurality of votes cast will be required to elect. Vacancies occurring in the council will be filled, until the next annual election, by vote of the remaining members of the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Nominating Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>In <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> of each year, the council will appoint a nominating committee to consist of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the association who are not members of the council. At least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of weeks&rsqb;</inline.instr> weeks before the annual meeting, such committee will advise the secretary of its nomination of candidates for the vacancies in the council to be filled at the next annual meeting. These nominations will be mailed by the secretary to the members of the association.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Other nominations may be made in writing if signed by at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members and delivered to the secretary at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of weeks&rsqb;</inline.instr> weeks before the annual meeting. The nominations shall likewise be mailed by the secretary to the members of the association.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Executive Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The council shall elect annually, from among its members, an executive committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members and may delegate to this committee power to transact, when the council is not in session, business not affecting the established policy or procedure of the association. The executive committee shall keep full minutes of each of its meetings and report the same to the next meeting of the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.6</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Management of Association Property.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Property of the association may be used in accordance with the directions of the council. The council shall not incur any debt or liability, or any combination of debts or liabilities, exceeding the net assets of the association.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.7</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Insignia, Colors, Badges, and Flags.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The council may adopt insignia, colors, badges, and flags for the association as it deems desirable.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.8</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Signature on Contracts and Formal Documents.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Contracts and formal documents will be signed by <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of officers&rsqb;</inline.instr> officers of the council or by <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> of its members whom the council shall designate.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>3</designator><name>MEETINGS OF THE COUNCIL</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Regular Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Regular meetings of the council will be held on the <inline.instr>&lsqb;ordinal number of day&rsqb;</inline.instr> of every month unless such day falls on a legal holiday, in which event the regular meeting for that month will be held at such time and place as may be designated by resolution of the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Special Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The President may call a special meeting of the council at any time. A special meeting must be called on the written request of any <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the council. At least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days&apos; notice by mail or telephone of such meeting must be given to the members of the council. The notice must state the object of the meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Quorum.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;Text number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members shall constitute a quorum at meetings of the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Order of Business.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>At meetings of the council, the following shall be the order of business:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Roll call.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Minutes of preceding meeting and action thereon.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Reports of officers and committees.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Elections.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Unfinished business.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>New business.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Attendance.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Any member of the council who is absent from <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of consecutive meetings&rsqb;</inline.instr> consecutive meetings without presenting a satisfactory excuse shall be deemed to have resigned as a member of the council and shall cease to be a member of the council. Such member may, however, be reinstated by a majority vote of the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>4</designator><name>OFFICERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Designation of Officers.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The officers of the association shall be a President, a Vice President, a secretary, and a treasurer. The President and Vice President will be elected annually by the council from among its elected members and will hold office until their successors shall have been elected. The secretary and treasurer will be appointed by, and hold office during the pleasure of, the council. The offices of secretary and treasurer may be held by the same person. Any active member of the association shall be qualified to be an officer of the association.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Duties of President.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(1)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Presiding Officer.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The President, or in the absence of the President, the Vice President, shall preside over all meetings of the association and the council. In the absence of both, a temporary presiding officer shall be elected from among the members present.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(2)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Appointing Committees.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The President shall appoint all committees of the association and of the council, unless it is specially provided or ordered otherwise.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(3)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>General Supervision.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The President shall exercise a general supervision over all of the affairs of the association.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(4)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Ex-Officio Member of Committees.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The President shall be a member, ex officio, of all committees but shall not be counted in determining a quorum. In the absence of the President, the Vice President may so serve.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Duties of Vice President.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>In the absence or disability of the President, the Vice President shall perform all duties of the President and, in so acting, shall have all powers of and be subject to all restrictions on the President.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Duties of Secretary.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The secretary shall keep a complete record of all proceedings and correspondence of the association and council. The secretary shall send notices of meetings by mail to members of the association or council as required. The secretary shall keep a membership book containing the names and addresses of each member of the association and the date and manner of termination of any such membership and shall perform all other duties usually appertaining to the office of secretary.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Duties of Treasurer.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The treasurer shall keep the books and accounts of the association and shall perform any other duties usually assigned to a treasurer. The treasurer shall give bond if required by the council. The treasurer shall make payments only for bills properly approved by the council. The treasurer shall co-sign with the President or Vice President all checks drawn on the accounts of the association. In the absence or incapacity of the treasurer, the treasurer&apos;s power to sign checks may be delegated by the council to one of its members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>5</designator><name>COMMITTEES</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The following shall be committees of the association and shall be constituted and empowered by the council as follows:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Executive Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>This committee&apos;s duties and the number of members thereof are set forth in Bylaw 2, Section 2.5.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Committee on Admissions.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>This committee shall consist of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the council and shall investigate the qualifications of applicants for membership and report its findings to the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Program Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>This committee shall be appointed by and have the number of members from time to time determined by the council or the President and shall provide speakers on appropriate topics for the monthly meetings of the council and the annual meetings of the association.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Other Committees.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Other committees may be appointed from time to time by the council or the President to consider and report to the council on subjects requiring investigation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Appointment; Tenure.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Committee members may be appointed by the President to hold office until relieved if the council so requests.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>6</designator><name>MEMBERSHIP</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Classes of Membership.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The classes of membership are as defined in the <inline.instr>&lsqb;articles of association/&lsqb;specification of document&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Nomination of Candidates for Membership.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>A candidate for membership must be proposed by a member and seconded by at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of other members&rsqb;</inline.instr> other members of the association in personally signed letters addressed to the secretary. The candidate shall submit such application forms as may be prescribed from time to time by the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Information on Candidates.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The name, address, and occupation of a candidate and a statement of the candidate&apos;s qualifications, together with the names of the candidate&apos;s sponsor and seconders, shall, after receipt by the council, be referred to the committee on admissions. The committee shall send the information to each member of the association with a request for confidential information concerning the candidate. The committee on admissions shall report its findings to the council, which shall then proceed to ballot in accordance with the provisions of Section 6.4 of this bylaw.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Election of Members.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The election of members shall be by ballot of the council. <inline.instr>&lsqb;Text number of affirmative votes&rsqb;</inline.instr> affirmative votes shall be necessary to elect and <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of negative votes&rsqb;</inline.instr> negative votes shall reject an applicant. A rejected applicant shall not be reconsidered for membership until at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of time period&rsqb;</inline.instr> after the date of any previous rejection.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Notification and Subscription of Elected Candidate.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>An elected candidate will be notified and will subscribe to the <inline.instr>&lsqb;articles of association/constitution&rsqb;</inline.instr> and bylaws of the association within <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of months&rsqb;</inline.instr> months after election. If the candidate does not so subscribe, the election shall be void.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.6</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Proceedings Confidential.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>All proceedings of the council or any part thereof, acting as a committee on admissions, shall be privileged and confidential.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>7</designator><name>ENTRANCE FEES AND ANNUAL DUES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>7.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Entrance Fee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The entrance fee shall be &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of entrance fee&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>7.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Annual Dues.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The annual membership dues, payable in advance in the month of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> of each year shall be &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of annual membership dues&rsqb;</inline.instr>. A member elected after the first day of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> in any year will pay one-half of the dues for that year.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>7.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Remission of Dues.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>In a special case, the council is empowered to remit the annual dues of a member should a majority of the members of the council deem such action to be in the best interest of the association.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>7.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Effect of Nonpayment of Dues.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Any member neglecting to pay dues or obligations of any kind for a period of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of months&rsqb;</inline.instr> months after they are due, provided notice of such deficiency has been mailed to the member, shall forfeit his or her rights to membership. After one additional month, if such dues or obligations are still unpaid, the member may be dropped from the roll of membership at the discretion of the council. If such discretion is not exercised, the member shall be dropped from the roll at the end of the calendar year.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>8</designator><name>TERMINATION OF MEMBERSHIP</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>8.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Termination by Resignation, Death, or Expulsion.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The membership of any member of the association will automatically terminate on the member&apos;s death, on the member&apos;s written request for termination delivered to the President or secretary of the association, or upon the member&apos;s expulsion by the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>8.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Rights on Termination.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>On termination of membership, any right, title, or interest of the member in or to the property and assets of the association shall cease. All sums due and owing to the association from any person who has terminated his or her membership shall remain a debt owed to the association by such person. Such debt shall be enforceable against the person or against the member&apos;s estate.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>9</designator><name>SUSPENSION AND EXPULSION OF MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>9.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Grounds for Suspension or Expulsion.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Any member may be suspended or expelled from the association for willful infractions of the house rules or of any bylaw or for acts of conduct that the council may deem disorderly, injurious, or hostile to the interest or objectives of the association, provided the council gives notice to such offending member of the proceedings against him or her and is provided an opportunity to be heard in his or her own defense.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>9.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Initiation of Suspension or Expulsion.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Proceedings under this section shall be initiated by resolution of the council or on complaint against any member signed by <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> other members and filed with the secretary. On adoption of the resolution or receipt of the complaint, as the case may be, the council shall schedule the matter to be heard at the first regular, or a special, meeting of the council. The secretary shall deliver to the accused member, at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days prior to the date of the hearing, a copy of the resolution or complaint, together with a notice of the time and place of hearing.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>9.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Hearing.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The President shall preside at such hearing and shall read the charges against the accused member. Such member shall be allowed to make a statement in his or her own behalf, cross-examine opposing witnesses, and call witnesses on his or her own behalf.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>9.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Determination of Hearing.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The council may, by the affirmative vote of <inline.instr>&lsqb;two-thirds/&lsqb;number of voting members&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> of its members, request the offending member to resign or may suspend or expel the member. Should he or she decline to resign following such request, the member&apos;s name shall be stricken from the rolls by the council.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>10</designator><name>ANNUAL MEETING OF ASSOCIATION&mdash;QUORUM</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>10.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Date of Annual Meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The annual meeting of the association for the election of members of the council and the transaction of the general business of the association shall be held on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of annual meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>10.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Special Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Special meetings of the association may be called at any time by the President and must be called at any time by the President or, in the absence of the President, by the Vice President or secretary on the written request of a majority of the council or on the written request of not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the association. <inline.instr>&lsqb;Text number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days&apos; notice of any special meeting must be given to the members of the association. The notice must state the object of the meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>10.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Quorum.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;Text number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members shall constitute a quorum at meetings of the association.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>10.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Order of Business.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>At the annual meetings of the association, the following shall be the order of business:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(1)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Roll Call.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(2)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Report on election of new council members and on amendments.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(3)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Report of the President.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(4)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>Address of guest speaker and discussion thereon.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>10.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Secretary&apos;s Report.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>The report of the secretary, not presented, summarizing the actions of the council for the year, shall be printed as an appendix to the proceedings of the meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>11</designator><name>AMENDMENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>These bylaws may be amended by the affirmative vote of a majority of the members voting at any regular or special meeting of the association, provided notice of such amendment or amendments and their nature shall have been given to the members of the association at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of time period&rsqb;</inline.instr> prior to the date of the meeting at which such amendment or amendments are to be presented for consideration. Any adopted amendments to the bylaws shall be binding on all members, including those who voted against them. Members not present at such meeting may vote by letter addressed to the secretary.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>12</designator><name>SUBSCRIPTION</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>By signing these bylaws, the member agrees and consents to any obligation incurred by the association in the past or to be incurred in the future.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>13</designator><name>DISSOLUTION</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><form.text>This association may be dissolved by the vote of a <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of portion&rsqb;</inline.instr> majority of its members. In the event of dissolution, the property of the association shall be distributed as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of manner of distribution&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>A club organized for pleasure, recreation, and other nonprofitable purposes will not be exempt from taxation for any taxable year if, at any time during such taxable year, the charter, bylaws, or other governing instrument of the organization or any written policy statement of the organization contains a provision that provides for discrimination against any person on the basis of race, color, or religion. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(i)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(i)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>As to regulation of membership, generally, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:20">&sect;30:20</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>1.</designator></name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="101 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;101 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="5">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;5</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="9">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;9</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>2.</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.6.</designator></name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="9">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;9</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="11">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;11</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>2.</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.7.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>A society, club, or association does have the right to protection against the copying of its insignia, badges, and emblems by another organization. <cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="12">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;12</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="12">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;12</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>2.</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.8.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>The general rule of the law of agency holds one who assumes to act as agent for a principal who has no such legal status or existence individually liable on the contract made on behalf of his or her professed principal. However, in the absence of a personal promise or covenant, one signing a contract, who therein represents himself or herself to be the agent of an association as a disclosed and known principal, or who assumes to contract for such principal only, cannot be held personally liable upon the covenants contained in such contract. <cite type="case">Whitford v. Laidler, 94 N.Y. 145, 1883 WL 12735 (1883)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="14">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;14</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="27 to 30" secrange="y">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;27 to 30</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>6.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>A voluntary association has a right to restrict its membership to those willing to sign the uniform agreement which constitutes its contractual relationship with its members. <cite type="case">Importers&apos; &amp; Exporters&apos; Ins. Co. v. Rhoades, 209 A.D. 689, 205 N.Y.S. 628 (1st Dep&apos;t 1924), rev&apos;d on other grounds, 239 N.Y. 420, 146 N.E. 648 (1925)</cite>. In general, whether to grant or refuse membership in a voluntary association is a matter under the complete control of the organization itself, and its ruling in this respect is not subject to review by the courts. <cite type="case">Simons v. Berry, 210 A.D. 90, 205 N.Y.S. 442 (1st Dep&apos;t 1924)</cite>; <cite type="case">Barazani v. Brighton and Manhattan Beach Chamber of Commerce and Civic Ass&apos;n, Inc., 20 Misc. 2d 844, 194 N.Y.S.2d 426 (Sup 1959)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>However, an association&apos;s authority to restrict membership is not unlimited where restriction is based on race, gender, or ethnicity. Thus, refusal of membership on such grounds can be challenged under circumstances, using antidiscrimination laws applicable to public entities. Associations, like corporations and other legislatively defined entities, are within the sphere of legislative control. <cite type="case">New York State Club Ass&apos;n, Inc. v. City of New York, 487 U.S. 1, 108 S. Ct. 2225, 101 L. Ed. 2d 1 (1988)</cite> (upholding New York City law forbidding discrimination in certain clubs with greater than 400 members in the interest of assuring equal access to business opportunities to women and minorities).</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="15 to 24" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;15 to 24</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="13 to 26" secrange="y">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;13 to 26</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>7.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>Provisions of the articles of association imposing upon members the payment of dues and assessments at stated times, and subscribed to by them, create a legal obligation upon the part of each member to pay such dues and assessments as long as the society remains a going concern and his or her membership therein continues. <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="17">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;17</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="17">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;17</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="23">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;23</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>9.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>An association may expel a member for a violation of its established rules for which expulsion is provided. <cite type="case">Marandino v. Westchester Country Club, Inc., 33 A.D.3d 800, 822 N.Y.S.2d 762 (2d Dep&apos;t 2006)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>Within contracts of association there inheres a term binding members to loyal support of the society in the attainment of its proper purposes and that, for a gross breach of this obligation, the power of expulsion is impliedly conferred on the association. <cite type="case">Berich v. Ithaca Police Benev. Ass&apos;n, Inc., 23 A.D.3d 904, 804 N.Y.S.2d 833 (3d Dep&apos;t 2005)</cite>; <cite type="case">Kelly v. Northport Yacht Club, Inc., 44 A.D.3d 858, 844 N.Y.S.2d 358 (2d Dep&apos;t 2007)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Rights and liabilities arising out of contract for lifetime membership in social or fraternal club or association" volref="10" pageref="1357">Rights and liabilities arising out of contract for lifetime membership in social or fraternal club or association, 10 A.L.R.3d 1357</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="21">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;21</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="23">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;23</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="ajpof2" titlename="Wrongful Expulsion from Voluntary Social Organization" volref="44" pageref="455">Wrongful Expulsion from Voluntary Social Organization, 44 Am. Jur. Proof of Facts 2d 455</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>10.</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>10.2.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>All members in good standing have a legally enforceable right to attend the meetings of the association and participate in its deliberations and decisions. Where the laws of the association prescribe the time and manner of giving notice, notice to members must be given as so prescribed. <cite type="case">In re Bandanza, 132 Misc. 817, 230 N.Y.S. 460 (Sup 1928)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="18">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;18</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="17">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;17</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>11.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>The bylaws or articles of association should provide that amendments are valid and binding on all members, including those who may have voted against them.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>Where the association has the right to alter its constitution and bylaws, a member is deemed to have consented to and acquiesced in amendments duly made. <cite type="case">Havens v. King, 221 A.D. 475, 224 N.Y.S. 193 (3d Dep&apos;t 1927), aff&apos;d, 250 N.Y. 617, 166 N.E. 346 (1929)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>As a general rule, unless forbidden by the organic law, an association, club, or society may alter, amend, or repeal its laws or enact others consistent with the purposes for which it was organized, whenever the welfare of the association so requires. <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="7">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;7</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="7">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;7</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="8">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;8</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>BYLAW</label><designator>13.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|26|30:25"><para.text>Where the operations of a voluntary association have been discontinued, its objects and purposes being abandoned by common consent, a court of equity has jurisdiction to decree a dissolution and to distribute its funds among its several members or contributors. <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="11">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;11</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="11">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;11</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="38">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;38</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<section.body>
<form uuid="I9aa444403fa111e6b356a92de1b1c32a">
<form.name.block><name>Meetings</name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|27|30:25.50"><form.text>Meetings of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of social or recreational group&rsqb;</inline.instr> may be called by the agreement of <inline.instr>&lsqb;percentage of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> or more of the members of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of social or recreational group&rsqb;</inline.instr> or by the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of executive board or committee&rsqb;</inline.instr>. Not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> business days&apos; notice of each meeting shall be given to each member, provided that a member may at any time before or after such meeting waive notice. For purposes of the preceding sentence, business days shall include only those days on which both United States national banking associations and Bermuda banks are open for regular business.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="112 to 118" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;112 to 118</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="143 to 146" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;143 to 146</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="222 to 224" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;222 to 224</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<section.body>
<form uuid="Id53887301b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|28|30:26"><form.text>&ldquo;Cause&rdquo; means any one or more of the following, as determined by <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of association committee&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> or its delegate in its sole discretion:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|28|30:26"><form.text>a member&apos;s commission of a felony or any crime of moral turpitude;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|28|30:26"><form.text>a member&apos;s dishonesty or material violation of standards of integrity in the course of fulfilling his or her duties to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|28|30:26"><form.text>a material violation of a material written policy of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr>, violation of which would be grounds for immediate dismissal under applicable <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr> policy; or</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|28|30:26"><form.text>willful and deliberate failure on the part of the member to perform his or her duties to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr> in any material respect, after reasonable notice of such failure and an opportunity to correct it.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:27</designator><name>Membership application</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id538ae401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>APPLICATION FOR MEMBERSHIP IN <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF ASSOCIATION&rsqb;</inline.instr></name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|30|30:27"><form.text>In consideration of participation in the benefits of the promotional and other activities of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr>, as well as in organizational affairs in accordance with the <inline.instr>&lsqb;articles of association/constitution/&lsqb;specification of other document&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> and bylaws, and in further consideration of like commitment by other members on the membership list, I, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of applicant&rsqb;</inline.instr>, apply for membership in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr> beginning <inline.instr>&lsqb;begin date of membership&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|30|30:27"><form.text>I agree to pay dues during each fiscal year, <inline.instr>&lsqb;begin date of fiscal year&rsqb;</inline.instr> to <inline.instr>&lsqb;end date of fiscal year&rsqb;</inline.instr>, throughout the life of this agreement in monthly installments in advance at the rate fixed by vote of the membership in accordance with the bylaws at the annual meeting of the association prior to the commencement of each such fiscal year.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|30|30:27"><form.text>When accepted by the association, this application will constitute an agreement by me to abide by the articles of association, bylaws and regulations of this association and will remain in effect until I resign my membership in writing at the end of any fiscal year or the association cancels my membership by procedures authorized in the bylaws.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of application&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of applicant&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of applicant&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<attachment.block>
<attachment>
<form.line align="c">ACCEPTANCE OF APPLICATION</form.line>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|30|30:27"><form.text>The above application is accepted subject to all the terms and conditions contained in the <inline.instr>&lsqb;articles of association/constitution/&lsqb;specification of document&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> and bylaws of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of acceptance&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l">By:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporate officer&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Title of corporate officer&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
</attachment>
</attachment.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|30|30:27"><para.text>A club organized for pleasure, recreation, and other nonprofitable purposes will not be exempt from taxation for any taxable year if, at any time during such taxable year, the charter, bylaws, or other governing instrument of the organization, or any written policy statement of the organization, contains a provision that provides for discrimination against any person on the basis of race, color, or religion. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(i)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(i)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|30|30:27"><para.text>Membership in a voluntary, unincorporated association may be withheld or accorded in such terms and conditions as the association sees fit to impose. See, generally, <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:1">&sect;30:1</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|30|30:27"><para.text>In an unincorporated voluntary association, the privilege of membership is not given by statute or derived through prescription, as in a corporation, but is created and conferred by the organization itself; it is derived exclusively from the body that bestows it and may be conferred or withheld at its pleasure. A voluntary association has a right to restrict its membership to those willing to sign the uniform agreement that constitutes its contractual relationship with its members. Whether to grant or refuse membership in a voluntary association is a matter under the complete control of the organization itself, and its ruling in this respect is not subject to review by the courts.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="147">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;147</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="15 to 24" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;15 to 24</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="13 to 26" secrange="y">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;13 to 26</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:28</designator><name>Resolution by members adopting bylaws of association</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id538fc601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|32|30:28"><form.text>Whereas no bylaws have been adopted governing the conduct of internal affairs of this association; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|32|30:28"><form.text>Whereas the set of bylaws presented to this meeting are suitable for the purpose and their adoption is in the association&apos;s best interests; it is, therefore,</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|32|30:28"><form.text>Resolved, that the members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr> this <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of resolution&rsqb;</inline.instr>, approve and adopt the bylaws presented to this meeting of members as the bylaws of the association, and it is</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|32|30:28"><form.text>Further resolved, that the bylaws be authenticated as such by the secretary of this association and be placed in its minute book and that a full and true copy of the bylaws, certified by the secretary, be kept at the principal office of the association for inspection by members at all reasonable times during business hours.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|32|30:28"><para.text>With respect to members of an association, the bylaws have the force and effect of a contract and may be enforced as such between members. <cite type="case">Stony Brook Shores Property Owners Ass&apos;n, Inc. v. Liscia, 169 A.D.2d 712, 564 N.Y.S.2d 192 (2d Dep&apos;t 1991)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="128">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;128</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="6">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;6</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="5">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;5</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:29</designator><name>Certification to bank of resolution authorizing bank account</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>

<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5394a801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-29_001">

<row><entry>To:</entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;name of creditor&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of creditor&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>,</entry></row>
<row><entry>State of New York</entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><form.text>I, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of secretary&rsqb;</inline.instr>, hereby certify to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of bank&rsqb;</inline.instr> of <inline.instr>&lsqb;address of bank&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York, that at a meeting of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;members/trustees/executive committee/&lsqb;title of authority&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr> held in the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of adopting resolutions&rsqb;</inline.instr>, the following resolutions were adopted and that they are in conformity with the bylaws of the association and are in full force and effect:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><form.text>Resolved, that <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of bank&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;address of bank&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr>, is designated as a depository of this association.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><form.text>Resolved further, that checks, notes, or other orders for the payment of money on the above named bank be made, signed, drawn, or indorsed by any <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of officers&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the following officers: <inline.instr>&lsqb;titles of officers&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><form.text>Resolved further, that the bank is authorized to pay any such orders and also to receive the same for credit of or in payment from the payee or any other holder, without inquiry as to the circumstances of issue or the disposition of proceeds, even if drawn or indorsed to any signing or indorsing officer or delivered in payment of the individual obligation of any such officer or for his or her credit or for deposit to his or her personal account or for cash.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><form.text>Resolved further, that the secretary is authorized to certify to the bank that these resolutions have been adopted and that they are in conformity with the bylaws.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><form.text>Resolved further, that the foregoing resolutions shall remain in full force and effect until written notice of their amendment or rescission shall have been received by the bank and that receipt of such notice shall not affect any action taken by the bank prior to such notice.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><form.text>I further certify that the present officers of the association are as follows:</form.text>
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-29_002">
<table>

</tbl></form.para>

<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><para.text>A card carrying the signature of the officers authorized to sign checks and a copy of the bylaws and constitution or articles of association of the organization should be supplied to the bank along with these resolutions.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><para.text>If the secretary is authorized by the resolution to make, sign, draw, or indorse any checks, notes, or other orders, either individually or jointly with another officer, this certificate should also be signed by a second officer, preferably one who is not so authorized.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|33|30:29"><para.text>A voluntary, unincorporated association, like other bodies, whether incorporated or unincorporated, can act only through natural persons. Accordingly, the question whether an association or its membership is liable in contract or tort depends upon the application of the principles of agency; there is no implication of agency of one member for another from the mere fact of association. Thus, since a voluntary, unincorporated association has no existence separate and apart from its members, an association is not liable on the contracts of its officers, agents, or individual members in the absence of prior authorization or ratification with full knowledge of the facts by its members. <cite type="case">Martin v. Curran, 303 N.Y. 276, 101 N.E.2d 683 (1951)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="225 to 229" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;225 to 229</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="11">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;11</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="11">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;11</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
