<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:30</designator><name>Demand for unpaid dues</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id539bfb01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<caption.block ref="manual">
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Letterhead of association&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</caption.block>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dear <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of member&rsqb;</inline.instr>:</form.line>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|34|30:30"><form.text>You are hereby notified that the amount of dues assessed against you as a member of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr> to date is the sum of &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of unpaid dues&rsqb;</inline.instr>. This amount is more than the amount that you have paid in as a member of this association. Under the provisions of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;constitution/articles of association/bylaws/&lsqb;specification of document&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the association, the unpaid amount of these dues constitutes a lien on your certificate of membership. The trustees of the association, therefore, demand that you pay, within <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days from the date of this notice, your unpaid dues and assessments. You are notified that, in the event of your failure to pay them within <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days from the date of this notice, a hearing will be held on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of hearing&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of hearing&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;place of hearing&rsqb;</inline.instr>, located at <inline.instr>&lsqb;address of hearing&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York, at which time, pursuant to the bylaws, your certificate of membership in this association may be cancelled and your rights and privileges terminated.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|34|30:30"><para.text>Provisions of the articles of association imposing upon members the payment of dues and assessments at stated times and subscribed to by them create a legal obligation upon the part of each member to pay such dues and assessments as long as the society remains a going concern and his or her membership therein continues. <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="17">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;17</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="172 to 175" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;172 to 175</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="17">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;17</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="23">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;23</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="ajpof2" titlename="Wrongful Expulsion from Voluntary Social Organization" volref="44" pageref="455">Wrongful Expulsion from Voluntary Social Organization, 44 Am. Jur. Proof of Facts 2d 455</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:31</designator><name>Complaint to governing body regarding fine, suspension, or expulsion of member</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id53a0dd01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-31_001">
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="1*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="19*"/>
<tbody>
<row><entry>To:</entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;name of governing body of association&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of governing body of association&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, New York</entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|35|30:31"><form.text>Complaint is hereby made to the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of executive committee&rsqb;</inline.instr> that reasonable cause exists to believe that <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of member&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a member of this organization, has <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of charges against accused member&rsqb;</inline.instr>. Demand is hereby made that appropriate hearing, on notice, be afforded to the member and that the board, after such hearing, fine, suspend, or expel this member or take such other action with respect to the matter as the board may deem proper.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of complaint&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of complainant&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|35|30:31"><para.text>An association may expel a member for a violation of its established rules for which expulsion is provided. <cite type="case">Kelly v. Northport Yacht Club, Inc., 44 A.D.3d 858, 844 N.Y.S.2d 358 (2d Dep&apos;t 2007)</cite>; <cite type="case">Marandino v. Westchester Country Club, Inc., 33 A.D.3d 800, 822 N.Y.S.2d 762 (2d Dep&apos;t 2006)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|35|30:31"><para.text>Within contracts of association there inheres a term binding members to loyal support of the society in the attainment of its proper purposes and that, for a gross breach of this obligation, the power of expulsion is impliedly conferred on the association. <cite type="case">Berich v. Ithaca Police Benev. Ass&apos;n, Inc., 23 A.D.3d 904, 804 N.Y.S.2d 833 (3d Dep&apos;t 2005)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="149 to 154" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;149 to 154</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="172 to 175" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;172 to 175</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Rights and liabilities arising out of contract for lifetime membership in social or fraternal club or association" volref="10" pageref="1357">Rights and liabilities arising out of contract for lifetime membership in social or fraternal club or association, 10 A.L.R.3d 1357</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="21">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;21</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="23">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;23</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="ajpof2" titlename="Wrongful Expulsion from Voluntary Social Organization" volref="44" pageref="455">Wrongful Expulsion from Voluntary Social Organization, 44 Am. Jur. Proof of Facts 2d 455</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:32</designator><name>Notice of hearing regarding fine, suspension, or expulsion of member</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id53a5bf01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-32_001">
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="1*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="19*"/>
<tbody>
<row><entry>To:</entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;name of accused member&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of accused member&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, New York</entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|36|30:32"><form.text>Notice is hereby given that a special meeting of this association will be held at <inline.instr>&lsqb;place of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr> at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, to take into consideration the circumstances of an alleged violation by you of your duties as a member of this association by <inline.instr>&lsqb;description of circumstances relating to offense&rsqb;</inline.instr> and the propriety of imposing a fine, suspending your membership, or expelling you from the association, the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of governing body&rsqb;</inline.instr> having requested your resignation for such cause on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of request&rsqb;</inline.instr>, and you having refused to do so.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|36|30:32"><form.text>By the order of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of governing body&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of notice of hearing&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|36|30:32"><para.text>If proceedings in a disciplinary hearing are had fairly, in good faith, and pursuant to the laws of the organization and there was nothing in the proceedings in violation of the law of the land, the decision of the organization&apos;s tribunal to suspend or expel a member is conclusive. <cite type="case">Wilcox v. Supreme Council of Royal Arcanum, 210 N.Y. 370, 104 N.E. 624 (1914)</cite>; <cite type="case">Spiegelman v. Engineers Country Club, Inc., 38 A.D.2d 728, 329 N.Y.S.2d 166 (2d Dep&apos;t 1972)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|36|30:32"><para.text>Where the constitution and bylaws of a voluntary association reasonably set forth grounds for expulsion and provide for a hearing upon notice to the member, judicial review of such proceedings is unavailable, unless the reason for expulsion is not a violation of the constitution or bylaws or is so trivial as to suggest that the action of the association was capricious or corrupt or unless the association failed to administer its own rules fairly. <cite type="case">Marandino v. Westchester Country Club, Inc., 33 A.D.3d 800, 822 N.Y.S.2d 762 (2d Dep&apos;t 2006)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="149 to 154" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;149 to 154</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="172 to 175" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;172 to 175</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Rights and liabilities arising out of contract for lifetime membership in social or fraternal club or association" volref="10" pageref="1357">Rights and liabilities arising out of contract for lifetime membership in social or fraternal club or association, 10 A.L.R.3d 1357</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="23 et seq." secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;23 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="22 to 26" secrange="y">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;22 to 26</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="ajpof2" titlename="Wrongful Expulsion from Voluntary Social Organization" volref="44" pageref="455">Wrongful Expulsion from Voluntary Social Organization, 44 Am. Jur. Proof of Facts 2d 455</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

</analytical.level>
</analytical.level.body>
</analytical.level>
<analytical.level>
<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>III</designator><name>Incorporated Associations</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<analytical.level>
<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>A</designator><name>General Considerations</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:33</designator><name>Introduction</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3350 to 3499" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3350 to 3499</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text>In New York, not-for-profit corporations are governed by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law (&ldquo;Law&rdquo;).<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="101 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;101 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, generally, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="9 to 13" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;9 to 13</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> A &ldquo;not-for-profit corporation&rdquo; is defined as a corporation: (1) formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">N-PCL &sect;102(a)(5)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> or existing on its effective date (September 1, 1970) and previously formed under any other general statute or by any special act of the State of New York, exclusively for a purpose or purposes, not for pecuniary profit or financial gain, for which a corporation may be formed under the chapter; and (2) no part of the assets, income, or profit of which is distributable to, or enures to the benefit of, its members, directors, or officers except to the extent permitted under the statute.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">N-PCL &sect;102(a)(5)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Not-for-profit corporations, generally, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="28">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;28</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> With respect to corporations formed prior to the effective date of the statute, by or pursuant to a special act of the New York legislature, which corporation has as its principal purpose a religious, education, or charitable purpose, and is operated, supervised, or controlled by or in connection with a religious organization, to the extent that the former Membership Corporations Law or the General Corporation Law applied to it as of the effective date of the statute, the corresponding provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law will apply. However, any such corporation may at any time after the effective date of the statute file a restated certificate of incorporation including a statement that it elects to have the statute apply in all respects to it. The restated certificate of incorporation must conform with the requirements of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">N-PCL &sect;402</cite> for new corporations. Upon the filing of such certificate by the Department of State, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law will apply in all respects to such corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="103" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;103(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Application of N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law to corporations formed prior to effective date of statute, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="11">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;11</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> It does not apply to any corporation to which the Education Law, Religious Corporation Law, or Benevolent Orders Law is applicable or to certain corporations formed under special acts.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="103" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;103(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Application of N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law to special not-for-profit corporations, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="10, 12" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;10, 12</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The application of the Law is exclusive in that, if it applies to a corporation, the Business Corporation Law does not apply.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="103" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;103(b)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text>A foreign corporation, before it conducts any activities in New York, must file an application for authority to do so from the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1304">N-PCL &sect;1304</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Application of foreign corporations to conduct activities, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="216">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;216</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The procedures for applying for the certificate of authority are set out in the Act.<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1304">N-PCL &sect;1304</cite>, specifying what must be set forth in the application and attached to it.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> A &ldquo;foreign corporation&rdquo; is defined as a corporation formed under laws other than the statutes of the State of New York, which, if formed under the statutes of this state, would be within the term &ldquo;not-for-profit corporation.&rdquo;<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(7)">N-PCL &sect;102(a)(7)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law is administered by the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|37|30:33"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104">N-PCL &sect;104</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:34</designator><name>Execution and filing of documents with Department of State; other formal requirements; corrections</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text>Every certificate or other instrument relating to a domestic or foreign not-for-profit corporation delivered to the New York Department of State for filing under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law must be in the English language, except that the corporate name need not be in the English language if written in English letters or characters.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;104(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>General requirements of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="68">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;68</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The instrument becomes effective upon the filing thereof by the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(f)">N-PCL &sect;104(f)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Effective date of certificate; effect of filing, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="81, 82" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;81, 82</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text>The Department of State will make, certify, and transmit electronically a copy of each such instrument to the clerk of the county in which the office of the domestic or foreign corporation is and is to be located. The county clerk must file and index such copy.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(g)">N-PCL &sect;104(g)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text>Every certificate required to be signed and delivered to the Department of State must, except as otherwise specified in &sect;104 providing for such certificate, be signed by either an officer, director, attorney-in-fact, or duly authorized person and must include the name and the capacity in which such person signs such certificate.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;104(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>General requirements of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="68">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;68</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text>If an instrument delivered to the Department of State for filing complies as to form with the requirements of law and there has been attached to it the consent or approval of the Supreme Court justice, governmental body or officer, or other person or body, if any, whose consent to or approval of such instrument or the filing thereof is required by any statute of the State of New York and the appropriate filing fee and tax, if any, required by law have been paid, the instrument will be filed and indexed by the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;104(e)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> No certificate of authentication or conformity or other proof will be required with respect to any verification, oath, or acknowledgment of any instrument delivered to the Department of State under the Law, if such verification, oath, or acknowledgment purports to have been made before a notary public, or person performing the equivalent function, of one of the states, or any subdivision thereof, of the United States or the District of Columbia.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;104(e)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> Without limiting the effect of a certificate of incorporation, filing and indexing by the Department of State will not be deemed a finding that a certificate conforms to law, nor will it be deemed to constitute an approval by the Department of State of the corporation&apos;s name or the contents of the certificate, nor will it be deemed to prevent any person with appropriate standing from contesting the legality in an appropriate forum.<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;104(e)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text>If the instrument is required to set forth the date of incorporation or the date when a certificate of incorporation was filed, the original certificate of incorporation is meant.<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;104(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>General requirements of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="68">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;68</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text>Any certificate or other instrument relating to a domestic or foreign corporation filed by the Department of State under the Law may be corrected with respect to any typographical or similar nonmaterial error apparent on the face or defect in its execution, including the deletion of any matter not permitted to be stated in the document, by the filing of a certificate of correction.<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="105" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;105(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Correcting or curing defective incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="134">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;134</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The certificate, entitled &ldquo;Certificate of Correction of (Correct Title of Certificate and Name of Corporation),&rdquo; must be signed and delivered to the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="105" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;105(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Correcting or curing defective incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="134">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;134</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The certificate of correction must state the name of the corporation; the date the certificate to be corrected was filed by the Department of State; the provision in the certificate as corrected or eliminated; and, if the execution was defective, the proper execution.<footnote><footnote.reference>11</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="105" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;105(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Correcting or curing defective incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="134">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;134</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The filing of the certificate by the Department of State does not alter the effective time of the instrument being corrected, which will remain as its original effective time, and will not affect any right or liability accrued or incurred before such filing.<footnote><footnote.reference>12</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="105" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;105(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Correcting or curing defective incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="134">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;134</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> A corporate name may not be changed or corrected under this section other than to correct any typographical or similar nonmaterial error.<footnote><footnote.reference>13</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|38|30:34"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="105">N-PCL &sect;105</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Correcting or curing defective incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="134">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;134</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:35</designator><name>Types of not-for-profit corporations; purposes and powers, generally</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3350 to 3499" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3350 to 3499</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text>Prior to its amendment, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite> provided for four types of not-for-profit corporations: Types A, B, C, and D. These four types of not-for-profit corporations have been replaced with two types: charitable and noncharitable. A corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the Not-For-Profit Corporation Law. A type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. Any submission or filing by such corporation to any person or entity will be deemed to have been submitted or filed by a noncharitable corporation, and any reference in any such filing or submission referring to the status of such corporation as a type A corporation will be deemed to refer to a noncharitable corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;201(b)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text>A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation for all purposes under the Not-For-Profit Corporation Law. Any submission or filing by such corporation to any person or entity will be deemed to have been submitted or filed by a charitable corporation, and any reference in any such filing or submission referring to the status of such corporation as a type B or type C corporation will be deemed to refer to a charitable corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;201(c)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text>A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any submission or filing by such corporation to any person or entity will be deemed to have been submitted or filed by a charitable corporation, and any reference in any such filing or submission referring to the status of such corporation as a type D corporation will be deemed to refer to a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. Any submission or filing by such corporation to any person or entity will be deemed to have been submitted or filed by a noncharitable corporation, and any reference in any such filing or submission referring to the status of such corporation as a type D corporation will be deemed to refer to a noncharitable corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;201(d)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text>The general powers of a not-for-profit corporation are enumerated by statute and are subject to limitation by the corporation&apos;s certificate of incorporation, by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, and by any other statute of the State of New York.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Powers of corporations, generally, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="421 et seq." secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;421 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text>A corporation organized under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law may not have stock or shares or certificates for stock or for shares, but may issue nontransferable membership certificates or cards to evidence membership, whether or not connected with any financial contribution to the corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="501">N-PCL &sect;501</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Existence and evidence of membership, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="826">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;826</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The fact that the corporation is a not-for-profit corporation and that the membership certificate or card is nontransferable must be noted conspicuously on the face or back of each such certificate or card.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|39|30:35"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="501">N-PCL &sect;501</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Existence and evidence of membership, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="826">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;826</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:36</designator><name>Relative advantage of incorporation</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3350 to 3499" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3350 to 3499</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>Although detailed discussion of the relative advantages and disadvantages of incorporating a club or association is beyond the scope of this chapter,<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>See discussion in Corporations <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="17:1 et seq." secrange="y">&dblsect;17:1 et seq.</cite></para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> the major factors to be taken into account may be mentioned briefly. The principal advantages of incorporating an association or club are that the corporate form provides a recognized legal entity for all purposes, including the conduct of its business activities and centralization of management, enables the club to have perpetual duration (unless a limited period is stated in the certificate of incorporation)<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &dblsect;202(a)(1)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">402(a)(5)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Duration, generally, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="110">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;110</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> and affords to directors and members limited liability for debts, liabilities, and obligations of the corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="517" subref="(a)">N-PCL &dblsect;517(a)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="719">719</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Duties and liabilities of directors, generally, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="683 et seq." secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;683 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Liabilities of members, generally, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="973">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;973</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>Corporate status permits the club or association to sue and be sued in all courts and to participate in actions and proceedings, whether judicial, administrative, arbitrative, or otherwise, in like cases as natural persons;<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)" pararef="(2)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)(2)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> to purchase, receive, take by grant, gift, devise, bequest or otherwise, lease or otherwise acquire, own, hold, improve, employ, use, and otherwise deal in and with, real or personal property, or any interest therein;<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)" pararef="(4)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)(4)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> borrow money<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)" pararef="(9)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)(9)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> or lend it;<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)" pararef="(10)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)(10)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> make contracts and give guarantees;<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)" pararef="(9)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)(9)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> to be a member, associate, or manager of other nonprofit activities or to the extent permitted in any other jurisdiction to be an incorporator of other corporations;<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)" pararef="(15)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)(15)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> and to exercise any corporate powers necessary or convenient to effect any of the purposes for which the corporation is formed.<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)" pararef="(16)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)(16)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>For a list of the general and special powers of a not-for-profit corporation, see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">N-PCL &sect;202</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> Unincorporated associations may exercise some, but not all, of these powers.<footnote><footnote.reference>11</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>See <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:19">&sect;30:19</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>A corporation whose lawful activities involve, among other things, the charging of fees or prices for its services or products has the right to receive such income and, in so doing, may make an incidental profit.<footnote><footnote.reference>12</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="508">N-PCL &sect;508</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> All such incidental profits must be applied to the maintenance, expansion, or operation of the lawful activities of the corporation and in no case may be divided or distributed in any manner whatsoever among the members, directors, or officers of the corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>13</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="508">N-PCL &sect;508</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>Although a not-for-profit corporation may not pay dividends or distribute any part of its income or profit to its members, directors, or officers, it may pay compensation in a reasonable amount to members, directors, or officers for services rendered,<footnote><footnote.reference>14</footnote.reference><footnote.body>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Payment of premiums by corporation on corporate officer&apos;s life insurance policy as affecting right to policy" volref="56" pageref="1086">Payment of premiums by corporation on corporate officer&apos;s life insurance policy as affecting right to policy, 56 A.L.R.3d 1086</cite> (secs. 3(a), 3(b) superseded in part by <cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr7" titlename="Construction and Application of &ldquo;Key Man&rdquo; Life Insurance" volref="12" pageref="Art. 6">Construction and Application of &ldquo;Key Man&rdquo; Life Insurance, 12 A.L.R.7th Art. 6</cite>).</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Test in stockholders&apos; actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation" volref="53" pageref="358">Test in stockholders&apos; actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation, 53 A.L.R.3d 358</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Compensation of directors and officers, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="789, 791" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;789, 791</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="ajpof2" titlename="Reasonableness of Corporate Officer&apos;s Compensation" volref="4" pageref="425">Reasonableness of Corporate Officer&apos;s Compensation, 4 Am. Jur. Proof of Facts 2d 425</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> and may make distributions of cash or property to members upon dissolution or final liquidation as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.<footnote><footnote.reference>15</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515">N-PCL &sect;515</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Distribution of assets on dissolution to members, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1431">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;1431</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> Additionally, the corporation may confer benefits on members or nonmembers in conformity with its purposes, may redeem its capital certificates or subvention certificates, and may make other distributions in cash or property to its members or former members, directors, or officers prior to dissolution or final liquidation as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law.<footnote><footnote.reference>16</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515">N-PCL &sect;515</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>The principal disadvantage of incorporation, aside from its trouble and expense, is that the activities of an incorporated association are subject to greater regulation than those of an unincorporated association.</para.text></para>
<feature.para.block><name.block><name>Practice Tip:</name></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>As the foregoing discussion demonstrates, numerous factors must be taken into consideration in determining whether it is advisable to incorporate an association or club, and the practitioner is strongly advised to review all factors carefully with the client before a final decision on the form of operation (unincorporated or incorporated not-for-profit) is made.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>If it is determined that the association or club should not be incorporated under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law,<footnote><footnote.reference>17</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="101 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;101 et seq.</cite></para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> many of the forms of certificates of incorporation and bylaws and individual provisions for such forms, appearing in this division of the chapter may, with some modification, be utilized by an unincorporated association or club.</para.text></para>
</feature.para.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>The discussion of incorporation in this division of the chapter is limited to incorporating under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. In the event the association or club determines to incorporate pursuant to the provisions of the New York Business Corporation Law,<footnote><footnote.reference>18</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-buscorp" secref="101 et seq." secrange="y">BCL &dblsect;101 et seq.</cite></para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> which provides that a corporation for profit may be organized under that Law for any lawful purpose or purposes,<footnote><footnote.reference>19</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-buscorp" secref="201">BCL &sect;201</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> recourse must be had to another chapter of this work.<footnote><footnote.reference>20</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|40|30:36"><para.text>See Corporations <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="17:1 et seq." secrange="y">&dblsect;17:1 et seq.</cite></para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
</section.block>
</analytical.level.body>
</analytical.level>
<analytical.level>
<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>B</designator><name>Form Drafting Principles</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<analytical.level>
<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>1</designator><name>In General</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:37</designator><name>Incorporation of existing association</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3379" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>An unincorporated association or group may incorporate under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. Where the certificate of incorporation is for the incorporation of an unincorporated association or group, the members of such association or group will automatically be members of the corporation so created, and all property owned by or held for the unincorporated association or group will automatically belong to and vest in the corporation, subject to all existing incumbrances and claims as if incorporation had not taken place.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="403">N-PCL &sect;403</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>A foreign corporation cannot conduct activities in New York until it has been authorized to do so as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1301" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1301(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Application of foreign corporations to conduct activities, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="216">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;216</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> Such a corporation may apply for authority to do so by filing an application signed and delivered to the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1304" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1304(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Application of foreign corporations to conduct activities, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="216">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;216</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>An existing unincorporated association should duly authorize its incorporation. Because the association is an aggregation of individuals who have contracted among themselves with regard to the manner of making decisions,<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>For definition and general background of associations, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:18">&sect;30:18</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> a vote of the membership to incorporate is suggested as a preliminary step. If the unincorporated association has a constitution or articles of association, authorization for its incorporation should be effected in the same manner as is provided in the constitution or articles for adopting amendments.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>As part of the incorporation process, a committee of the members of the unincorporated association or group should be appointed or elected or otherwise constituted and specifically authorized to incorporate the association or group. The reason for this is that when the certificate of incorporation is filed with the Department of State, it must have attached to it an affidavit of the subscribers of the certificate stating that they constitute a majority of the members of a committee duly authorized to incorporate the association or group.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;402(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>All members of an unincorporated association may not favor incorporation. In this event and if they do not wish to become members of the corporation being formed, dissenting members should file their dissent in writing with the secretary of the newly formed corporation or simply resign.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>Where the certificate of incorporation is for the incorporation of an unincorporated association or group, the members of such association or group shall be members of the corporation so created. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="403">N-PCL &sect;403</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>If the association owns property or has rights under existing contracts, it is desirable that conveyances to the new corporation be executed to avoid questions as to title to such property or rights.<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>Where the certificate of incorporation is for the incorporation of an unincorporated association or group, all property owned by or held for the unincorporated association or group shall belong to and vest in the corporation, subject to all existing incumbrances and claims as if incorporation had not taken place. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="403">N-PCL &sect;403</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>Furthermore, a corporation organized to take over the business of an unincorporated association or club may assume the liabilities of the association or club and thereupon become liable to the creditors of the association or club. The assumption may be either express or implied from the circumstances.<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>Where the certificate of incorporation is for the incorporation of an unincorporated association or group, all property owned by or held for the unincorporated association or group shall belong to and vest in the corporation, subject to all existing incumbrances and claims as if incorporation had not taken place. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="403">N-PCL &sect;403</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>If the association has debts, accounts payable, and the like, the new corporation should formally assume them as one of the first acts of its existence.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text>Under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law,<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="101 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;101 et seq.</cite></para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> one or more incorporators may organize a not-for-profit corporation. An incorporator must be a natural person at least 18 years of age.<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|41|30:37"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="401">N-PCL &sect;401</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Incorporators, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="67">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;67</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The Law imposes no citizenship or residence requirements for incorporators.</para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:38</designator><name>Incorporation of existing association<sep/>Formal requirements for certificate of incorporation</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3379" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation should be drafted as nearly as possible in the form and with the content indicated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">N-PCL &sect;402</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text>In accordance with general provisions of the Law, the certificate must be in the English language, except that the corporate name need not be in the English language if written in English letters or characters.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;104(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>General requirements of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="68">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;68</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text>The certificate must be entitled &ldquo;Certificate of Incorporation of (Name of Corporation), Under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">Section 402 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law</cite>&rdquo; and must be signed by each incorporator with his or her name and address included in the certificate.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The certificate must be delivered to the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation becomes effective upon the filing thereof by the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|42|30:38"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(f)">N-PCL &sect;104(f)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Effective date of certificate; effect of filing, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="81, 82" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;81, 82</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:39</designator><name>Incorporation of existing association<sep/>Contents</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3379" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law prescribes the minimum specific elements of a certificate of incorporation for a not-for-profit corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">N-PCL &sect;402</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> These required elements are:</para.text>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>The name of the corporation,<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(a)">N-PCL &dblsect;104(a)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(1)">402(a)(1)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>For discussion of requisites of a name for a not-for-profit corporation, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:46">&sect;30:46</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> which need not be in the English language, provided it is written in English letters or characters;<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;104(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Limitations and conditions governing choice of name, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="164 to 179" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;164 to 179</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>A statement that the corporation is a corporation as defined in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">Section 102(a)(5) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>;<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(2)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(2)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>The purpose or purposes for which the corporation is formed, it being sufficient to state that the purpose of the corporation is any purpose for which corporations may be organized under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law as a charitable or noncharitable corporation, and whether it is a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite>;<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(2-a)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(2-a)</cite>. Any corporation may also set forth any activities that it intends to carry out in furtherance of such purpose or purposes; provided that this will not be interpreted to require that the certificate of incorporation set forth such activities or otherwise state how the corporation&apos;s purposes will be achieved.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>The purposes for which not-for-profit corporations may be organized under the Law are set forth in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>See the discussion of purposes and powers, generally, in <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>, and the discussion concerning statement of purposes in the certificate of incorporation in <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:40">&sect;30:40</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Purposes of not-for-profit corporations, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="57, 58" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>If it is not formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body, a statement that no such consent or approval is required;<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>Such statement will be deemed conclusive for purposes of filing by the Department of State. If subsequent to submitting the certificate of incorporation for filing, the corporation plans to engage in any activity requiring consent or approval pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="404">N-PCL &sect;404</cite>, the corporation must obtain such consent or approval and accordingly amend its certificate of incorporation pursuant to the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(2-b)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(2-b)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>The county within the state in which the office of the corporation is to be located and, if desired, the post office address of an office outside the state, at which, pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="621">N-PCL &sect;621</cite>, the books and records of account of the corporation will be kept;<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Location of books and records under N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="369">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;369</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
