<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>The names and addresses of the initial directors;<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(4)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(4)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>The number of directors constituting the entire board must not be less than three. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="702" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;702(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>Except as otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, the corporation must be managed by its board of directors, and each director must be at least 18 years of age, except in the case of certain specified youth groups. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="701" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;701(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Construction and effect of corporate bylaws or articles relating to change in number of directors" volref="3" pageref="623">Construction and effect of corporate bylaws or articles relating to change in number of directors, 3 A.L.R.3d 623</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>7</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>The specific duration of the corporation unless it is intended that the duration be perpetual, in which case the certificate may remain silent on the point;<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(5)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Duration of corporation, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="110, 111" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;110, 111</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>8</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>A designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation upon whom process against it may be served and the post office address within or outside the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State;<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(6)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(6)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Designation of agent for service of process; Secretary of State, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>9</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>If the corporation is to have a registered agent, the agent&apos;s name and address within the state and a statement that the registered agent is to be the agent of the corporation upon whom process against the corporation may be served; and<footnote><footnote.reference>11</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(7)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(7)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Designation of agent for service of process; Secretary of State, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>10</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>Statements, if any, required in connection with special not-for-profit corporations.<footnote><footnote.reference>12</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(8)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(8)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>Special not-for-profit corporations are provided for in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" artref="14">Article 14 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law</cite> (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1401 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1401 et seq.</cite>), which special corporations include, inter alia, cemetery corporations, medical societies, alumni corporations, historical societies, boards of trade and chambers of commerce, and local development corporations.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements for special not-for-profit corporations, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
</list></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>If the certificate is for the incorporation of an existing unincorporated association or group, it must have attached to it an affidavit of the subscribers of the certificate stating that they constitute a majority of the members of the committee duly authorized to incorporate the association or group.<footnote><footnote.reference>13</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;402(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>In addition, the certificate may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert: (1) for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation; or (2) as required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate of incorporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>14</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;402(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>Furthermore, a provision may be included in the certificate specifying greater requirements as to quorum and votes of members on general matters of business or any specified item(s) of business at membership meetings.<footnote><footnote.reference>15</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="615" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;615(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>Greater requirement for quorum at meetings of members, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="914">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;914</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Number of votes to take action, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="918, 919" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;918, 919</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> If the certificate contains such a provision, the existence of the provision must be noted conspicuously on the face or back of every membership certificate or card or capital certificate issued by the corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>16</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="615" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;615(c)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>There is no requirement that the certificate must set forth any of the corporate powers enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.<footnote><footnote.reference>17</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|43|30:39"><para.text>General and special powers of not-for-profit corporations are set forth in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">N-PCL &sect;202</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Powers and functions of corporations, generally, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="421">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;421</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:40</designator><name>Incorporation of existing association<sep/>Statement of purposes</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3379" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text>A corporation may be formed for various purposes under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text>See <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite> for a discussion of purposes for which a not-for-profit corporation may be formed.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text>The purpose or purposes for which a not-for-profit corporation may be formed may not include pecuniary profit or financial gain, and no part of the assets, income, or profits of the corporation may be distributable to or enure to the benefit of its members, directors, or officers, except to the extent permitted under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">N-PCL &dblsect;102(a)(5)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201" subref="(a)">201(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text>Although a not-for-profit corporation may not pay dividends or distribute any part of its income or profits to its members, directors, or officers, it may pay compensation in a reasonable amount to members, directors, or officers for services rendered and may make distributions of cash or property to members upon dissolution or final liquidation as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515">N-PCL &sect;515</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text>A corporation whose lawful activities involve, among other things, the charging of fees or prices for its services or products has the right to receive such income and, in so doing, may make an incidental profit. All such incidental profits must be applied to the maintenance, expansion, or operation of the lawful activities of the corporation and in no case may be divided or distributed in any manner whatsoever among the members, directors, or officers of the corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="508">N-PCL &sect;508</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Purposes of not-for-profit corporations, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="57, 58" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation of the not-for-profit corporation must set forth the specific purpose or purposes for which the corporation is formed.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(2)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(2)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> A corporation formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the law.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|44|30:40"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;201(b)</cite>. Under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, a type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;201(b)</cite>. A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation for all purposes under this chapter. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;201(c)</cite>. A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;201(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Purposes of not-for-profit corporations, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="57, 58" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:41</designator><name>Incorporation of existing association<sep/>Filing; endorsements and attachments</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3379" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>The signed<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>For formal requirements, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:38">&sect;30:38</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> certificate of incorporation should be delivered to the Department of State for filing.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>The filing fee, which is subject to change, for a certificate of incorporation is &dollar;75.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104-A" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;104-A(e)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>If the certificate is for the incorporation of an existing unincorporated association or group, it must have attached to it an affidavit of the subscribers of the certificate stating that they constitute a majority of the members of the committee duly authorized to incorporate the association or group.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;402(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>A certificate of reservation of a corporate name (or in lieu thereof an affidavit by the applicant or by the applicant&apos;s agent or attorney that the certificate of reservation has been lost or destroyed) must accompany the certificate of incorporation when it is delivered to the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;303(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>For discussion concerning reservation of a corporate name, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:46">&sect;30:46</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Reservation of corporate name, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="161 to 163" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;161 to 163</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>Corporate existence begins upon the filing of the certificate of incorporation by the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="403">N-PCL &sect;403</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Commencement of existence, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="109">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;109</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The certificate will be conclusive evidence that all conditions precedent have been fulfilled and that the corporation has been formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, except in an action or special proceeding brought by the Attorney General.<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="403">N-PCL &sect;403</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Evidentiary effect of certificate, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="85">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;85</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> Where the certificate is for the incorporation of an unincorporated association or group, the members of such association or group shall be members of the corporation so created, and all property owned by or held for it shall belong to and vest in the corporation, subject to all existing encumbrances and claims as if the incorporation had not taken place.<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="403">N-PCL &sect;403</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Effect on incorporation of unincorporated group, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="82">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;82</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>The Department of State will make, certify, and transmit electronically a copy of the certificate of incorporation to the clerk of the county in which the office of the corporation is or is to be located.<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(g)">N-PCL &sect;104(g)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> The county clerk will file and index such copy.<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|45|30:41"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(g)">N-PCL &sect;104(g)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:42</designator><name>Incorporation of existing association<sep/>Amendment; restated certificate of incorporation</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3379" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation may amend its certificate of incorporation in any and as many respects as may be desired, as long as the amendment contains only such provisions as might lawfully be contained in the original certificate of incorporation at the time of amendment.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="801" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;801(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Amendment of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="143 to 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;143 to 157</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>The procedure to amend the certificate of incorporation is set forth in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. If there are members entitled to vote thereon, an amendment may be adopted by a majority vote of such members at a meeting of members.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802" subref="(a)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &sect;802(a)(1)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Procedure for effecting amendment or change of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="147 to 153" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;147 to 153</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> If there are no members entitled to vote thereon, an amendment may be adopted by a majority of the entire board.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802" subref="(a)" pararef="(2)">N-PCL &sect;802(a)(2)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Procedure for effecting amendment or change of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="147 to 153" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;147 to 153</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Authorization of amendment or change of certificate of incorporation by board of directors, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="150">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;150</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>Any one or more of the following changes may be authorized by or pursuant to authorization of the board:</para.text>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>To specify or change the location of the office of the corporation;</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>To specify or change the post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any notice required by law; and</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>To make, revoke, or change the designation of a registered agent or to specify or change the address of its registered agent.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;802(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Authorization of amendment or change of certificate of incorporation by board of directors, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="150">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;150</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
</list></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>To accomplish any amendment, a certificate of amendment entitled &ldquo;Certificate of Amendment of the Certificate of Incorporation of (Name of Corporation) Under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="803">Section 803 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>&rdquo; must be signed and delivered to the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="803" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;803(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Procedure for effecting amendment or change of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="147 to 153" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;147 to 153</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The contents of the certificate are enumerated in the statute.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="803" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;803(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>For execution requirements, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:34">&sect;30:34</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Contents of certificate of amendment, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="154">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;154</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>The Department of State will make, certify, and transmit electronically a copy of the certificate of amendment to the county in which the office of the corporation is located.<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(g)">N-PCL &sect;104(g)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>A corporation, when authorized by the board, may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation without making any amendment or change thereby, except that it may include any one or more of the amendments or changes that may be authorized by the board without a vote of members.<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;805(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Restated certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> Alternatively, a corporation may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation as amended thereby to effect any one or more of the amendments or changes authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, when authorized by a vote of a membership class.<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;805(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Restated certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> Upon filing by the Department of State, the original certificate of incorporation will be superseded and the restated certificate of incorporation, including any amendments and changes made thereby, will be the corporation&apos;s certificate of incorporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(f)">N-PCL &sect;805(f)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Restated certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>To accomplish such restatement, a restated certificate of incorporation entitled &ldquo;Restated Certificate of Incorporation of (Name of Corporation) Under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805">Section 805 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>&rdquo; must be signed and delivered to the Department of State. The contents of the certificate are enumerated in the statute.<footnote><footnote.reference>11</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;805(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>For execution requirements, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:34">&sect;30:34</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Contents of restated certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>The Department of State will make, certify, and transmit electronically a copy of the restated certificate of incorporation to the county in which the office of the corporation is located.<footnote><footnote.reference>12</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(g)">N-PCL &sect;104(g)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>If the restated certificate merely restates the text of the certificate of incorporation without making any amendment or change, then the certificate should include a statement that the text of the certificate of incorporation, as amended, is thereby restated without further amendment or change to read as therein set forth in full.<footnote><footnote.reference>13</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(b)" pararef="(3)">N-PCL &sect;805(b)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Restated certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>If the restated certificate restates the text of the certificate of incorporation as amended or changed thereby, then the restated certificate should include a statement that the certificate of incorporation is amended or changed to effect one or more of the amendments or changes authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, specifying each such amendment or change and that the text of the certificate of incorporation is thereby restated as amended or changed to read as therein set forth in full.<footnote><footnote.reference>14</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(b)" pararef="(4)">N-PCL &sect;805(b)(4)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Restated certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text>A restated certificate of incorporation need not include statements as to the incorporator(s) or as to the first directors.<footnote><footnote.reference>15</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|46|30:42"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;805(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Restated certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:43</designator><name>Bylaws</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|47|30:43"><para.text>The term &ldquo;bylaws&rdquo; for a not-for-profit corporation means the code of rules adopted for the regulation or management of the affairs of the corporation, irrespective of the name by which such rules are designated.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|47|30:43"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(2)">N-PCL &sect;102(a)(2)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> They serve the same purpose as do bylaws of a corporation for profit. They set forth the details of internal government with respect to the membership structure and details concerning regulation of the corporation&apos;s trustees and officers. Any provision that might properly be included in the bylaws may be incorporated in the certificate of incorporation. The day-to-day regulation of corporate affairs is, however, generally specified in the bylaws, allowing the certificate to be kept as simple as possible.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Bylaws of not-for-profit corporations, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="118">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;118</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Bylaws, generally, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Corporations" secref="252 to 271" secrange="y">Am. Jur. 2d, Corporations &dblsect;252 to 271</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<feature.para.block><name.block><name>Practice Tip:</name></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|47|30:43"><para.text>Bylaws should be distinguished from corporate resolutions. Although a bylaw may be adopted by resolution, once adopted, the bylaw becomes a continuing and permanent rule. Conversely, a resolution is usually confined to a single corporate act.</para.text></para>
</feature.para.block>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:44</designator><name>Bylaws<sep/>Contents</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|48|30:44"><para.text>The bylaws may contain any provision relating to the business of the corporation, the conduct of its affairs, its rights or powers, or the rights or powers of its members, directors, or officers, not inconsistent with law or the certificate of incorporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|48|30:44"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(f)">N-PCL &sect;602(f)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> The certificate of incorporation may set forth any provision, not inconsistent with the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or any other statute of the State of New York, which provision is for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation, or required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate of incorporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|48|30:44"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;402(c)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<feature.para.block><name.block><name>Practice Tip:</name></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|48|30:44"><para.text>It should be noted as a practical consideration that whether particular matters should be treated in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws depends to some extent on such factors as the size of the corporation and the desired amount of membership regulation. Generally, the more routine matters involved in governing a corporation should be placed in the bylaws. Where there is a choice between putting provisions in the bylaws or the certificate, the bylaws will sometimes be chosen because they are not a matter of public record. In this connection, it should be noted that amendment of the certificate is considerably more difficult than amendment of the bylaws.</para.text></para>
</feature.para.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|48|30:44"><para.text>In order to be valid and binding, a bylaw must not disturb vested rights or impair the obligation of a contract, take away or abridge substantial rights of a member, affect rights of property, or create an obligation unknown to the law. Furthermore, a bylaw must be a general regulation affecting all the members alike; it cannot be directed against a single member. Any bylaw must have a rational nexus to the organization&apos;s purpose, be nondiscriminatory in its application, and refrain from depriving members of any right expressly granted in the basic agreement and not made expressly subject to revision of a so-called vested right. Nevertheless, it is not true that a bylaw must never modify or vary rights of individuals; if such were the case, no valid bylaw whatever could be made.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>General requisites and validity of bylaws, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="120 to 123" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;120 to 123</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:45</designator><name>Bylaws<sep/>Adoption, amendment, and repeal</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text>The initial bylaws of a corporation may be adopted by its incorporators at its organization meeting and, if not so adopted by its incorporators, by its board of directors.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;602(a)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides different methods for the adoption of new bylaws. Bylaws may be adopted by the members of the not-for-profit corporation entitled to vote at that time in the election of directors and, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, by the board of directors.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;602(b)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> If so provided in some other law of the state, any governmental body or officer authorized by such law to supervise a not-for-profit corporation created under such law may adopt bylaws.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;602(d)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text>Any bylaw adopted by the board may be amended or repealed by the members and, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, any bylaw adopted by the members may be amended or repealed by the board.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;602(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Amendment or repeal of bylaws, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="129">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;129</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Amendment or repeal of bylaws, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Corporations" secref="266 to 269" secrange="y">Am. Jur. 2d, Corporations &dblsect;266 to 269</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text>If any bylaws regulating an impending election of directors is adopted, amended, or repealed by the board, there must be set forth in the notice of the next meeting of members for the election of directors the bylaw so adopted, amended, or repealed, together with a concise statement of the changes made.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;602(e)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para><para.text>In the case of residential not-for-profit corporations, changes including the adoption, amendment or repeal of the bylaws by the board of directors must be provided to the members, stockholders, and delegates of such corporation in writing, by physical or electronic means, within ten days of such adoption.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(g)">N-PCL &sect;602(g)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<feature.para.block><name.block><name>Practice Tip:</name></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|49|30:45"><para.text>The original, or a copy, of the bylaws as amended or otherwise altered, certified by the secretary of the corporation, should be kept at the principal office of the corporation.</para.text></para>
</feature.para.block>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:46</designator><name>Corporate name; reservation; change</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3382">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3382</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>The selection of a distinctive corporate name will be one of the first tasks of the incorporators, and it should be noted that certain statutory requirements and limitations<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301">N-PCL &sect;301</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> must be taken into account in making the selection. The corporate name need not be in the English language as long as it is written in English letters or characters.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;104(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Use of &ldquo;family name&rdquo; by corporation as unfair competition" volref="72" pageref="8">Use of &ldquo;family name&rdquo; by corporation as unfair competition, 72 A.L.R.3d 8</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Incorporation of company under particular name as creating exclusive right to such name" volref="68" pageref="1168">Incorporation of company under particular name as creating exclusive right to such name, 68 A.L.R.3d 1168</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>According to statute, the corporate name must:</para.text>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Contain the word &ldquo;corporation,&rdquo; &ldquo;incorporated,&rdquo; or &ldquo;limited&rdquo; or an abbreviation of one of such words, unless the corporation is formed for charitable or religious purposes or for purposes requiring special approval or is a bar association;<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(1)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Be such as to distinguish it from the names of corporations of any kind, or a fictitious name of an authorized foreign corporation, as such names appear on the Department of State&apos;s index of names of existing domestic and authorized foreign corporations of any kind, including fictitious names of authorized foreign corporations;<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(2)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(2)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Not contain any word or phrase or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, the use of which is prohibited or restricted by statute;<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, in a context that indicates or implies that the corporation is formed or authorized for any purpose or is possessed in the state of any power other than a purpose for which, or a power with which, the domestic corporation may be and is formed or the foreign corporation is authorized;<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(4)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(4)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(e)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Not, with certain exceptions, contain any of the proscribed words or phrases, or any abbreviation or derivative of such words or phrases, to include &ldquo;bank,&rdquo; &ldquo;casualty,&rdquo; &ldquo;doctor,&rdquo; &ldquo;endowment,&rdquo; &ldquo;insurance,&rdquo; &ldquo;lawyer,&rdquo; and &ldquo;underwriter&rdquo;;<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(5)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>The use of the words listed is permitted if certain requirements are met. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)" spararef="(B)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(5)(B)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>The word &ldquo;doctor&rdquo; has special ramifications governing its use. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)" spararef="(B)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(5)(B)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(9)">(9)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(f)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, in a context that will tend to mislead the public into believing that the corporation is an agency or instrumentality of the United States or the State of New York, or a subdivision of such entities, or is a public corporation;<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(6)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(6)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(g)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Not contain the word &ldquo;cooperative&rdquo; or an abbreviation, contraction, or derivative of such word.<footnote><footnote.reference>9</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(7)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(7)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>(h)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivation of a word or phrase, that, separately or in context, is indecent or obscene or ridicules or degrades any person, group, belief, business, or agency of government or indicates or implies any unlawful activity;<footnote><footnote.reference>10</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301" subref="(a)" pararef="(8)">N-PCL &sect;301(a)(8)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para></list.item>
</list></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>After having determined that a given name is available for use, counsel should arrange to reserve it. A corporate name may be reserved by: (1) any person intending to form a domestic corporation; (2) any domestic corporation intending to change its name; (3) any foreign corporation intending to apply for authority to conduct activities in New York; (4) any authorized foreign corporation intending to change its name; (5) any person intending to incorporate a foreign corporation and to have it apply for authority to conduct activities in New York; (6) any domestic corporation intending to file the consent of the Attorney General to reinstate such corporation pursuant to the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.<footnote><footnote.reference>11</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;303(a)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>A fictitious name for use as an authorized foreign corporation may be reserved by: (1) any foreign corporation intending to apply for authority to do business in the State of New York; (2) any authorized foreign corporation intending to change its fictitious name under which it conducts activities in this state; and (3) any authorized foreign corporation which has changed its corporate name in its jurisdiction, which new corporate name is not available in this state.<footnote><footnote.reference>12</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;303(b)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>An application to reserve a corporate name must be delivered to the Department of State. The application must set forth the applicant&apos;s name and address, the name to be reserved, and a statement of the basis under Section 303 of the Law for the application,<footnote><footnote.reference>13</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;303(c)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> for example, that the basis for the application is that the applicant is a person intending to form a domestic corporation. The Secretary of State may require the applicant to set forth in the application the nature of the activities to be conducted by the corporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>14</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;303(c)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> The application must be signed by the applicant or the applicant&apos;s attorney or agent.<footnote><footnote.reference>15</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(f)">N-PCL &sect;303(f)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> The fee for filing an application for reservation of a corporate name, which is subject to change, is &dollar;10.<footnote><footnote.reference>16</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104-A" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;104-A(b)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>If the name is available for corporate use, the Department of State will reserve the name for the applicant&apos;s use for a period of 60 days and issue a certificate of reservation.<footnote><footnote.reference>17</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;303(c)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> The certificate of reservation (or in lieu thereof an affidavit by the applicant or by the applicant&apos;s agent or attorney that the certificate of reservation has been lost or destroyed) must accompany the certificate of incorporation or the application for authority when it is delivered to the Department of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>18</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;303(c)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>The Secretary of State may extend the reservation for additional periods of not more than 60 days each, upon the written request of the applicant, or the applicant&apos;s attorney or agent, delivered to the Department of State, to be filed before the expiration of the reservation period then in effect.<footnote><footnote.reference>19</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;303(d)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> The request must have attached to it the certificate of reservation of name.<footnote><footnote.reference>20</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;303(d)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote> No more than two such extensions will be granted.<footnote><footnote.reference>21</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;303(d)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>Upon the applicant&apos;s request, delivered to the Department of State before the expiration of the reserved period, together with the certificate of reservation, the Department will cancel the reservation.<footnote><footnote.reference>22</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;303(e)</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>A corporation may change its name by amending its certificate of incorporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>23</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="801" subref="(b)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &sect;801(b)(1)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|50|30:46"><para.text>For discussion concerning amendment of certificate of incorporation, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:42">&sect;30:42</cite>.</para.text></para></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:47</designator><name>Secretary of State as designated agent for service of process; registered agent</name></outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3459">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3459</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3494">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3494</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text>The Secretary of State is the agent of every domestic corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and every authorized foreign corporation upon whom process against the corporation may be served.<footnote><footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="304" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;304(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Designation of agent for service of process; Secretary of State, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<feature.para.block><name.block><name>Practice Tip:</name></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation must contain a provision designating the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation upon whom process against it may be served and a post office address within or outside the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State.<footnote><footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(6)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(6)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Designation of agent for service of process; Secretary of State, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
</feature.para.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text>Additionally, a domestic corporation organized under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law and a foreign corporation authorized to conduct activities in New York may designate a registered agent in the State of New York upon whom process against the corporation may be served.<footnote><footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;305(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Designation of agent for service of process, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The agent must be a natural person who is a resident of or has a business address in the State of New York or a domestic corporation or a foreign corporation of any type or kind formed or authorized to do business in the state under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or under any other statute of the State of New York.<footnote><footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;305(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text>As to statutory provisions concerning service of process on a registered agent, see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="306">N-PCL &sect;306</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Designation of agent for service of process, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The designation of a registered agent, with the agent&apos;s name and address and a statement that the registered agent is to be the agent of the corporation upon whom process against it may be served, is made in the certificate of incorporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(b)">N-PCL &dblsect;305(b)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(7)">402(a)(7)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Specific requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Designation of agent for service of process; Secretary of State, see <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> The designation of a registered agent may be made, revoked, or changed, or the address of the registered agent may be specified or changed by amendment of the corporation&apos;s certificate of incorporation.<footnote><footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(b)">N-PCL &dblsect;305(b)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="801" subref="(b)" pararef="(8)">801(b)(8)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Amendment of certificate of incorporation, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="143 to 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;143 to 157</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text>A change in the certificate of incorporation making, revoking, or changing the designation of a registered agent or specifying or changing the address of a registered agent may be authorized by or pursuant to authorization of the board of directors.<footnote><footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">N-PCL &sect;802(c)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Authorization of amendment or change of certificate of incorporation by board of directors, <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="150">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;150</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block></footnote.body></footnote> Such a change may be accomplished by filing a certificate of change, entitled &ldquo;Certificate of Change of (Name of Corporation) Under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="803-A">Section 803-A of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.&rdquo;<footnote><footnote.reference>8</footnote.reference><footnote.body><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="803-A">N-PCL &sect;803-A</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|51|30:47"><para.text>The fee for filing a certificate of change, which is subject to change, is &dollar;20. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104-A" subref="(g)">N-PCL &sect;104-A(g)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
