<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:53</designator><name>Checklist<sep/>Actions to be taken prior to incorporation of existing association</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CHK</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"><para.text>Calling a meeting of all the members to decide the issue of incorporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"><para.text>Sending a notice of the meeting to all the members.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"><para.text>Passing a resolution, by a majority of the members, authorizing incorporation of the association and execution of the certificate of incorporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"><para.text>Formation, by election, appointment, or otherwise, of a committee of members specifically authorized to incorporate the association and execute the certificate of incorporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"><para.text>Recording minutes of the meeting containing the vote of the membership authorizing incorporation of the association and execution of certificate of incorporation and formation of a committee of members to accomplish the incorporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"><para.text>Preparing affidavit that incorporation has been authorized.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|57|30:53"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation of what was previous to incorporation an unincorporated not-for-profit association or group must have annexed thereto an affidavit of the subscribers of such certificate, stating that they constitute a majority of the members of a committee duly authorized to incorporate such association or group. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;402(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3375" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3375</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</check.list>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:54</designator><name>Checklist<sep/>Matters to be considered in selecting a corporate name</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CHK</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must contain one of the following: &ldquo;corporation,&rdquo; &ldquo;incorporated,&rdquo; or &ldquo;limited,&rdquo; or an abbreviation of one of such words (unless the corporation is formed for charitable or religious purposes or for purposes requiring special approval or is a bar association).</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must not contain any word or phrase, or abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, that indicates or implies that the corporation is organized for any purpose other than one or more of the purposes permitted by its certificate of incorporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must be distinguishable from the names of corporations of any kind or a fictitious name of an authorized foreign corporation, as such names appear on the Department of State&apos;s index of names of existing domestic and authorized foreign corporations.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, the use of which is prohibited or restricted by statute.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, in a context that indicates or implies that the corporation is authorized for any purpose or is possessed in the state of any power other than a purpose for which, or a power with which, the corporation may be and is formed or the foreign corporation is authorized.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must not, with certain exceptions, contain any of certain, specified words or phrases, or any abbreviation or derivative of such words or phrases, such as &ldquo;bank,&rdquo; &ldquo;casualty,&rdquo; &ldquo;doctor,&rdquo; &ldquo;endowment,&rdquo; &ldquo;insurance,&rdquo; &ldquo;lawyer,&rdquo; &ldquo;surety,&rdquo; and &ldquo;underwriter.&rdquo;</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>7</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, in a context that will tend to mislead the public into believing that the corporation is an agency or instrumentality of the United States or the State of New York, or a subdivision thereof, or is a public corporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>8</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must not contain the word &ldquo;cooperative&rdquo; or an abbreviation, contraction, or derivative of such word.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>9</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name must not contain any word or phrase, or any abbreviation or derivative of a word or phrase, that, separately or in context, is indecent or obscene or ridicules or degrades any person, group, belief, business, or agency of government or indicates or implies any unlawful activity.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>10</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>The name need not be in the English language as long as it is written in English letters or characters.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>This checklist is based on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301">N-PCL &sect;301</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|58|30:54"><para.text>For discussion of corporate name, reservation, and change of name, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:46">&sect;30:46</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3382">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3382</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="164 to 176" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;164 to 176</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</check.list>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:55</designator><name>Checklist<sep/>Matters that must be stated in certificate of incorporation</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CHK</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Name of the corporation, which must satisfy the requirements of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>If an existing unincorporated association is being incorporated, the name of that association.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Statement that the corporation is organized pursuant to the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Statement that the corporation is a corporation as defined in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">Section 102(a)(5) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Purpose or purposes for which it is formed, it being sufficient to state that the purpose of the corporation is any purpose for which corporations may be organized under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law as a charitable or noncharitable corporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Whether it is a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">Section 201 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>7</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>If it is not formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body, a statement that no such consent or approval is required.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>8</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>County within the state in which the office of the corporation is to be located.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>9</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>The post office address of an office outside the state, if any, where books and records of account are to be kept.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>10</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>The names and addresses of the initial directors.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>11</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Duration of the corporation if other than perpetual.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>12</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process on the corporation and the post office address within or outside the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of process against the corporation served upon him or her. The corporation may include an email address to which the Secretary of State may email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>13</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Name and address within the state of corporation&apos;s registered agent, if any, and a statement that such registered agent is to be the agent of the corporation upon whom process against it may be served.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>14</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Statement concerning approvals or consents.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>15</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Statements, if any, concerning special not-for-profit corporations.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>16</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Any other provision(s) permitted by law concerning regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation (including types or classes of membership and distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation) or required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>17</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Signature(s) of incorporator(s).</para.text></para></list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>The certificate must be entitled &ldquo;Certificate of Incorporation of <ital>(Name of Corporation)</ital> Under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">Section 402 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law</cite>.&rdquo; <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>This checklist is based on the provisions of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">N-PCL &sect;402</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>For discussion concerning the contents of a certificate of incorporation, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:39">&sect;30:39</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>1.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301">N-PCL &sect;301</cite> sets out the general rules governing the requirements for corporate names for nonprofit corporations.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3375" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3375</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="164 to 176" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;164 to 176</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>5.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>A corporation may be formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for any one or more of the purposes specified in the Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="57, 58, 421" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58, 421</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>6.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>Prior to its amendment, four types of not-for-profit corporations, Types A, B, C and D, were provided for. These four types have been replaced with two types, charitable and noncharitable.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>A corporation formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. A type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation. A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>For complete discussion of types of not-for-profit corporations, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>9.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law requires every not-for-profit corporation to keep, at the office of the corporation, correct and complete books and records of account and minutes of the proceedings of its members, board, and executive committee, if any, and to keep at such office or at the office of its transfer agent or registrar in this state a list or record containing the names and addresses of all members, the class or classes of membership or capital certificates and the number of capital certificates held by each, and the dates when they respectively became the holders of record thereof. However, the corporation may keep its books and records of account in an office of the corporation without the state, as specified in its certificate of incorporation. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="621" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;621(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="396">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;396</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>12.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>The Secretary of State is the agent of every domestic corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="304" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;304(a)</cite>. Additionally, the certificate of incorporation must contain a designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process and provide therein a post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State. The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(6)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(6)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>13.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation is not required to have a registered agent, inasmuch as the statute is couched in permissive language. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;305(a)</cite>. In any event, however, the Secretary of State will be the agent for service of process against the corporation, (see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="304" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;304(a)</cite>) and must be designated as such in the certificate of incorporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(6)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(6)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>The corporation&apos;s registered agent is the person upon whom process against the corporation may be served and who shall deliver to the corporation all process, notices, or demands received by the agent as agent for the corporation. The registered agent must be: (1) a natural person who is a resident of or has a business address in the State of New York; or (2) a domestic corporation or a foreign corporation of any type or kind formed or authorized to conduct business in the State of New York under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or other state statute. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;305(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>For the procedure for serving process on a registered agent, see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="306">N-PCL &sect;306</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>The designation of a registered agent may be made, revoked, or changed as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;305(b)</cite>. This means that the designation may only be made in the certificate of incorporation and that any designation (if the corporation made no designation in its original certificate of incorporation), change, or revocation must be made by amending the certificate. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="801" subref="(b)" pararef="(8)">N-PCL &dblsect;801(b)(8)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">802(c)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>16.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|59|30:55"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert: (1) for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation; or (2) as required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate of incorporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;402(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71, 72" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;71, 72</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</check.list>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:56</designator><name>Checklist<sep/>Matters that may be included in either the certificate of incorporation or bylaws</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CHK</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Limitations, if any, on the general powers of the corporation provided for in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Membership qualifications if the corporation is to have members.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>When the corporation is to have two or more classes of members, the designation of such classes and the relative rights and limitations of the different classes of members.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Voting, property, and other rights and privileges of members.</para.text></para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>a</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Where a member is entitled to vote, the member shall have no more than nor less than one vote, except that if a corporation has an organization as a member, the certificate or bylaws may provide that such organization shall be entitled to votes substantially proportionate to its membership.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>b</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide, either absolutely or contingently, that the members of any class are not entitled to vote or may otherwise limit or define the voting powers of the members or the respective classes of members, but no such denial, limitation, or definition of voting rights will be effective unless at the time one or more classes of members, singly or in the aggregate, are entitled to full voting rights.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>c</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Whenever any corporate action, other than the election of directors, is to be taken by vote of the members, it must, except as otherwise provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, the certificate of incorporation, or the bylaws, be authorized by a majority of the votes cast at a meeting of members by the members entitled to vote thereon.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>d</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Greater requirements as to quorum and votes of members than required by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>e</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Reservation to the members of the power to make, alter, and repeal bylaws.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>f</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Denial of right to vote by proxy.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>g</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Cumulative voting rights.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>h</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Transferability of membership in the corporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Authorization of initiation fees, dues, assessments, fines, and other penalties and provisions for the enforcement of their collection.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Right of directors to appoint committees to manage business affairs.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>7</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Qualifications of directors.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>8</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Provisions as to election or appointment of directors and their terms of office.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>9</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Restrictions on holding meetings of directors within or outside State of New York.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>10</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Quorum requirements as to directors.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>11</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Provision, if desired, that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board or that the President is authorized to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>12</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Number, time, and manner of choosing qualifications, term of office, official designations, powers, duties, and compensation of officers.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>13</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Appointment and authority of executive or other committees of directors.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>14</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Right of officers to be ex-officio members of board of directors.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Matter that is likely to be subject to frequent change should be placed in the bylaws because the certificate of incorporation can be amended by the membership only in compliance with statutory procedures. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="801 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;801 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3350 to 3499" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3350 to 3499</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="147 to 153" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;147 to 153</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>1.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;202(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>It is not necessary to set forth in the certificate of incorporation any of the corporate powers enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">N-PCL &sect;202</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>For complete discussion of powers, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="421">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;421</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>2.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601">N-PCL &sect;601</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="823">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;823</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>3.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation may have one or more classes of members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;601(a)</cite>. If a corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation and characteristics of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;601(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>If the corporation has members, membership may be effected and evidenced by: (1) signature on the certificate of incorporation; (2) designation in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws; (3) membership certificate or card or capital certificate; or (4) such method, including, but not limited to the foregoing, as is prescribed by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;601(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="823">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;823</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4a.</designator></name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="611" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;611(e)</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="916">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;916</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4b.</designator></name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="612">N-PCL &sect;612</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="916">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;916</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4c.</designator></name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="613" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;613(b)</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4d.</designator></name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="615" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;615(a)</cite>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="912">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;912</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4e.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;602(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602">N-PCL &sect;602</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="127">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;127</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4f.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>A member entitled to vote may vote in person or, unless the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws otherwise provide, by proxy executed in writing by the member or by that member&apos;s agent. A proxy will not be valid after 11 months from the date of its execution unless otherwise provided in the proxy. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="609" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;609(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="943 to 946" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;943 to 946</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4g.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="617">N-PCL &sect;617</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide that in all elections for directors every member entitled to vote will have the right to cumulate his or her vote and to give one candidate a number of votes equal to his or her vote multiplied by the number of directors to be elected or to distribute such votes on the same principle among as many candidates as he or she thinks fit. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="617">N-PCL &sect;617</cite>. The implication is that if cumulative voting is not provided for in either the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, it will not be permitted in directors&apos; elections.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="917">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;917</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>4h.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Membership certificates or cards are not transferable. If the certificate of incorporation or bylaws permits transfer of membership, upon each such transfer the certificate or card issued to a former member will be surrendered, and a new certificate or card will be issued to the new member. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;601(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>5.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated therein, a corporation may levy initiation fees, dues, and assessments on its members, whether or not they are voting members, and may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;507(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="828, 829" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;828, 829</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>6.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. To the extent provided in the resolution, or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="712" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;712(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="592 to 594" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;592 to 594</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>7.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or bylaws may prescribe qualifications for directors. A director must, however, be at least 18 years of age, except in the case of certain specified youth groups. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="701">N-PCL &sect;701</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="535">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;535</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>8.</designator></name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="703" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;703(b)</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="537, 541" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;537, 541</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>9.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Meetings of the board of directors may be held either within or outside the state, unless otherwise provided by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="710" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;710(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="595 to 607" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;595 to 607</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>10.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, a majority of the entire board of directors constitutes a quorum, provided that the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may fix the quorum at less than a majority of the entire board if, in the case of a board of 15 members or less, the quorum is at least one-third of the entire number of members, and, in the case of a board of more than 15 members, the quorum must be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction thereof) in excess of 15. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="707">N-PCL &sect;707</cite>. See <cite type="case">Desuzia v. Board of Directors of Concourse Village, Inc., 117 A.D.3d 426, 985 N.Y.S.2d 48 (1st Dep&apos;t 2014)</cite> stating that a supermajority quorum requirement may be imposed through corporate bylaws under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="605">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;605</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>11.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;713(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="531">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;531</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>12.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713">N-PCL &sect;713</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>A corporation may pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Payment of premiums by corporation on corporate officer&apos;s life insurance policy as affecting right to policy" volref="56" pageref="1086">Payment of premiums by corporation on corporate officer&apos;s life insurance policy as affecting right to policy, 56 A.L.R.3d 1086</cite> (secs. 3(a), 3(b) superseded in part by <cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr7" titlename="Construction and Application of &ldquo;Key Man&rdquo; Life Insurance" volref="12" pageref="Art. 6">Construction and Application of &ldquo;Key Man&rdquo; Life Insurance, 12 A.L.R.7th Art. 6</cite>).</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Test in stockholders&apos; actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation" volref="53" pageref="358">Test in stockholders&apos; actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation, 53 A.L.R.3d 358</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="531, 789" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;531, 789</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="ajpof2" titlename="Reasonableness of Corporate Officer&apos;s Compensation" volref="4" pageref="425">Reasonableness of Corporate Officer&apos;s Compensation, 4 Am. Jur. Proof of Facts 2d 425</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>13.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="712" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;712(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="592 to 594" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;592 to 594</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>14.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|60|30:56"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;713(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</check.list>
</section.body>

<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>(1)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|61|30:57"><para.text>Procedure.</para.text></para></list.item>

<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"><para.text>Statement that the agent is resigning as registered agent for the designating corporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"><para.text>The date the certificate of incorporation or the application for authority of the designating corporation was filed by the Department of State.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"><para.text>Statement that the agent has sent a copy of the certificate of resignation by registered mail to the designating corporation at the post office address on file in the Department of State specified for the mailing of process or, if such address is the address of the registered agent, then to the office of the designating corporation in the jurisdiction of its formation or incorporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"><para.text>Signature of resigning agent.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"><para.text>Date.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"><para.text>This checklist is based on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;305(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|63|30:59"><para.text>The certificate must be entitled &ldquo;Certificate of Resignation of Registered Agent of (Name of Designating Corporation) Under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305">Section 305 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.&rdquo;</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:60</designator><name>Checklist<sep/>Matters that must be included in a certificate of dissolution</name></outline.name.block>

<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Name of the corporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>If the name of the corporation has been changed, the name under which it was formed.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Date on which the corporation&apos;s certificate of incorporation was filed by the Department of State.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Name and address of each of the corporation&apos;s officers and directors.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Statement as to whether the corporation is a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Statement as to whether or not the corporation holds assets at the time of authorization of its plan of dissolution and distribution of assets as provided by statute which are legally required to be used for a particular purpose.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>7</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Statement that the corporation elects to dissolve.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>8</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Manner in which the dissolution was authorized.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>9</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Statement that the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets has been approved by the Attorney General or by a justice of the Supreme Court, if such approval is required.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>10</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Signature(s).</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>11</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>Date.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>This checklist is based on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1003" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1003(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>The certificate must be entitled &ldquo;Certificate of Dissolution of (Name of Corporation) Under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1003">Section 1003 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.&rdquo;</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3482">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3482</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1328 to 1336" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1328 to 1336</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Item</label><designator>8.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|64|30:60"><para.text>If the dissolution of the corporation is authorized by a vote of the directors and/or members of the corporation that is less than that ordinarily required by the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or any other applicable law, as permitted by statute, then the certificate of dissolution must so state. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1003" subref="(a)" pararef="(7)">N-PCL &sect;1003(a)(7)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</check.list>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:61</designator><name>Checklist<sep/>Matters that must be included in a certificate of surrender of authority by a foreign not-for-profit corporation</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CHK</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>Name of the foreign corporation as it appears on the index of names of existing domestic and authorized foreign corporations of any kind in the Department of State and the fictitious name the corporation has agreed to use in the State of New York pursuant to law.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>The jurisdiction of its incorporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>Date it was authorized to conduct activities in the State of New York.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>Statement that the corporation surrenders its authority to conduct activities in New York.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>Statement that the corporation revokes the authority of its registered agent, if any, previously designated and consents that process against it in any action or special proceeding may be served on the Secretary of State.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>A post office address within or without the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation that may be served on the Secretary of State. The corporation may include an email address to which the Secretary of State shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>7</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>Signature of an officer of or attorney-in-fact for the foreign corporation or a trustee, receiver, or other liquidator of the corporation.</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>8</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>Date.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>This checklist is based on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1311" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1311(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>The certificate must be entitled &ldquo;Certificate of Surrender of Authority of (Name of Corporation) Under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1311">Section 1311 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.&rdquo; <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1311" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1311(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>The Department of State will not file such certificate unless the consent of the state tax commission to the surrender of authority is attached thereto. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1311" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;1311(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|65|30:61"><para.text>The authority of the foreign corporation to conduct activities in New York will terminate on the filing by the Department of State of the certificate of surrender of authority. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1311" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;1311(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="223">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;223</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</check.list>

<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>1</designator><name>Proceedings Preliminary to Incorporation of an Existing Association; Corporate Name</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:62</designator><name>Notice of meeting to pass on resolution of incorporation</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5477b501b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-62_001">
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="1*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="19*"/>
<tbody>
<row><entry>To:</entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;name of member&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"><form.text>You are hereby notified that there will be a meeting of the members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr> at <inline.instr>&lsqb;address of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, for the purpose of voting on a resolution to incorporate the association as a not-for-profit corporation under the provisions of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="101 et seq." secrange="y">Sections 101 et seq. of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law</cite>. A copy of the resolution is attached to this notice.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: Any member unable to attend the above meeting in person may vote by proxy, in writing, dated and signed by such member, authorizing someone present at the meeting to cast the member&apos;s vote.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: Any member unable to attend the above meeting in person may vote by mail, provided such vote, in writing and signed by the member, is received at the above address not later than the time of the meeting.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of person issuing notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Attachments&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation of what was previous to incorporation an unincorporated not-for-profit association or group must have annexed thereto an affidavit of the subscribers of such certificate, stating that they constitute a majority of the members of a committee duly authorized to incorporate such association or group. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;402(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"><para.text>All members in good standing of an association have a legally enforceable right to attend the meetings of the society and participate in its deliberations and decisions. <cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="18">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;18</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"><para.text>Notice of a meeting of a voluntary association must include the time, place, and object of the meeting. <cite type="case">Goller v. Stubenhaus, 77 Misc. 29, 134 N.Y.S. 1043 (Sup 1912)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|66|30:62"><para.text>Where the laws for the internal government of the association ordain the time or manner of giving notice, notice to members must be given as so prescribed. <cite type="case">In re Bandanza, 132 Misc. 817, 230 N.Y.S. 460 (Sup 1928)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Associations" numref="171">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Associations &key;171</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3374">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="18">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &sect;18</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Associations and Clubs" secref="17">Am. Jur. 2d, Associations and Clubs &dblsect;17</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>

<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|67|30:63"><form.text>Resolved that the <inline.instr>&lsqb;President and secretary/members of the governing board&rsqb;</inline.instr> are authorized to incorporate this association, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of unincorporated association&rsqb;</inline.instr>, under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and, for that purpose, to execute and file with the Department of State the certificate of incorporation of the corporation to be formed.</form.text></form.para>

<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|67|30:63"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation of what was previous to incorporation an unincorporated not-for-profit association or group must have annexed thereto an affidavit of the subscribers of such certificate, stating that they constitute a majority of the members of a committee duly authorized to incorporate such association or group. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;402(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
