<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:66</designator><name>Request for extension of reservation of corporate name</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5483ea01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>REQUEST FOR EXTENSION OF RESERVATIONOF NAME</name></form.name.block>
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-66_001">
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="1*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="19*"/>
<tbody>
<row><entry>To:</entry><entry>Department of State, State of New York</entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"><form.text>I am the applicant named in the attached certificate of reservation issued by the Department of State on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of issue&rsqb;</inline.instr>, reserving the name <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> for use by the domestic not-for-profit corporation intended to be formed by the applicant.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"><form.text>I hereby request that the reservation be extended for an additional 60 days beyond the original expiration period that ends on <inline.instr>&lsqb;end date of expiration period&rsqb;</inline.instr>, pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(d)">Section 303(d) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, for the reason that <inline.instr>&lsqb;description of reason for extension&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"><form.text>No other request for extension has been filed by me.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of request&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of applicant&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of applicant&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Attachments&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"><para.text>The Secretary of State may extend the reservation of corporate name for additional periods of not more than 60 days each, upon the written request of the applicant, the applicant&apos;s attorney, or agent delivered to the Department of State, to be filed before the expiration of the reservation period then in effect. The request must have attached to it the certificate of reservation of name. No more than two such extensions will be granted. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;303(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|70|30:66"><para.text>The request for extension of reservation of corporation name must be signed by the original applicant, the applicant&apos;s attorney, or his or her agent. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(f)">N-PCL &sect;303(f)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3382">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3382</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="161 to 163" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;161 to 163</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:67</designator><name>Request to cancel reservation of corporate name</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5488cc01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>REQUEST TO CANCEL RESERVATION OF NAME</name></form.name.block>
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-67_001">
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="1*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="19*"/>
<tbody>
<row><entry>To:</entry><entry>Department of State, State of New York</entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"><form.text>The undersigned is the applicant for reservation of the corporate name of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, as evidenced by the attached certificate of reservation issued to applicant on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of issue&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"><form.text>The reserved period will expire on <inline.instr>&lsqb;expiry date of period&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"><form.text>Pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(e)">Section 303(e) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, the undersigned hereby requests that the Department of State cancel the reservation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of request&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of applicant&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of applicant&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Attachments&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"><para.text>On the request of the applicant, delivered to the Department of State before the expiration of the reserved period, together with the certificate of reservation, the Department will cancel the reservation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;303(e)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|71|30:67"><para.text>The request to cancel the reservation of corporation name must be signed by the original applicant, the applicant&apos;s attorney, or his or her agent. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="303" subref="(f)">N-PCL &sect;303(f)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:68</designator><name>Certificate of incorporation</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>

</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id54901f01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CORPORATION&rsqb;</inline.instr> UNDER <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">SECTION 402 OF THE N.Y. NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW</cite></name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>We, the undersigned, acting as incorporators of a corporation under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, do hereby adopt the following Certificate of Incorporation for such corporation:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator><name>NAME</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The name of the corporation is <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator><name>NOT-FOR-PROFIT STATUS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>This corporation is a &ldquo;corporation&rdquo; as defined in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)" secref="102">Subparagraph (a)(5) of Section 102 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator><name>PURPOSES AND POWERS</name></name.block></head>
<item.selection.group type="choice">
<instruction>&lsqb;EITHER:&rsqb;</instruction>
<item.selection>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The <inline.instr>&lsqb;purpose/purposes&rsqb;</inline.instr> for which the corporation is formed <inline.instr>&lsqb;is/are&rsqb;</inline.instr>: <inline.instr>&lsqb;description of purposes as authorized under N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
</item.selection>
<instruction>&lsqb;OR:&rsqb;</instruction>
<item.selection>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The purpose for which the corporation is formed is any purpose for which corporations may be organized under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law as a <inline.instr>&lsqb;charitable/noncharitable&rsqb;</inline.instr> corporation.</form.text></form.para>
</item.selection>
</item.selection.group>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>In addition to the foregoing corporate purposes, the corporation shall have and exercise all of the general and special powers of corporations set forth in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">Section 202 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator><name>CORPORATE TYPE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The corporation is a <inline.instr>&lsqb;charitable/noncharitable&rsqb;</inline.instr> corporation under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">Section 201 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>V</designator><name>LOCATION OF CORPORATE OFFICE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The office of the corporation shall be located in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: The books and records of account kept by the corporation pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="621">Section 621 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite> shall be kept at an office outside the state, which office shall be located at &lsqb;address of office&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of city&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of state&rsqb; &lsqb;zip code of office&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VI</designator><name>INITIAL DIRECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The initial Board of Directors shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> in number, their names and addresses being as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;names of initial directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;addresses of initial directors&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VII</designator><name>DURATION</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The duration of this corporation shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;perpetual/from the date this certificate is filed by the Department of State until &lsqb;date of expiration&rsqb;/&lsqb;specification of time period&rsqb; from the date of filing of this certificate of incorporation/&lsqb;specification of duration of corporation&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VIII</designator><name>DESIGNATION OF SECRETARY OF STATE ASAGENT FOR SERVICE OF PROCESS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The corporation designates the Secretary of State of the State of New York as its agent upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address of the corporation <inline.instr>&lsqb;within/outside&rsqb;</inline.instr> the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served upon the Secretary of State is as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;mailing address of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr> <inline.instr>&lsqb;zip code of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: The email address to which the Secretary of State shall email a notice of the fact that process against the corporation has been served electronically upon the Secretary of State is: <inline.instr>&lsqb;email address of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IX</designator><name>DESIGNATION OF REGISTERED AGENT FORSERVICE OF PROCESS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: The corporation additionally designates &lsqb;&lsqb;name of individual&rsqb;, whose post office address is &lsqb;post address of individual&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of city&rsqb;, State of New York &lsqb;zip code of individual&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;, &lsqb;incorporated under the laws of the State of New York/a foreign corporation authorized to do business in the State of New York&rsqb;, with offices at &lsqb;address of corporation&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of city&rsqb;, State of New York &lsqb;zip code of office&rsqb; as its agent upon whom process against it may be served&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>X</designator><name>ADDITIONAL PROVISIONS FOR SPECIAL NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATIONS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: &lsqb;Specification of additional provisions&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XI</designator><name>APPROVALS AND CONSENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text>The corporation <inline.instr>&lsqb;is/is not&rsqb;</inline.instr> formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring the consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body. <inline.instr>&lsqb;No consent or approval is required/Such consent or approval is attached&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XII</designator><name>ADDITIONAL PROVISIONS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: &lsqb;List of additional provisions&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of certificate of incorporation&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Names of incorporators&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Addresses of incorporators&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Acknowledgments&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>The fee for filing a certificate of incorporation, which is subject to change, is &dollar;75. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104-A" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;104-A(e)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation must be signed by each incorporator with his or her name and address included in the certificate and delivered to the Department of State. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>If the certificate of incorporation is for the incorporation of an existing unincorporated association or group, it must have attached to it an affidavit of the subscribers of the certificate stating that they constitute a majority of the members of the committee duly authorized to incorporate the association or group. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;402(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>For discussion of certificate of incorporation, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:68 et seq." secrange="y">&dblsect;30:68 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>For checklists of matters that must and matters that may be included in the certificate, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:55 to 30:57" secrange="y">&dblsect;30:55 to 30:57</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>For form of affidavit of subscribers of the certificate that they constitute a majority of the members of the committee authorized to incorporate the association or group, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:73">&sect;30:73</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3370 to 3379" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301">N-PCL &sect;301</cite> sets out the general rules governing the requirements for corporate names for nonprofit corporations.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="164 to 176" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;164 to 176</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>A corporation may be formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for any one or more of the purposes specified in the Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>It is not necessary to set forth in the certificate of incorporation any of the corporate powers enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">N-PCL &sect;202</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="57, 58, 421" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58, 421</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>Prior to its amendment, four types of not-for-profit corporations, Types A, B, C and D, were provided for. These four types have been replaced with two types, charitable and noncharitable.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>A corporation formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. A type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation. A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>For complete discussion of types of not-for-profit corporations, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VI.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>The board of directors of a not-for-profit corporation must consist of three or more directors; the initial number of directors is implied by the listing of names and addresses of the initial directors in the certificate of incorporation. Thereafter, the number (never less than three) may be fixed by the bylaws or, in the case of a corporation having members, by action of the members or of the board under the specific provisions of a bylaw adopted by the members. If not otherwise fixed, the number of directors will be three. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="702" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;702(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VIII.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>The Secretary of State is the agent of every domestic corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="304" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;304(a)</cite>. Additionally, the certificate of incorporation must contain a designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process and provide therein a post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State. The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(6)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(6)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71, 1062" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;71, 1062</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IX.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation is not required to have a registered agent, inasmuch as the statute is couched in permissive language. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;305(a)</cite>. In any event, however, the Secretary of State will be the agent for service of process against the corporation (see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="304" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;304(a)</cite>) and must be designated as such in the certificate of incorporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(7)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(7)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>The corporation&apos;s registered agent is the person upon whom process against the corporation may be served and who shall deliver to the corporation all process, notices, or demands received by the agent as agent for the corporation. The registered agent must be: (1) a natural person who is a resident of or has a business address in the State of New York; or (2) a domestic corporation or a foreign corporation of any type or kind formed or authorized to conduct business in the State of New York under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or other state statute. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;305(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>For the procedure for serving process on a registered agent, see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="306">N-PCL &sect;306</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>The designation of a registered agent may be made, revoked, or changed as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;305(b)</cite>. This means that the designation may only be made in the certificate of incorporation and that any designation (if the corporation made no designation in its original certificate of incorporation), change, or revocation must be made by amending the certificate. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="801" subref="(b)" pararef="(8)">N-PCL &dblsect;801(b)(8)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">802(c)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XII.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert: (1) for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation; or (2) as required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate of incorporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;402(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|74|30:68"><para.text>The additional provisions should regulate the internal affairs of the corporation, such as the types or classes of membership or the distribution of assets for different purposes (e.g. for dissolution, final liquidation, or as required by government officials or entities as a requirement for filing a certificate of incorporation). The provisions need to be consistent with the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law and other applicable state statutes and regulations.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71, 72" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;71, 72</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>

<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id54929001b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<image.block ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|75|30:69">

<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|75|30:69"><para.text>The above form, revised 12/22, is available from the New York State Department of State, <cite type="url" normalpub="webref">http://www.dos.ny.gov</cite>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3374">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:69.50</designator><name>Certificate of incorporation<sep/>Previously unincorporated association</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.name.block><name>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CORPORATION&rsqb;</inline.instr> UNDER &sect;402 OF THE NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK</name></form.name.block>
<form.para><form.text>We, the undersigned, being each natural persons of eighteen years or over, desiring to form a corporation pursuant to the provisions of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York, hereby certify:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>FIRST:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The name of the corporation is <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> (hereinafter, the &ldquo;Corporation&rdquo;).</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>SECOND:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The Corporation is a not-for-profit corporation as defined in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">Section 102(a)(5) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>THIRD:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The corporation is a charitable corporation under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">Section 201 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>FOURTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The Corporation is not formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring the consent or approval of any New York State official, department, board, agency, or other body and, accordingly, no consent or approval is required.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>FIFTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The principal office of the Corporation will be located in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr> County, New York.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>SIXTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The purposes for which the Corporation is to be formed are for charitable purposes within the meaning of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)" date="1986">Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986</cite> as amended (the &ldquo;Code&rdquo;). The more specific and primary purposes for which this Corporation is formed are:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>To engage in charitable fundraising for the purposes of collaboration and to develop and promote the educational purposes of cultivating knowledge of <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of topic&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>To exercise all the powers and privileges and to perform all of the duties and obligations of the Corporation as set forth in the Corporation&apos;s Bylaws, including all of the general powers set forth in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">Section 202 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, together with the power to solicit and receive grants, bequests and contributions for these stated purposes.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>To make and perform any contracts and do any other acts and things through the exercise of any power suitable, convenient, proper, or incidental for the accomplishment of any of the powers enumerated herein or in the said Bylaws, including to fix, levy, collect and enforce payment by any lawful means of any charges or assessments imposed pursuant to the terms of the Bylaws, and to pay all expenses in connection therewith, including all office and other expenses incident to the conduct of the business of the Corporation, and to do any other act or thing incidental to or connected with the foregoing purposes, or in the advancement thereof, but not for the pecuniary profit or financial gain of its members, directors, or officers except as permitted under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" artref="5">Article 5 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>SEVENTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The Corporation has not been formed for pecuniary profit or financial gain, and no part of the assets, income, or profit of the Corporation is distributable to, or inures to the benefit of, its directors, officers, or members except to the extent permitted under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. Notwithstanding any of the provision of this Certificate of Incorporation, the Corporation shall not conduct activities not permitted to be carried on: (i) by a corporation exempt from federal income tax under Section 501(c)(3) of the Code; or (ii) by a corporation, contributions to which are deductible under Section 170(c)(2) of the Code; or (iii) any activities prohibited by Section 501(c)(3) of the Code, and no substantial part of the activities of the corporation shall be carrying on propaganda, or otherwise attempting to influence legislation (except as otherwise provided by <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(h)">Internal Revenue Code Section 501(h)</cite>) or participating in, or intervening in (including the publication or distribution of statements), any political campaign on behalf of any candidate for public office.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>EIGHTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Upon the winding up and dissolution of the Corporation, the assets of the Corporation remaining after payment of, or provision for payment of, all debts and liabilities of the Corporation shall be distributed to an organization or organizations recognized as exempt under Section 501(c)(3) of the Code.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>NINTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>No part of the net earnings of the Corporation shall inure to the benefit of any member, trustee, director, officer of the Corporation, or any private individual, except that reasonable compensation may be paid for services rendered. No such member, trustee, director or officer of the Corporation, nor any private individual, shall be entitled to share in the distribution of any of the corporate assets upon dissolution of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>TENTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The Corporation shall have members, the qualifications, terms, and rights of which shall be set by the Bylaws of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>ELEVENTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The Corporation shall be managed and operated by a board of directors, the number of which is to be no less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;minimum number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr>, elected as set forth in the Bylaws and in a number as set in accordance with the requirements of the Bylaws of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>TWELFTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The names and addresses of the initial directors are: <inline.instr>&lsqb;names and addresses of initial directors&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>THIRTEENTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The duration of the Corporation shall be perpetual.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>FOURTEENTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The Secretary of State of the State of New York is hereby designated the agent of the Corporation upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address to which the Secretary of State shall mail a copy of any process against the Corporation served upon him or her as agent of the Corporation is: <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of post office address&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>FIFTEENTH:</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>The directors, officers, and members of the Corporation shall be indemnified by the Corporation to the fullest extent permitted by law, but not in any manner not permitted by, nor prohibited by, applicable law. More specifically, but not in limitation of the foregoing:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>General Rights and Duties of Defense and Indemnity. No director, officer, or member of the Corporation shall be personally liable to the Corporation or its members for damages for any breach of duty in such capacity unless said breach of duty, whether an act or omission, is found by judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction (or by other adjudication) to have been committed in bad faith or to have involved intentional misconduct or knowing violation of the law, or that the person charged personally gained a financial profit or other advantage to which such person was not legally entitled, or that the such person&apos;s act(s) or omission(s) materially or criminally violated the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York. Each person who serves as a director, officer, or member of the Corporation while this Article is in effect shall be deemed to be doing so in reliance on the provisions of this Article, and neither the amendment or repeal of this Article, nor the adoption of any Bylaw inconsistent with this Article, shall apply to or have any effect on the liability or alleged liability of any such director, officer, or member for, arising out of, based upon, or in connection with any acts or omissions of such person occurring prior to the amendment, repeal, or adoption of any inconsistent provision. The provisions of this Article are cumulative and shall be in addition to and independent of any and all other limitations upon, or eliminations of, the liabilities of directors, officers, and members of the Corporation, as such, whether such limitations or eliminations arise under or are created by any law, rule, regulation, bylaw, agreement, vote of members or disinterested directors, or otherwise. The Corporation shall also indemnify, to the fullest extent now or hereafter provided for or permitted by law, each person involved in or made or threatened to be made a party to any action, suit, claim, proceeding, arbitration, alternative dispute resolution mechanism, investigation, administrative or legislative hearing, or any other actual, threatened, pending or completed proceeding, whether civil, administrative, or criminal, or whether formal or informal, and including an action by or in the right of the Corporation or any other corporation, partnership, joint venture, trust, employee benefit plan or other enterprise, whether profit or non-profit (any such entity, other than the Corporation, being hereinafter referred to as an &ldquo;Enterprise&rdquo;), and further including all appeals therein (any such process and all appeals being hereafter referred to as a &ldquo;Proceeding&rdquo;), by reason of the fact that such person, or such person&apos;s testator or intestate, is or was a director, officer, or member of the Corporation, or while so serving such person acted in an official capacity as a director, officer, or member in any other Enterprise, as against any and all judgments, fines, costs, penalties, amounts paid in settlement and expenses, including attorneys&apos; fees, as are actually and reasonably incurred as a result of or in connection with any Proceeding, except as may be limited or otherwise so provided below.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Specific Rules for Derivative Actions. The Corporation, by virtue of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="722">Section 722 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation law</cite>, shall indemnify any person made party to an action by or in the right of the Corporation to procure a judgment in its favor by reason of the fact that such person, or such person&apos;s testator or intestate, is or was a director, officer, or member of the Corporation, against the reasonable expenses, including attorneys&apos; fees, actually and necessarily incurred by any such person in connection with the defense of such action, or in connection with an appeal therein, except in relation to matters as to which such director, officer, or member is adjudged to have breached such person&apos;s duty to the Corporation under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="717">Section 717 of the Not-for Profit Corporation Law</cite>. Such indemnification shall in no case include amounts paid in settling or otherwise disposing of a threatened action, or a pending action with or without court approval, or expenses incurred in defending a threatened action, or a pending action which is settled or otherwise disposed of without court approval.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Interpretations and Intent of Provisions. Whenever a defense or indemnity is claimed by any person and this Certificate of Incorporation references a breach of duty, commission of a breach in bad faith, intentional misconduct, a knowing violation of law, or a personal gain for which there was no legal entitlement, it shall be a defense by the claimant that while a director, officer, or member, such person acted in good faith for a purpose that such person reasonably believed to be in the best interests of the Corporation or that such person had no reasonable cause to believe that their conduct was unlawful. The termination of any action or proceeding by judgment, settlement, conviction, or upon a plea of <ital>nolo contendere</ital>, or its equivalent, shall not in itself create a presumption that any such director, officer, or member did not act in good faith or for a purpose that was reasonably believed to be in the best interests of the Corporation, or that such person had reasonable cause to believe that the applicable conduct was unlawful. It is the intent of this Article to require the Corporation to indemnify the persons referred to herein for the aforementioned judgments, fines, penalties, amounts paid in settlement, etc., whenever such indemnification could lawfully be permitted by express provisions of a Certificate of Incorporation, and the indemnification required by this Article shall not be limited by the absence of an express recital of such circumstances. In making any determination regarding any person&apos;s entitlement to indemnification hereunder it shall be presumed that such person is entitled to indemnification and the Corporation shall have the burden of proving the contrary.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Insurance and Agreements. The Corporation may, with the approval of the Board of Directors, enter into an agreement with any person who is, or is about to become, a director, officer, member, employee, or agent of the Corporation, or who is serving, or is about to serve at the request of the Corporation as such in any Enterprise, and such agreement may provide for indemnification of such person and advancement of expenses to such person upon terms, and to the extent, not prohibited by law. The failure to enter into any such agreement shall not affect or limit the rights of any such person under this Article.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(e)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Non-exclusivity. The provisions of this Article shall not be exclusive and shall include, by implication, any and all rights and remedies available to the Corporation, the directors, officers, and members by statute or otherwise, including but not limited to the purchase and maintenance of insurance to fund the aforementioned indemnification pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="726">Section 726 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(f)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Limitations and Procedure. In limitation of the foregoing, no act or omission of any director, officer, or member, to the extent it provides any benefit to said director, officer, or member, shall be defended or indemnified by or at the expense of the Corporation whenever the limitations and restrictions of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or &sect;501(c)(3) of the Code shall prohibit such defense or indemnity. Further, no indemnification shall be made to or on behalf of any such person if a judgment or other final adjudication adverse to such person establishes that such person&apos;s acts were material to the cause of action so adjudicated and: (i) committed in bad faith; or (ii) the result of active and deliberate dishonesty; or (iii) such person personally gained in fact a financial profit or other advantage to which such person was not legally entitled. In addition, no indemnification shall be made with respect to any Proceeding initiated by any person against the Corporation or any other director, officer, or member thereof, other than to enforce the terms of this Article, unless such Proceeding was authorized by the Board of Directors. Further, no indemnification shall be made with respect to any settlement or compromise of any Proceeding unless and until the Corporation has consented to such settlement or compromise. Written notice of any Proceeding for which indemnification may be sought by any person shall be given to the Corporation as soon as practicable; however, an individual&apos;s failure to provide such notice shall not relieve the Corporation of its indemnification obligations hereunder, except to the extent that the Corporation has been prejudiced by its failure to receive such notice in a timely manner. The Corporation shall then be permitted (but not required) to participate in the defense of any such proceeding or, unless conflicts of interest or position exist between such person and the Corporation in the conduct of such defense, to assume such defense. In the event that the Corporation assumes the defense of any such Proceeding, the legal counsel selected by the Corporation shall be deemed acceptable to such person, and after such an assumption the Corporation shall not be liable to such person for any legal or other expenses subsequently incurred unless such expenses have been expressly authorized by the Corporation. In the event that the Corporation participates in but does not assume the defense in a Proceeding, the person claiming indemnity may select counsel, subject to such person&apos;s duty to cooperate in good faith with the Corporation in respect of any common defense or common use of counsels, unless doing so would be inappropriate due to actual or potential differing interests between or among such parties.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit>
<form.para><form.text>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned incorporators, each being at least eighteen (18) years of age, have made, subscribed and caused to be acknowledged this Certificate of Incorporation this <inline.instr>&lsqb;ordinal number of day&rsqb;</inline.instr> day of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;identification of year&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Names of incorporators&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3374">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:70</designator><name>Certificate of incorporation<sep/>Previously unincorporated club incorporating as a social club</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id549c5401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CORPORATION&rsqb;</inline.instr> UNDER <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">SECTION 402 OF THE N.Y. NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW</cite></name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>We, the undersigned, acting as incorporators of a corporation under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, which corporation has previously operated as an unincorporated association under the name of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, do hereby adopt the following Certificate of Incorporation for such corporation:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator><name>NAME</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The name of the corporation is <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator><name>NOT-FOR-PROFIT STATUS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>This corporation is a &ldquo;corporation&rdquo; as defined in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)" secref="102">Subparagraph (a)(5) of Section 102 of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator><name>PURPOSES AND POWERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The specific and primary purpose for which this corporation is organized is to provide social and recreational facilities for its members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The general purposes for which this corporation is organized are: <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of general purposes for incorporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>This corporation shall have and exercise all rights and powers conferred upon not-for-profit corporations under the laws of the State of New York, generally, and specifically as provided in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">Section 202 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law</cite>, provided, however, that this corporation is not empowered to engage in any activity that in itself is not in furtherance of its purposes as set forth in subparagraphs (a) through (c) of this ARTICLE III.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator><name>CORPORATE TYPE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The corporation shall be a <inline.instr>&lsqb;charitable/noncharitable&rsqb;</inline.instr> corporation under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">Section 201 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>V</designator><name>LOCATION OF CORPORATE OFFICE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The office of the corporation shall be located in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, New York.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: The books and records of account kept by the corporation pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="621">Section 621 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite> shall be kept at an office outside the state, which office shall be located at &lsqb;address of office&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of city&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of state&rsqb;, &lsqb;zip code of office&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>

<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VII</designator><name>DURATION</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The duration of this corporation shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;perpetual/from the date this certificate is filed by the Department of State until &lsqb;date of expiration&rsqb;/&lsqb;specification of time period&rsqb; from the date of filing of this certificate of incorporation/&lsqb;specification of duration of corporation&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VIII</designator><name>DESIGNATION OF SECRETARY OF STATE ASAGENT FOR SERVICE OF PROCESS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The corporation designates the Secretary of State of the State of New York as its agent upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address of the corporation <inline.instr>&lsqb;within/outside&rsqb;</inline.instr> the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served upon the Secretary of State is as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;mailing address of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr> <inline.instr>&lsqb;zip code of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: The email address to which the Secretary of State shall email a notice of the fact that process against the corporation has been served electronically upon the Secretary of State is: <inline.instr>&lsqb;email address of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IX</designator><name>DESIGNATION OF REGISTERED AGENT FORSERVICE OF PROCESS<inline.instr>&lsqb;EITHER:&rsqb;</inline.instr></name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The corporation additionally designates &lsqb;name of individual&rsqb;, whose post office address is <inline.instr>&lsqb;post office address of individual&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York <inline.instr>&lsqb;zip code of individual&rsqb;</inline.instr> as its agent upon whom process against it may be served.<inline.instr>&lsqb;OR:&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The corporation additionally designates <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of other corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;incorporated under the laws of the State of New York/a foreign corporation authorized to do business in the State of New York&rsqb;</inline.instr>, with offices at <inline.instr>&lsqb;post office address of other corporation&apos;s office&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York <inline.instr>&lsqb;zip code of other corporation&apos;s office&rsqb;</inline.instr> as its agent upon whom process against it may be served.<inline.instr>&lsqb;OR:&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>No additional registered agent is designated for service of process. The Secretary of State of the State of New York, however, is the corporation&apos;s agent upon whom process against it may be served, as provided by ARTICLE VIII.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>X</designator><name>APPROVALS AND CONSENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The corporation <inline.instr>&lsqb;is/is not&rsqb;</inline.instr> formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring the consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body. <inline.instr>&lsqb;No consent or approval is required/Such consent or approval is attached&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XI</designator><name>MEMBERSHIP</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The authorized number, qualifications, and manner of admission of members of this corporation; the different classes of membership, if any; the property, voting, and other rights and privileges of members; the liability of members for dues and/or assessments and the method of collection of such dues and assessments; and the termination and transfer of membership <inline.instr>&lsqb;are as follows: &lsqb;specification of terms of membership&rsqb;/shall be as set forth in the bylaws of this corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XII</designator><name>MANAGEMENT OF CORPORATE AFFAIRS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The powers of this corporation shall be exercised, its properties controlled, and its affairs conducted by a board of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> directors. The number of directors provided for in this Certificate of Incorporation may be changed by a bylaw duly adopted by the members entitled to vote.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Election of Directors.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The method of electing directors shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;as follows: &lsqb;specification of method of election&rsqb;/as set forth in the bylaws&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Elective Officers.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The officers of this corporation shall be a President, a Vice President, a secretary, and a treasurer. Other offices and officers may be established or appointed by members of this corporation at any regular annual meeting or any special meeting of members called for such purpose. The qualifications, the time, and manner of electing or appointing the duties of, the terms of office of, and the manner of removing officers shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;as follows: &lsqb;specification of manner of election&rsqb;/as set forth in the bylaws&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Committees.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>This corporation shall have at least two <inline.instr>&lsqb;type of committees&rsqb;</inline.instr> committees, as follows: The <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of authority&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall elect annually, from its members, an executive committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of persons&rsqb;</inline.instr> persons and an admission committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of persons&rsqb;</inline.instr> persons. The powers and duties of these committees shall be as specified in the bylaws. Other committees and their powers and duties may be specified in the bylaws or may be appointed from time to time by the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of authority&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XIII</designator><name>INCOME FROM PUBLIC EVENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>If this <inline.instr>&lsqb;club/association/&lsqb;title of entity&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> holds any events in which members of the general public are invited to participate for a fee, the net proceeds, if any, attributable to such participation by nonmembers will be paid over to an organization that is exempt from federal income tax under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</cite> of <inline.instr>&lsqb;identification of year&rsqb;</inline.instr> on an annual basis, unless this corporation itself is a tax-exempt organization under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XIV</designator><name>BYLAWS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>Bylaws shall be hereafter adopted at the first meeting of the Board of Directors. Such bylaws may be amended or repealed, in whole or in part, by action of the Board of Directors or by the members at any regular or special meeting of the members called for such purpose. Any duly enacted amendments to the bylaws shall be binding on all members of this corporation, including those who may have voted against them.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XV</designator><name>AMENDMENT OF CERTIFICATE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>Amendments to this Certificate of Incorporation may be proposed by a resolution adopted by the Board of Directors and presented to a quorum of the members for their vote at an annual meeting or any special meeting called for such purpose. Amendments may be adopted by a vote of at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;two-thirds/&lsqb;number of voting members&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> of a quorum of members present and voting either in person or by proxy.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XVI</designator><name>DISSOLUTION</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>This corporation shall be dissolved and its affairs wound up <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of manner of voluntary dissolution&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text>The method of distribution of assets on dissolution shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;as follows &lsqb;specification of method of dissolution&rsqb;/as set forth in the bylaws&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XVII</designator><name>MISCELLANEOUS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;Text of additional provisions&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
