<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="301">N-PCL &sect;301</cite> sets out the general rules governing the requirements for corporate names for nonprofit corporations.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3374">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="164 to 176" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;164 to 176</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLES</label><designator>II and XIII.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>If the incorporated club wishes also to operate as an organization exempt from the payment of federal and state income taxes, it should be remembered that the tax exemption provided by <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(a)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(a)</cite> for organizations described in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(7)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(c)(7)</cite> applies only to clubs that are organized and operated exclusively for pleasure, recreation, and other nonprofitable purposes but does not apply to any club if any part of its net earnings inures to the benefit of any private shareholder. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="1.501(c)(7)-1" subref="(a)">26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(7)-1(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation is discussed in <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:68 et seq." secrange="y">&dblsect;30:68 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>Checklists of matters that must and may be included in the certificate of incorporation are set forth in <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:55, 30:56" secrange="y">&dblsect;30:55, 30:56</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>A corporation may be formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for any one or more of the purposes specified in the Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>It is not necessary to set forth in the certificate of incorporation any of the corporate powers enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">N-PCL &sect;202</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="57, 58, 421" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58, 421</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>Prior to its amendment, four types of not-for-profit corporations, Types A, B, C and D, were provided for. These four types have been replaced with two types, charitable and noncharitable.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>A corporation formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. A type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation. A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">N-PCL &sect;201</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>For complete discussion of types of not-for-profit corporations, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VI.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The board of directors of a not-for-profit corporation must consist of three or more directors; the initial number of directors is implied by the listing of names and addresses of the initial directors in the certificate of incorporation. Thereafter, the number (never less than three) may be fixed by the bylaws or, in the case of a corporation having members, by action of the members or of the board under the specific provisions of a bylaw adopted by the members. If not otherwise fixed, the number of directors will be three. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="702" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;702(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VIII.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The Secretary of State is the agent of every domestic corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="304" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;304(a)</cite>. Additionally, the certificate of incorporation must contain a designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process and provide therein a post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State. The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(6)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(6)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71, 1062" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;71, 1062</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IX.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation is not required to have a registered agent, inasmuch as the statute is couched in permissive language. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;305(a)</cite>. In any event, however, the Secretary of State will be the agent for service of process against the corporation (see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="304" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;304(a)</cite>) and must be designated as such in the certificate of incorporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(a)" pararef="(7)">N-PCL &sect;402(a)(7)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The corporation&apos;s registered agent is the person upon whom process against the corporation may be served and who shall deliver to the corporation all process, notices, or demands received by the agent as agent for the corporation. The registered agent must be: (1) a natural person who is a resident of or has a business address in the State of New York; or (2) a domestic corporation or a foreign corporation of any type or kind formed, or authorized to conduct business, in the State of New York, under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law or other state statute. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;305(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>For the procedure for serving process on a registered agent, see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="306">N-PCL &sect;306</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The designation of a registered agent may be made, revoked, or changed as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="305" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;305(b)</cite>. This means that the designation may only be made in the certificate of incorporation and that any designation (if the corporation made no designation in its original certificate of incorporation), change, or revocation must be made by amending the certificate. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="801" subref="(b)" pararef="(8)">N-PCL &dblsect;801(b)(8)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">802(c)(3)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1062, 1063" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XVI.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>A nonjudicial dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation must be initiated by the adoption by its board of directors of a plan for its dissolution and the distribution of its assets. This plan must implement any provision in the certificate of incorporation prescribing the distributive rights of its members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1001(a)</cite>. If the corporation is a charitable corporation and has no assets to distribute and no liabilities at the time of dissolution, the plan of dissolution must include a statement to that effect. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;1001(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>Upon adopting a plan of dissolution and distribution of assets, the board must submit it to a vote of the members. The plan must be approved at a meeting of members by two-thirds vote as provided by statute, provided, however, that if the corporation is a charitable corporation, other than a corporation incorporated pursuant to the law governing public cemetery corporations, the vote required by the corporation&apos;s board of directors for adoption of the plan of dissolution of such a corporation or by the corporation&apos;s members for the authorization thereof will be:</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>(1) In the case of a vote by the board of directors: (i) the number of directors required under the certificate of incorporation, bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any other applicable law; or (ii) if the number of directors actually holding office as such at the time of the vote to adopt the plan is less than the number required to constitute a quorum of directors under the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or any other applicable law, the remaining directors unanimously; and</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>(2) In the case of a vote by the members, (i) the number of members required under the certificate of incorporation, bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any other applicable law; or (ii) by the vote of members authorized by an order of the Supreme Court pursuant to statute permitting the corporation to dispense with the applicable quorum requirement. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1002(a)</cite>. If there are no members entitled to vote on the dissolution of the corporation, the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets is deemed authorized upon its adoption by the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;1002(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>Whenever a statute creating or authorizing the formation of a corporation requires approval by a governmental body or officer for the formation of such corporation, dissolution may not be authorized without the approval of such body or officer. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;1002(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The plan of dissolution and distribution of assets must have annexed thereto the approval of the Attorney General in the case of a charitable corporation and in the case of any noncharitable corporation which holds assets at the time of dissolution legally required to be used for a particular purpose. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(d)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &sect;1002(d)(1)</cite>. Application to the Attorney General for such approval is by verified petition, with the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets and certified copies of the consents prescribed by this provision annexed thereto. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(d)" pararef="(2)">N-PCL &sect;1002(d)(2)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>In lieu of the vote of members referred to above, nonjudicial dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation can be effected by written or electronic consent of the members without a meeting, as the statute states that whenever members may take action by vote, such action may be taken without a meeting on written or electronic consent of all the members entitled to vote thereon. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;614(a)</cite>. Written or electronic consent thus given by all members entitled to vote has the same effect as a unanimous vote of members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;614(b)</cite>. Moreover, when there are no members of record, such action may be taken on the written consent signed by a majority in interest of the subscribers for capital certificates whose subscriptions have been accepted or their successors in interest or, if no subscription has been accepted, on the written consent signed by the incorporator or a majority of the incorporators. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;614(c)</cite>. Under such circumstances, when there are two or more incorporators, if any dies or is for any reason unable to act, the other or others may act, but, if there is no incorporator able to act, any person for whom an incorporator was acting as agent may act in his or her stead, or, if such other person also dies or is for any reason unable to act, his or her legal representative may act. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;614(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law makes special provisions for the dissolution of an incorporated firefighter&apos;s benevolent association created by act of the legislature. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1013">N-PCL &sect;1013</cite>. Likewise, special statutory provisions exist for the dissolution of a Young Men&apos;s or a Young Women&apos;s Christian Association which ceases to carry out the objects set forth in its certificate of incorporation, according to the general rules of the national board of such associations, or abandons or discontinues for one year the use of any of its property for such objects. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1404" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;1404(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1328 to 1336" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1328 to 1336</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XVII.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;402(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|76|30:70"><para.text>The additional provisions should only be provisions required or permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for the regulations of the internal affairs of a corporation.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:71</designator><name>Certificate of incorporation<sep/>Alumni association</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id54a13601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CORPORATION&rsqb;</inline.instr> UNDER <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402">SECTION 402 OF THE N.Y. NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW</cite></name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>We, the undersigned, acting as incorporators of a corporation under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, do hereby adopt the following Certificate of Incorporation for such corporation:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator><name>NAME</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The name of the corporation is <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator><name>NOT-FOR-PROFIT STATUS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>This corporation is a &ldquo;corporation&rdquo; as defined in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)" secref="102">Subparagraph (a)(5) of Section 102 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator><name>PURPOSES AND POWERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The specific and primary purposes for which this corporation is organized are as follows:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>To unite the graduates of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of hospital&rsqb;</inline.instr> School of Nursing in order to promote the highest excellence in the science and art of nursing and to cultivate closer professional relationship and good fellowship among the graduates of the school.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>To advance the interest of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of hospital&rsqb;</inline.instr> School of Nursing in the expectation and hope of making it one of the foremost among institutions of its type in the United States.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>To cooperate with District No. <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of district&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state nurses&apos; association&rsqb;</inline.instr> and with the American Nurses Association in the promotion of the professional and educational enhancement of nursing.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>To extend aid to those in need and to provide for the care of sick members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(e)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>To create, manage, and control a fund, to be known as the &ldquo;Alumni Fund,&rdquo; and for that purpose acquire and hold real and personal property. The principal of such fund, or the income to be derived therefrom, may be transferred to the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of hospital&rsqb;</inline.instr> School of Nursing, or used for and applied to such object or objects connected with the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of hospital&rsqb;</inline.instr> School of Nursing as the alumni corporation shall direct.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(f)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>This corporation shall have and exercise all rights and powers conferred upon not-for-profit corporations under the laws of the State of New York, generally, and specifically as provided in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="202">Section 202 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, provided, however, that this corporation is not empowered to engage in any activity that in itself is not in furtherance of its purposes as set forth in subparagraphs (a) through (e) of this Article III.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator><name>CORPORATE TYPE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The corporation shall be a <inline.instr>&lsqb;charitable/noncharitable&rsqb;</inline.instr> corporation under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="201">Section 201 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>V</designator><name>LOCATION OF CORPORATE OFFICE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The office of the corporation shall be located in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, New York.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: The books and records of account kept by the corporation pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="621">Section 621 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite> shall be kept at an office outside the state, which office shall be located at &lsqb;address of office&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of city&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of state&rsqb; &lsqb;zip code of office&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VI</designator><name>INITIAL DIRECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The first Board of Directors shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> in number, their names and addresses being as follows:</form.text>
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-71_001">
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="1*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="1*"/>
<thead>
<row><entry>Names</entry><entry>Residential Addresses</entry></row>
</thead>
<tbody>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of director 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of director 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of director 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of director 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of director 3&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of director 3&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of director 4&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of director 4&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of director 5&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of director 5&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of director 6&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of director 6&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of director 7&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of director 7&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VII</designator><name>DURATION</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The duration of this corporation shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;perpetual/from the date this certificate is filed by the Department of State until &lsqb;date of expiration&rsqb;/&lsqb;specification of time period&rsqb; from the date of filing of this certificate of incorporation/&lsqb;specification of duration of corporation&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VIII</designator><name>DESIGNATION OF SECRETARY OF STATE ASGENT FOR SERVICE OF PROCESS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The corporation designates the Secretary of State of the State of New York as its agent upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address of the corporation <inline.instr>&lsqb;within/outside&rsqb;</inline.instr> the state to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served upon the Secretary of State is as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;mailing address of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr> <inline.instr>&lsqb;zip code of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: The email address to which the Secretary of State shall email a notice of the fact that process against the corporation has been served electronically upon the Secretary of State is: <inline.instr>&lsqb;email address of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IX</designator><name>DESIGNATION OF REGISTERED AGENT FORSERVICE OF PROCESS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: The corporation additionally designates &lsqb;&lsqb;name of individual&rsqb;, whose post office address is &lsqb;post office address of individual&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of city&rsqb;, State of New York &lsqb;zip code of individual&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;, incorporated under the laws of the State of New York/a foreign corporation authorized to do business in the State of New York, with offices at &lsqb;office address of foreign corporation&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of city&rsqb;, &lsqb;name of county&rsqb;, State of New York &lsqb;zip code of office&rsqb;&rsqb; as its agent upon whom process against it may be served.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>X</designator><name>APPROVALS AND CONSENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The corporation <inline.instr>&lsqb;is/is not&rsqb;</inline.instr> formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring the consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body. <inline.instr>&lsqb;No consent or approval is required/Such consent or approval is attached&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XI</designator><name>POWERS, DUTIES, AND PRIVILEGES OF MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The powers, duties, and privileges of the members of the corporation shall be such as are specified in the bylaws of the corporation. All provisions in this certificate of incorporation, or in the bylaws of the corporation, for the regulation and conduct of the affairs of the corporation and the qualifications for membership in the corporation are expressly intended to be in furtherance, and not in limitation or exclusion, of the powers conferred by statute.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XII</designator><name>ALUMNI FUND</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The Board of Directors shall have the custody and management of the Alumni Fund but shall not dispose of the whole or any part of the principal of any invested fund except as authorized by a two-thirds vote of the members of the corporation present at an annual meeting of such members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XIII</designator><name>BYLAWS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>Bylaws will be hereafter adopted at the first meeting of the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors of the corporation may adopt, alter, and repeal any bylaw, subject to the power of the members of the corporation to change or repeal same.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XIV</designator><name>AMENDMENT OF CERTIFICATE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>Amendments to this certificate of incorporation may be proposed by a resolution adopted by the Board of Directors and presented to a quorum of the members for their vote at an annual meeting or any special meeting called for such purpose. Amendments may be adopted by a vote of at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;two-thirds/&lsqb;number of voting members&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> of a quorum of members present and voting <inline.instr>&lsqb;either in person/by proxy&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XV</designator><name>DISSOLUTION</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>This corporation shall be dissolved and its affairs wound up <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of manner of voluntary dissolution&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text>The method of distribution of assets on dissolution shall be as set forth in the bylaws.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XVI</designator><name>MISCELLANEOUS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;List of additional provisions required or permitted to be set forth in certificate of incorporation by N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for regulation of internal affairs of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of certificate of incorporation&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of incorporator 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of incorporator 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of incorporator 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of incorporator 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of incorporator 3&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of incorporator 3&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Acknowledgments&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><para.text>Incorporating under a not-for-profit act does not automatically cause a corporation to be tax-exempt. It must also meet the Code requirements for exempt organizations, including those governing both the formal documents establishing the organization and the operational requirements for the organizations. Each organization must meet the specific requirements of the tax law that governs its type. Even if tax-exempt, a corporation is taxed on its unrelated business income.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><para.text>Alumni associations are exempt if they are organized to promote the welfare of the university, are operated as an integral part of the university, and are subject to the control of the university insofar as policies and disbursements are concerned. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-ruling" numref="60-143" volref="1960-1" reporter="C.B." volpg="192">Rev. Rul. 60-143, 1960-1 C.B. 192</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><para.text>The alumni of any college or university or of one or more colleges or schools of any university may be incorporated by executing and filing a certificate pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" artref="4">Article 4 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>. Such a corporation is considered a special not-for-profit corporation. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1407" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1407(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation is discussed in <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:68 et seq." secrange="y">&dblsect;30:68 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><para.text>Checklists of matters that must and may be included in the certificate of incorporation are set forth in <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:55, 30:56" secrange="y">&dblsect;30:55, 30:56</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3374">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="58">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;58</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Paragraph</label><designator>(e)</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><para.text>The power of an alumni corporation to create, manage, and control an alumni fund is set forth in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1407" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;1407(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>X.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><para.text>The section of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law that makes provision for alumni corporations set forth no requirements as to consents or approvals. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1407">N-PCL &sect;1407</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XII.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|77|30:71"><para.text>This provision is based on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1407" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;1407(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<section.body>
<form>
<form.name.block><name>Certificate and Affidavit of Executive Committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr></name></form.name.block>
<form.para><form.text>In accordance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">New York Not-for-Profit Law &sect;402(b)</cite>, the undersigneds, being all of the members of the Executive Committee of the unincorporated association known as <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of association&rsqb;</inline.instr>, execute this affidavit under penalty of perjury to confirm that we are and have been duly authorized to incorporate the association.</form.text></form.para>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of signature&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>

</item.selection>
</item.selection.group>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|78|30:72"><para.text>Every certificate or other instrument which is required under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law to be signed and delivered to the Department of State for filing shall, except as otherwise specified in the section providing for such certificate, be signed either by an officer, director, attorney-in-fact or duly authorized person. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;104(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|78|30:72"><para.text>The name and the capacity in which any person signs such certificate must be included in the certificate. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;104(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|78|30:72"><para.text>With respect to paragraph A in the foregoing form, note that written or electronic consent given by all the members entitled to vote thereon has the same effect as a unanimous vote of such members, and any certificate delivered to the Department of State, with respect to such authorization, must recite that the authorization was by unanimous written consent. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;614(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|79|30:73"><para.text>If the certificate of incorporation is for the incorporation of an existing unincorporated association or group, it must have attached to it an affidavit of the subscribers of the certificate stating that they constitute a majority of the members of the committee duly authorized to incorporate the association or group. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="402" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;402(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<outline.name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator><name>Purpose Clause for Particular Types of Social Clubs or Associations</name></outline.name.block>

<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:74</designator><name>Athletic club</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id54afdc01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|80|30:74"><form.text>The specific and primary purposes for which this club is formed are to promote and encourage all kinds of field and athletic sports; to promote and encourage the sport, pleasure, exercise, and recreation of its members; to establish and maintain an athletic club to provide for the enjoyment, entertainment, and physical improvement and fitness of its members; to promote sociability and friendship among its members; and to manage and conduct entertainments, excursions, and social meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|80|30:74"><para.text>For complete discussion of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|80|30:74"><para.text>For complete discussion of statement of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:40">&sect;30:40</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3373">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3373</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3450">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3450</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="57, 58" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:75</designator><name>Glider club</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id54b24d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"><form.text>The specific and primary purposes for which this club is formed are to promote and encourage interest in aviation and particularly motorless flight, soaring, and glider operation and all allied sciences for the benefit of members of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"><form.text>To purchase, lease, or otherwise acquire and own, use, and operate and sell or otherwise dispose of real and personal property, including but not limited to airplanes, gliders, sail planes, airports, hangars, and all other aircraft equipment and services for this equipment that may be incidental to the use and operation of the equipment, along with any other real or personal property or other facilities that may be required for the use of its members.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"><form.text>To do any other act or thing incidental to or connected with the foregoing purposes or in advancement of these purposes, but not for profit.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"><form.text>The enumeration of the specific purposes and powers in this statement of purpose does not limit or restrict the general powers of the Corporation and the enjoyment or exercise of these powers, as conferred by the laws of the State of New York upon corporations organized under the provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"><para.text>For complete discussion of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|81|30:75"><para.text>For complete discussion of statement of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:40">&sect;30:40</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<form uuid="Id54c84601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"><form.text>The <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of party&rsqb;</inline.instr> Party Central Committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, referred to below as the Committee, shall be the official body and representative of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of party&rsqb;</inline.instr> Party in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr> and shall perform the duties imposed on it by statute. The Committee is charged by law with the management and control of the Party campaigns in the county under the general direction of the State Central Committee of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of party&rsqb;</inline.instr> Party, and, to carry out that duty, the Committee shall do everything it considers necessary and desirable:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"><form.text>To seek, develop, and elect <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of party&rsqb;</inline.instr> Party candidates at every election;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"><form.text>To strengthen the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of party&rsqb;</inline.instr> Party in every way, particularly by establishing and supporting viable constituent organizations within each legislative district in the county by creating and maintaining official and permanent precinct and campaign organizations throughout the county, by maintaining proper liaison with the state central committee and with all recognized volunteer organizations in the county, and by making known the position of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of party&rsqb;</inline.instr> Party on national, state, and local issues, after proper consideration of national and state party platforms and policy, and on such other issues as the committee deems to be appropriate;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"><form.text>To maintain the official fund-raising organization for the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of party&rsqb;</inline.instr> Party within the county; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"><form.text>To perform other duties and services for the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of party&rsqb;</inline.instr> Party.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>

<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|88|30:82"><para.text>For complete discussion of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>

<section.body>
<form uuid="Id54e32101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|97|30:91"><form.text>The particular business and objects of this <inline.instr>&lsqb;club/association/&lsqb;type of entity&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> are the promotion of social intercourse between the representative members of the dramatic profession and of the kindred professions of literature, painting, sculpture, and music and the patrons of the arts; the creating of a library relating especially to the history of the American stage and the preservation of pictures, bills of the play, photographs, and curiosities connected with this history.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|97|30:91"><para.text>For complete discussion of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|97|30:91"><para.text>For complete discussion of statement of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:40">&sect;30:40</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:92</designator><name>Wildlife conservation society</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id54e59201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|98|30:92"><form.text>The specific and primary purposes for which this <inline.instr>&lsqb;society/&lsqb;type of entity&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> is formed are to dedicate itself by social and educational means to the conservation and propagation of the fish, game, and wildlife of the State of New York and throughout the United States of America; to support true sportsmanship in a lawful manner among those who hunt and fish; to promote and encourage field sports and good fellowship; to encourage support of the fish and game laws of the State of New York and of the nation; to work for the respect and acknowledgment of just rights of property owners; and to work for, support, and encourage a close relationship between property owners and sportsmen.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|98|30:92"><para.text>For complete discussion of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|98|30:92"><para.text>For complete discussion of statement of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:40">&sect;30:40</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|99|30:93"><form.text>The purposes for which this <inline.instr>&lsqb;club/association/&lsqb;type of entity&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> is formed are:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|99|30:93"><form.text>The furtherance of good fellowship;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|99|30:93"><form.text>The conservation and furtherance of the art and skill of fishing;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|99|30:93"><form.text>The promotion and encouragement of the highest standards of fishing, including bait casting, fly casting, and other forms of fishing;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|99|30:93"><form.text>To aid in the formulation and establishment of sound policies and practices designed to conserve, restore, protect, and safely regulate the natural resources of our continent;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(e)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|99|30:93"><form.text>To coordinate and stimulate the efforts of individuals and organizations interested in conservation and to interest and educate the people of this continent with respect to conservation; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(f)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|99|30:93"><form.text>To solicit, collect, and otherwise raise money or other property and distribute it as may be deemed best for the promotion of conservation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>

<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|100|30:94"><form.text>To aid in the protection of fish, birds, and game;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|100|30:94"><form.text>To promote and provide social and athletic recreation for its members;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|100|30:94"><form.text>To give and promote entertainments, lectures, social affairs, celebrations, exhibitions, games, and amusements of any and all descriptions for the general enjoyment and instruction of the members;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(e)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|100|30:94"><form.text>To provide shooting matches amongst its own members and members of other similarly constituted organizations for the benefit, enjoyment, instruction, and well-being of its members;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(f)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|100|30:94"><form.text>To establish and own shooting galleries and the necessary equipment for the same;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(g)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|100|30:94"><form.text>To purchase or lease and to maintain and operate buildings, club houses, or other structures as incidental to the above purposes; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(h)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|100|30:94"><form.text>To sell, lease, mortgage, or otherwise dispose of the same.</form.text></form.para></form.item>

<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:96.30</designator><name>Prevention of overbreeding of cats and dogs</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>

<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>

<section.body>
<form uuid="I0cf716803b7b11ee89ac8b38cb0993c7">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|103|30:96.30"><form.text>The purpose for which this non-profit <inline.instr>&lsqb;type of entity&rsqb;</inline.instr> is formed is to prevent cruelty to unwanted animals by preventing the overbreeding of cats and dogs by providing funds to pet owners who wish to have their pets spayed or neutered, but cannot afford the cost of such operations.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|103|30:96.30"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-ruling" numref="74-194" volref="1974-1" reporter="C.B." volpg="129">Rev. Rul. 74-194, 1974-1 C.B. 129</cite>, in which the I.R.S. approved the prevention of overbreeding as a purpose qualifying for tax exempt status.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|102|30:96"><para.text>For complete discussion of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|102|30:96"><para.text>For complete discussion of statement of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:40">&sect;30:40</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:96.50</designator><name>Provision of shelter to stray animals</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I0cf764a03b7b11ee89ac8b38cb0993c7">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|104|30:96.50"><form.text>The purpose for which this non-profit <inline.instr>&lsqb;type of entity&rsqb;</inline.instr> is formed is to prevent cruelty to unwanted animals by providing shelter and care for lost, stray and abandoned animals. This <inline.instr>&lsqb;type of entity&rsqb;</inline.instr> is not organized for the private gain of any person. The specific purposes for which this corporation is formed are exclusively charitable within the meaning of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">&sect;501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</cite>.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|104|30:96.50"><para.text>The New York Not-for-Profit Corporations Law specially defines corporation to exclude any purpose that is for pecuniary profit or financial gain, and prohibits use of corporate assets, income, or profit to benefit members, directors or officers (except to the extent otherwise permitted by statute). <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="102" subref="(a)" pararef="(5)">N-PCL &sect;102(a)(5)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|102|30:96"><para.text>For complete discussion of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|102|30:96"><para.text>For complete discussion of statement of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:40">&sect;30:40</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3373">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3373</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:24.50</designator><name>LGBT social club</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I9aa137003fa111e6b356a92de1b1c32a">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"><form.text>This association is formed for the purpose of providing its members who identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual or transexual (&ldquo;LGBT&rdquo;) a social gathering organization. This association will be authorized as follows:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>A</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"><form.text>To operate and manage the association to provide a support and educational organization for the LGBT community;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>B</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"><form.text>To organize social gathering for the association;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>C</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"><form.text>To organize public forums and gatherings to educate on LGBT issues;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>D</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"><form.text>To provide opportunities for networking for business and other purposes among LGBT members;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>E</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"><form.text>To plan weekend or other trips for the association members;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>F</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"><form.text>To raise funds and provide other support for the LGBT community; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>G</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|25|30:24.50"><form.text>To take any other action or provide any other support as the members deem proper and necessary.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|102|30:96"><para.text>For complete discussion of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:35">&sect;30:35</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|102|30:96"><para.text>For complete discussion of statement of purposes, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:40">&sect;30:40</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:97</designator><name>Bylaws<sep/>Social club</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id550a3101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>BYLAWS OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CLUB&rsqb;</inline.instr> A NEW YORK NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION</name></form.name.block>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of club&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l">State of New York</form.line>
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator><name>OFFICES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Principal Office.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The principal office of the club in the State of New York shall be located at <inline.instr>&lsqb;office address of club&rsqb;</inline.instr>, in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Other Offices.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The club may have such other offices, either within or outside <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York, as the board of trustees may determine or as the affairs of the club may require from time to time.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator><name>MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Classes of Membership.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The club shall have <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of classes&rsqb;</inline.instr> <inline.instr>&lsqb;class/classes&rsqb;</inline.instr> of members. The designation of such <inline.instr>&lsqb;class/classes&rsqb;</inline.instr> and the qualifications and rights of the members of such <inline.instr>&lsqb;class/classes&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall be as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of designation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of qualifications&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of rights of members&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Admission.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>An applicant will be admitted to membership in the club only on making application for such membership and on being elected by the board of directors. Applications for membership will be in such form as shall be prescribed by the board of directors. An affirmative vote of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the board of directors will be required for election.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Voting Rights.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Each member will be entitled to one vote on each matter submitted to a vote of the members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Suspension or Expulsion of Members.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>If a complaint against any member shall be signed by <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> other members and filed with the secretary, the secretary shall bring the matter to the notice of the board of directors within <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days of the date of the complaint. The board of directors shall then request an explanation from the accused member, and if the accused member fails to explain or, after a fair hearing, is unable to justify his or her conduct, the board of directors is empowered to inflict a fine or to pass a resolution suspending or expelling the accused member from the club <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: such resolution not to take effect until affirmed by a majority vote of the board of directors specially summoned to consider the resolution&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4(a)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Grounds for Suspension.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>A majority of the board of directors shall have power to suspend or expel members for willful infractions of the house rules or of any bylaw of the club, for acts or conduct that they may deem disorderly or injurious or hostile to the interests of the objects of the club, or for acts or conduct calculated to disturb the order, peace, or harmony of the club or to impair the good name of the club.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4(b)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Appeal by Member.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The offender may appeal from the sentence of suspension or expulsion, as provided in these bylaws.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4(b)(1)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Preliminary Notice and Hearing.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Prior to the expulsion or suspension of a member, the member shall be entitled to a notice and hearing before the board of directors or before a committee of the board of directors, whichever the accused member may elect.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4(b)(2)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Notice of Appeal.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>A member expelled or suspended from the club by determination of the board of directors may appeal such action within <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days after notice of the determination is posted on the bulletin board, by filing with the secretary a written notice of his or her appeal and the reasons supporting such appeal.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4(b)(3)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Time for Hearing Appeal.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>All appeals shall be heard at a meeting of the membership, to be called for that purpose by the board of directors, within <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days after notice of the appeal has been filed with the secretary.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4(b)(4)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Procedure.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The President or Vice President shall preside at such meetings, and the cause of suspension or expulsion shall be reported in writing by the board of directors, with a statement of facts on which their determination was founded, a copy of which will be furnished to the appellant at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days before the meeting, at which time a copy of the determination shall also be filed with the secretary. At the appeal meeting, the appellant shall present his or her defense in writing, to which one member of the board of directors may reply orally. The appellant or any one member in the appellant&apos;s behalf may then answer orally, and a director may speak in support of the charge; thereafter, no further discussion will be allowed.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4(b)(5)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Disposition of Appeal.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The presiding officer shall then put the question to the membership, as follows: &ldquo;Shall the determination of the board of directors in this case be affirmed?&rdquo; If a majority of those present vote in the affirmative, the determination will stand as the final judgment of the club. If less than a majority of those present vote in the affirmative, then the determination of the board of directors will be reversed and the appellant will be immediately restored to full membership rights and privileges, and the board of directors shall be precluded from again suspending or expelling the member for the same offense based on the same facts and occurring at the same time and place as alleged in the original complaint.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Resignation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Any member may resign by filing a written resignation with the secretary, but such resignation shall not relieve the member so resigning of the obligation to pay any dues, assessments, or other charges theretofore accrued and unpaid.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.6</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Reinstatement.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>On written request signed by a former member and filed with the secretary, the board of directors may, by the affirmative vote of two-thirds of the members of the board, reinstate such former member to membership on such terms as the board of directors may deem appropriate.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.7</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Transfer of Membership.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Membership in this club <inline.instr>&lsqb;is/is not&rsqb;</inline.instr> <inline.instr>&lsqb;transferable/assignable&rsqb;</inline.instr>. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: However, no such transfer is valid unless the proposed transfer is submitted to the board of directors in writing and is approved by a majority vote of the entire board. No such transfer shall become effective until the secretary of the club is notified of the transfer in writing. The secretary must then record the transfer in the membership book. In no event, however, shall membership certificates issued by the club be transferable. Upon transfer of membership, the transferring member shall surrender his or her membership certificate, and a new certificate shall be issued to the transferee.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.8</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Termination of Membership.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Membership will terminate on the death or resignation of a member, the transfer of his or her membership in accordance with these bylaws, or on the member&apos;s expulsion by the board of directors. Upon such termination, any right, title, or interest of the member in or to the property and assets of the club will cease.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator><name>MEETINGS OF MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Annual Meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>An annual meeting of the members shall be held on the <inline.instr>&lsqb;ordinal number of day&rsqb;</inline.instr> day in the month of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> in each year, at the hour of <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of annual meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, for the purpose of electing directors and for the transaction of such other business as may come before the meeting. If the day fixed for the annual meeting shall be a legal holiday in the State of New York, such meeting shall be held on the next succeeding business day. If the election of directors shall not be held on the day designated in these bylaws for any annual meeting or at any adjournment thereof, the board of directors shall cause the election to be held at a special meeting of the members as soon thereafter as is convenient.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Special Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Special meetings of the members may be called by the President, a majority of the board of directors, or not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;fraction of votes&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the members having voting rights.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Place of Meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The board of directors may designate any place, either within or outside the State of New York, as the place of meeting for any annual meeting or for any special meeting called by the board of directors. If no designation is made or if a special meeting be otherwise called, the place of meeting shall be the registered office of the club in the State of New York. However, if all of the members shall meet at any time and place, either within or outside the State of New York, and consent to the holding of a meeting, such meeting shall be valid without call or notice, and at such meeting any corporate action may be taken.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
