<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Notice of Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Written or printed notice stating the place, day, and hour of any meeting of members shall be delivered, either personally or by mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting, not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> nor more than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days before the date of such meeting, or in the case of a removal of one or more directors, a merger, consolidation, dissolution, or sale, lease, or exchange of assets not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> nor more than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days before the date of such meeting, by or at the direction of the President, the secretary, or the officers or persons calling the meeting. In case of a special meeting or when required by statute or by these bylaws, the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called shall be stated in the notice. If mailed, the notice of a meeting shall be deemed to be delivered when deposited in the United States mail addressed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the records of the club, with postage prepaid.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Informal Action by Members.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Any action required by law to be taken at a meeting of the members or any action that may be taken at a meeting of members may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing, setting forth the action to be taken, shall be signed by all of the members entitled to vote with respect to the subject matter thereof.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.6</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Quorum.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The members holding <inline.instr>&lsqb;percentage of votes&rsqb;</inline.instr>&percnt; of the votes that may be cast at any meeting shall constitute a quorum at such meeting. If a quorum is not present at any meeting of members, a majority of the members present may adjourn the meeting from time to time without further notice.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.7</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Proxies.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>At any meeting of members, a member entitled to vote may vote by proxy executed in writing by the member or by his or her authorized attorney in fact. No proxy shall be valid after <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of time period&rsqb;</inline.instr> from the date of its execution, unless otherwise provided in the proxy.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.8</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Voting by Mail.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Where directors are to be elected by members, such election may be conducted by mail in such manner as the board of directors shall determine.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.9</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Cumulative Voting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>At any election for directors of the club, each and every member entitled to vote may cumulate his or her vote by giving one candidate as many votes as the number of such directors multiplied by his or her vote shall equal or by distributing such votes on the same principle among any number of such candidates. Any member who intends to cumulate his or her votes shall give written notice of such intention to the secretary of the club on or before the day preceding the election at which such member intends to cumulate his or her votes.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator><name>BOARD OF DIRECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>General Powers.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The affairs of the club shall be managed by its board of directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Number, Tenure, and Qualifications.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The number of directors shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr>. Directors shall be elected at each annual meeting of members, and each director shall hold office until the next annual meeting of members and until his or her successor shall have been elected and qualified. Directors <inline.instr>&lsqb;must/need not&rsqb;</inline.instr> be members of the club.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Regular Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;The board of directors shall hold regular meetings at least once a month on such date and at such hour as may, from time to time, be agreed upon/A regular annual meeting of the board of directors shall be held without other notice than this bylaw, immediately after, and at the same place, as the annual meeting of members&rsqb;</inline.instr>. The board of directors may provide by resolution the time and place, either within or outside the State of New York, for the holding of additional regular meetings of the board without other notice than such resolution.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Special Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Special meetings of the board of directors may be called by or at the request of the President or any <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> directors. The person or persons authorized to call special meetings of the board may fix any place, either within or outside the state, as the place for holding any special meeting of the board called by them.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Telephone Conference Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Any or all directors may participate in a meeting of the board or a committee of the board by means of conference telephone or any means of communication by which all persons participating in the meeting are able to hear each other.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.6</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Notice.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Notice of any special meeting of the board of directors shall be given at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of time period&rsqb;</inline.instr> prior to such meeting by written notice delivered personally or sent by mail or telegram to each director at his or her address as shown by the records of the club. If mailed, such notice shall be deemed to be delivered when deposited in the United States mail in a sealed envelope so addressed, with postage prepaid. If notice be given by telegram, such notice shall be deemed to be delivered when the telegram is delivered to the telegraph company. Any director may waive notice of any meeting. The attendance of a director at any meeting will constitute a waiver of notice of such meeting, except where a director attends a meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business because the meeting is not lawfully called or convened. The business to be transacted at the meeting need not be specified in the notice or waiver of notice of such meeting, unless specifically required by law or by these bylaws.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.7</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Quorum.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>A majority of the board of directors shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at any meeting of the board, but, if less than a majority of the directors are present at the meeting, a majority of the directors present may adjourn the meeting from time to time without further notice.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.8</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Manner of Acting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The act of a majority of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present shall be the act of the board of directors, unless the act of a greater number is required by law or by these bylaws.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.10</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Vacancies.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Any vacancy occurring in the board of directors shall be filled by the affirmative vote of a majority of the remaining directors though less than a quorum of the board of directors. A director elected to fill a vacancy shall hold office until the next annual meeting at which the election of directors is in the regular order of business and until his or her successor is elected or appointed and qualified.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Any directorship to be filled by reason of an increase in the number of directors shall be filled by election at an annual meeting or at a special meeting of members called for that purpose. If no members have the right to vote, the directorship shall be filled by <inline.instr>&lsqb;description of procedure of filling up vacancy&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.11</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Compensation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;The board of directors, by the affirmative vote of a majority of the directors then in office, shall have the authority to establish reasonable compensation of all directors for services to the club as directors, officers, or otherwise/Directors as such shall not receive any stated salaries for their services as directors, but, by resolution of the board of directors, a fixed sum and expenses of attendance, if any, may be allowed for attendance at such regular and special meetings of the board; but nothing in these bylaws shall be construed to preclude any director from serving the club in any other capacity and receiving compensation for such service/Directors as such shall not receive any stated salaries for their services, but&rsqb;</inline.instr> by resolution of the board of directors, any director may be indemnified for expenses and costs, including attorney&apos;s fees, actually and necessarily incurred in connection with any claim asserted against that director, by action in court or otherwise, by reason of his or her being or having been such director, except in relation to matters as to which he or she shall have been guilty of negligence or misconduct in respect of the matter in which indemnity is sought.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>V</designator><name>OFFICERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Officers.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The officers of the club shall be a President, one or more Vice Presidents (the number to be determined by the board of directors), a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as may be elected in accordance with the provisions of this article. The board of directors may elect or appoint such other officers, including one or more assistant secretaries and one or more assistant treasurers, as it shall deem desirable, such officers to have the authority and to perform the duties prescribed, from time to time, by the board of directors. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, provided that no officer shall execute, acknowledge, or verify any instrument in more than one capacity if the instrument is required by law or by these bylaws to be executed, acknowledged, or verified by two or more officers.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Election and Term of Office.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The officers of the club shall be elected annually by the board of directors at the regular annual meeting of the board of directors. If the election of officers shall not be held at such meeting, such election shall be held as soon thereafter as is convenient. New offices may be created and filled at any meeting of the board of directors. Each officer shall hold office until his or her successor shall have been elected and qualified.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Removal.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Any officer elected or appointed by the board of directors may be removed by the board of directors whenever in its judgment the best interests of the club would be served thereby, but such removal shall be without prejudice to the contract rights, if any, of the officer so removed.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Vacancies.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>A vacancy in any office because of death, resignation, removal, disqualification, or otherwise may be filled by the board of directors for the unexpired portion of the term.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>President.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The President shall be the principal executive officer of the club and shall, in general, supervise and control all of the business and affairs of the club. The President shall preside at all meetings of the members and of the board of directors. The President may sign, with the secretary or any other proper officer of the club authorized by the board of directors, any deeds, mortgages, bonds, contracts, or other instruments that the board of directors have authorized to be executed, except in cases where the signing and execution thereof shall be expressly delegated by the board of directors or by these bylaws or by statute to some other officer or agent of the club. In general, the President shall perform all duties incident to the office of President and such other duties as may be prescribed by the board of directors from time to time.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.6</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Vice President.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>In the absence of the President or in event of an inability or refusal to act, the <inline.instr>&lsqb;Vice President/Vice Presidents in the order of their election&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall perform the duties of the President and, when so acting, shall have all the powers of and be subject to all the restrictions on the President. Any Vice President shall perform such other duties as, from time to time, may be assigned by the President or by the board of directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.7</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Treasurer.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>If required by the board of directors, the treasurer shall give a bond for the faithful discharge of his or her duties in such sum and with such surety or sureties as the board of directors shall determine. The treasurer shall have charge and custody of and be responsible for all funds and securities of the club; receive and give receipts for money due and payable to the club from any source whatsoever, and deposit all such monies in the name of the club in such banks, trust companies, or other depositories as shall be selected by the board of directors and, in general, perform all the duties incident to the office of treasurer and such other duties as, from time to time, may be assigned by the President or by the board of directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.8</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Secretary.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The secretary shall keep the minutes of the meetings of the members and of the board of directors in one or more books provided for that purpose; see that all notices are given in accordance with the provisions of these bylaws or as required by law; be custodian of the corporate records and of the corporate seal of the club and see that the corporate seal of the club is affixed to all documents, the execution of which on behalf of the club under its seal is authorized in accordance with the provisions of these bylaws; keep a register of the post office address of each member which shall be furnished to the secretary by such member; and in general perform all duties incident to the office of secretary and such other duties as, from time to time, may be assigned by the President or by the board of directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.9</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Assistant Treasurers and Assistant Secretaries.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>If required by the board of directors, the assistant treasurers shall give bonds for the faithful discharge of their duties in such sums and with such sureties as the board of directors shall determine. The assistant treasurers and assistant secretaries, in general, shall perform such duties as shall be assigned to them by the treasurer or the secretary or by the President or the board of directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VI</designator><name>COMMITTEES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Executive Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Internal management and conduct of the business of the club shall, by resolution adopted by a majority of the board of directors in office, be vested in an executive committee composed of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of persons&rsqb;</inline.instr> persons. Members of the committee shall be appointed by resolution of the board of directors. <inline.instr>&lsqb;All/At least &lsqb;number of members&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the committee shall be directors of the club. The executive committee is authorized to hire and discharge employees, to make all contracts and authorize all transactions in the ordinary course of business of the club, and to do all things necessary or incident thereto. This designation and the delegation thereto of authority shall not operate to relieve the board of directors or any individual director of any responsibility imposed by law.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The executive committee may act by unanimous written agreement of its members or by a majority vote of its members at any regularly called meeting of which all members have had reasonable notice. The committee shall, at each regular meeting of the board of directors and from time to time when requested by the board, make a full report of all business transacted by the committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Other Committees of Directors.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The board of directors, by resolution adopted by a majority of the directors in office, may designate other committees, each of which shall consist of two or more directors, which committees, to the extent provided in the resolution, shall have and shall exercise the authority of the board of directors. The designation of such committees and the delegation of authority to them shall not operate to relieve the board of directors or any individual director of any responsibility imposed by law.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>A committee designated may perform the functions of any officer and the functions of any two or more officers may be performed by a single committee, including the functions of both President and secretary.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Other Committees.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Other committees not having and exercising the authority of the board of directors in the management of the club may be designated by a resolution adopted by a majority of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: Except as otherwise provided in such resolution, members of each such committee shall be members of the club, and the President of the club shall appoint the members thereof.&rsqb;</inline.instr> Any member thereof may be removed by the person or persons authorized to appoint such member whenever in that person&apos;s or those persons&apos; judgment the best interests of the club will be served by such removal.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Term of Office.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Each member of a committee shall continue as such until the next annual meeting of the board of directors and until a successor is appointed, unless the committee shall be sooner terminated, or unless the member shall be removed from the committee, or unless the member shall cease to qualify as a member of the committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.5</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Chair.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>One member of each committee shall be appointed to chair the committee by the person or persons authorized to appoint the committee members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.6</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Vacancies.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Vacancies in the membership of any committee may be filled by appointments made in the same manner as provided in the case of the original appointments.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.7</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Quorum.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Unless otherwise provided in the resolution of the board of directors designating a committee, a majority of the whole committee shall constitute a quorum and the act of a majority of the members present at a meeting at which a quorum is present shall be the act of the committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>6.8</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Rules.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Each committee may adopt rules for its own government not inconsistent with these bylaws or with rules adopted by the board of directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VII</designator><name>CONTRACTS, CHECKS, DEPOSITS, AND FUNDS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>7.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Contracts.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The board of directors may authorize any officer or officers, agent or agents of the club, in addition to the officers so authorized by these bylaws, to enter into any contract or to execute and deliver any instrument in the name of and on behalf of the club, and such authority may be general or confined to specific instances.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>7.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Checks, Drafts, or Orders for Payment.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>All checks, drafts, or orders for the payment of money, notes, or other evidences of indebtedness issued in the name of the club shall be signed by such officer or officers, agent, or agents of the club and in such manner as shall from time to time be determined by resolution of the board of directors. In the absence of such determination by the board of directors, such instruments shall be signed by the treasurer or an assistant treasurer and countersigned by the President or a Vice President of the club.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>7.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Deposits.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>All funds of the club shall be deposited from time to time to the credit of the club in such banks, trust companies, or other depositaries as the board of directors may select.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>7.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Gifts.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The board of directors may accept on behalf of the club any contribution, gift, bequest, or devise for the general purposes or for any special purpose of the club.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VIII</designator><name>CERTIFICATES OF MEMBERSHIP</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>8.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Certificate of Membership.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The board of directors may provide for the issuance of certificates evidencing membership in the club, which shall be in such form as may be determined by the board. The certificates shall be signed by the President or a Vice President and by the secretary or an assistant secretary and shall be sealed with the seal of the club. All certificates evidencing membership of any class shall be consecutively numbered. The name and address of each member and the date of issuance of the certificate shall be entered on the records of the club. If any certificate shall become lost, mutilated, or destroyed, a new certificate may be issued on such terms and conditions as the board of directors may determine.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>8.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Issuance of Certificates.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>If the board of directors shall have provided for the issuance of certificates of membership under the provisions of Section 8.1 when a member has been elected to membership and has paid any initiation fee and dues that may then be required, the secretary shall issue a certificate of membership in the new member&apos;s name and deliver it to the new member.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>8.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Nontransferability of Certificates.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>In no event shall membership certificates issued by the club be transferable. Upon transfer of membership as provided in ARTICLE II of these bylaws, the transferring member shall surrender his or her membership certificate, and a new certificate shall be issued to the transferee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IX</designator><name>DUES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>9.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Initiation Fee and Annual Dues.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The board of directors may determine from time to time the amount of initiation fee, if any, and annual dues payable to the club by members <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: of each class&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>9.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Payment of Dues.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Dues shall be payable in advance of the first day of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> in each fiscal year. Dues of a new member shall be prorated from the first day of the month in which such new member is elected to membership for the remainder of the fiscal year of the club.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>9.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Default and Termination of Membership.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>When any member <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: of any class&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall be in default in the payment of dues for a period of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of months&rsqb;</inline.instr> months from the beginning of the fiscal year or period in which such dues become payable, his or her membership may be terminated by the board of directors in the manner provided in Article II of these bylaws.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>X</designator><name>USE OF FACILITIES</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Unless specifically authorized by resolution of the board of directors limited as to date, time, and event or function, no person except a member of the club, the family of such member, and guests of the member, when in the company of the member, shall use the facilities owned or leased by the club. As used in these bylaws, the term &ldquo;family&rdquo; shall include only persons within the third degree of relationship either to the member or to the member&apos;s spouse.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XI</designator><name>MISCELLANEOUS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>11.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Books and Records.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The club shall keep correct and complete books and records of account and shall also keep minutes of the proceedings of its members, board of directors, and committees having any of the authority of the board of directors and shall keep at the registered or principal office a record giving the names and addresses of the members entitled to vote. All books and records of the club may be inspected by any member or his or her agent or attorney for any proper purpose at any reasonable time.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>11.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Fiscal Year.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The fiscal year of the club shall begin on the first day of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> and end on the last day of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> in each year.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>11.3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Corporate Seal.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The board of directors shall provide a corporate seal, which shall be in the form of <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of form&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>11.4</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Waiver of Notice.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Whenever any notice is required to be given under the provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or under the provisions of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws of the club, a waiver of such notice in writing signed by the person or persons entitled to such notice or transmitted electronically by electronic mail and setting forth information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the person or persons, whether before or after the time stated in the notice, shall be deemed equivalent to the giving of such notice.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>XII</designator><name>AMENDMENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>12.1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Power of Members to Amend Bylaws.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>The bylaws of this club may be amended, repealed, or added to or new bylaws may be adopted <inline.instr>&lsqb;by the vote or written assent of &lsqb;a majority/&lsqb;percentage of members entitled to vote&rsqb;&percnt;&rsqb; of the members entitled to vote/by the vote of &lsqb;a majority/&lsqb;percentage of quorum&rsqb;&percnt;&rsqb; of a quorum at a meeting called for the purpose according to the certificate of incorporation or bylaws&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>12.2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Power of Directors to Amend Bylaws.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><form.text>Subject to any limitations set forth in the certificate of incorporation, these bylaws, and the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law concerning corporate action that must be authorized or approved by the members of the club, the bylaws of this club may also be amended, repealed, or added to, or new bylaws may be adopted, by a resolution of the board of directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The tax law defines social clubs as those in which the members are associated together in fellowship toward some common objective (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-irs-ruling" numref="67-428" volref="1967-2" reporter="C.B." volpg="204">Rev. Rul. 67-428, 1967-2 C.B. 204</cite>) and, to be tax exempt, must be operated primarily for pleasure or recreational purposes. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(7)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(c)(7)</cite>. Substantially all its activities must be for the purposes for which it was organized. Clubs engaging in an unrelated business run the risk of losing exempt status. No more than 35&percnt; of a club&apos;s gross income can come from investment sources or from nonmembership sources. Furthermore, no more than 15&percnt; of a club&apos;s gross income can come from use of a club&apos;s facilities by the public. None of the earnings of a club can inure to the benefit of a private shareholder.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>An exempt club is subject to one special requirement: Neither the charter nor bylaws nor any written policy of the club can provide for discrimination against any person on the basis of race, color or religion. Two exceptions exist: (1) a club can discriminate on religious grounds if it limits its membership to a particular religion in order to further the principles of that religion. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(i)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(i)</cite>; or (2) an auxiliary of a fraternal benefit society that limits its membership to those of a particular religion may also discriminate on religious grounds.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>A qualified social club is exempt from tax only on income from its exempt activities, that is, from amounts paid by its members. Investment income is taxed, as is all other unrelated business income. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(b)">26 U.S.C.A. &dblsect;501(b)</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="512">512</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Dues, fees, assessments, and similar payments made to a social or recreational club are not deductible. This applies whether the club is used for personal purposes (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="262">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;262</cite>) or business purposes. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(a)(3)</cite>. This is an exception to the general rule that ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the operation of a business are deductible. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="162" subref="(a)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;162(a)</cite>. The prohibition applies to clubs organized for &ldquo;business, pleasure, recreation, or other social purpose.&rdquo; It applies even to clubs used solely for the benefit of employees. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(e)" pararef="(4)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(e)(4)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>A possible exception may exist for payments to &ldquo;clubs&rdquo; that are really associations directly organized for the furtherance of a business purpose. If such an association does not offer the customary amenities of a club&mdash;dining and recreational facilities&mdash;the costs should be deductible as business expenses.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Contributions to a club do not qualify as deductible donations for income tax purposes. An exception may also exist here if the organization is not really a social or recreational club but is devoted to some purpose for which a charitable contribution is permitted under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="170" subref="(b)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;170(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The situation under the estate tax is less categorical. Only contributions for public, religious, charitable, scientific, literary, educational, and certain other purposes are deductible. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="2055" subref="(a)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;2055(a)</cite>. While this would seem to exclude contributions to most clubs, a bequest to trustees of a club to give financial assistance to the sick and unfortunate residents of a town was held deductible, as was a contribution to an art club devoted principally to educational activities. In the latter case, the club also provided incidental social activities, but this did not prevent the contribution from being deductible. <cite type="secondary" normalpub="aj2" topicname="Federal Taxation" parmkref="144,308">Am. Jur. 2d, Federal Taxation &para;144,308</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>As to contents of bylaws, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:44">&sect;30:44</cite>. As to adoption of bylaws, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:45">&sect;30:45</cite>. For pertinent checklist concerning matters that may be covered in bylaws, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:56">&sect;30:56</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>A club seeking exemption and which does not come under the exemption should include in both its bylaws and its charter (or articles of incorporation) a provision specifically prohibiting discrimination. Although the Tax Code does not require this, the inclusion of the provision will serve to show the intent of the members in this regard and will make obtaining and maintaining the exemption easier.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation may have one or more classes of members or, in the case of a charitable corporation, may have no members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;601(a)</cite>. If a corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;601(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>If the corporation has members, membership may be effected and evidenced by: (1) signature on the certificate of incorporation; (2) designation in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws; (3) membership certificate or card or capital certificate; or (4) such method, including but not limited to the foregoing, as is prescribed by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;601(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="823">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;823</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.3.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide, either absolutely or contingently, that the members of any class shall not be entitled to vote or may limit or define the matters on and the circumstances in which a member or a class of members shall be entitled to vote, and, except as otherwise provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, such provisions of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws shall prevail, according to their tenor, in all elections and in all proceedings over the provisions of Chapter 6 of the Law which authorize any action by the members, but no such denial, limitation or definition of voting rights shall be effective unless, at the time, one or more classes of members, singly or in the aggregate, are entitled to full voting rights. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="612">N-PCL &sect;612</cite>. See also <cite type="case">Gluck v. Chevre Liady Nusach Hoary, 97 A.D.3d 787, 949 N.Y.S.2d 149 (2d Dep&apos;t 2012)</cite> stating that given that not-for-profit corporation had only one member, Orthodox Jewish congregation, that member could not be deprived of the right to vote except via its removal or resignation as a member of corporation.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="916">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;916</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.4.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Generally, members will be held bound by the corporate regulations and bylaws respecting disciplinary action or expulsion. <cite type="case">Kendrick v. Watermill Beach Club, Inc., 8 Misc. 2d 798, 165 N.Y.S.2d 1009 (Sup 1957)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="831 to 834" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;831 to 834</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.7.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Membership certificates or cards shall not be transferable. If the certificate of incorporation or bylaws permits transfer of membership, upon each such transfer the certificate or card issued to a former member shall be surrendered, and a new certificate or card shall be issued to the new member. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;601(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.8.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, membership in a not-for-profit corporation shall by terminated by death, resignation, expulsion, expiration of a term of membership, or dissolution and liquidation under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" artref="10">Articles 10</cite> and <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" artref="11">11 of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(e)">N-PCL &sect;601(e)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Transfer of membership may be permitted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;601(d)</cite>. If memberships are transferable, any restrictions on the transfer of memberships must be reasonable if they are to be enforced against the members. The restrictions will probably be valid if imposed by the certificate of incorporation or bylaws or by a written agreement among any number of members. Any restrictions on transfer of membership should, in any event, be noted conspicuously on the certificate or other written evidence representing the membership or in corporate materials (such as brochures, informational packets, etc.) available to outsiders on request so that a prospective transferee may have sufficient notice and actual knowledge thereof.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>A restriction on the transfer of memberships will probably be enforced if it: (1) obligates the member to offer to the corporation or to any other members a prior opportunity to acquire the membership; (2) obligates the corporation to purchase the membership; (3) requires the corporation to consent to any proposed transfer of the membership or to approve the proposed transferee; or (4) prohibits the transfer of the membership to designated persons or classes of persons and the designation is not manifestly unreasonable.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="835">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;835</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Meetings of members may be held at such place, either within or outside the state, as may be fixed by or under the bylaws or, if not so fixed, at the office of the corporation in the state. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;603(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="908">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;908</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.1.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>A meeting of the members shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of other business on a date fixed by or under the bylaws. Failure to hold the annual meeting on the date so fixed or to elect a sufficient number of directors to conduct the business of the corporation will not work a forfeiture or give cause for dissolution of the corporation, except as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provisions relating to judicial dissolution in the event of deadlock among directors or members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;603(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="908">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;908</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.2.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Special meetings of the members may be called by the board of directors and by such person(s) as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;603(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="897">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;897</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.4.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member&apos;s fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="605" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;605(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member&apos;s authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="606">N-PCL &sect;606</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="901 to 907" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;901 to 907</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.5.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken at any meeting of the members by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may be taken without a meeting if all the members entitled to vote thereon consent thereto in writing or electronically. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;614(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="894">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;894</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.6.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Members entitled to cast a majority of the total number of votes at a meeting will constitute a quorum at the meeting, provided that, when a specified item of business is required to be voted on by a class of members, voting as a class, members entitled to cast a majority of the total votes entitled to be cast by such class will constitute a quorum for the transaction of such specified items of business. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="608" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;608(a)</cite>. The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide for any lesser quorum not less than the members entitled to cast 100 votes or one-tenth of the total number of votes entitled to be cast, whichever is lesser, and may, under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="615">N-PCL &sect;615</cite>, provide for a greater quorum. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="608" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;608(b)</cite>. The members present may adjourn the meeting despite the absence of a quorum. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="608" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;608(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="912">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;912</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.7.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>A member entitled to vote may vote in person or, unless the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws otherwise provide, by proxy executed in writing by the member or by that member&apos;s agent. A proxy will not be valid after 11 months from the date of its execution, unless otherwise provided in the proxy. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="609" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;609(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="943 to 946" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;943 to 946</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.8.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that directors shall be elected or appointed in the manner provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="703" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;703(b)</cite>. There is no prohibition in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law against holding an election for directors by mail.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="544">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;544</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.9.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide that in all elections for directors every member entitled to vote will have the right to cumulate his or her vote and to give one candidate a number of votes equal to his or her vote multiplied by the number of directors to be elected or to distribute such votes on the same principle among as many candidates as he or she thinks fit. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="617">N-PCL &sect;617</cite>. The implication is that if cumulative voting is not provided for in either the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, it will not be permitted in directors&apos; elections.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="917">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;917</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Except as otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, each not-for-profit corporation must have a board of directors and the affairs of the corporation must be managed by or under the direction of the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="701" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;701(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that, in addition to any other liabilities imposed by law on directors of a corporation, directors who vote for, or concur in, any of certain enumerated actions will be jointly and severally liable to the corporation for the benefit of the corporation and its creditors, members, or other interested persons to the extent of any injury suffered by those persons as a result of the action. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="719">N-PCL &sect;719</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71, 683 et seq." secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;71, 683 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.2.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or bylaws may prescribe qualifications for directors. A director must, however, be at least 18 years of age, except in the case of certain specified youth groups. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="701" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;701(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The minimum number of directors of a not-for-profit corporation is set by statute at three. Subject to such limitation, the number may be fixed by the bylaws or, in the case of a corporation having members, by action of the members or the board under the specific provisions of a bylaw adopted by the members. If not otherwise fixed, the number shall be three. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="702" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;702(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that directors elected or appointed at large shall be divided into either two, three, four, or five classes for the purpose of staggering their terms of office and that all or some of the directors elected or appointed otherwise than at large shall be divided into the same or a different number of classes, not exceeding five, for the same purpose. All classes shall be as nearly equal in number as possible and, if provision has been made for cumulative voting, no class shall include less than three directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="704" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;704(a)</cite>. The terms of office of the directors initially classified shall be as follows: that of the first class shall expire at the next annual meeting of members if there be members or of the board if there be no members; the second class at the second succeeding annual meeting; the third class, if any, at the third annual meeting, and so on. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="704">N-PCL &sect;704</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="535, 537, 541" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;535, 537, 541</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.3.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Meetings of the board of directors may be held either within or outside the state, unless otherwise provided by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="710" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;710(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="595 to 607" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;595 to 607</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.4.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice if the time and place of such meetings are fixed by the bylaws. Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;711(a)</cite>. Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to any director who submits a waiver of notice, whether before or after the meeting, or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to such meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the director signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;711(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board, unless required by the bylaws. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;711(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="595 to 607" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;595 to 607</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.5.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any one or more members of the board or of any committee thereof who is not physically present at a meeting of the board or a committee may participate by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="708" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;708(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="602">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;602</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.7.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, a majority of the entire board of directors constitutes a quorum, provided that the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may fix the quorum at less than a majority of the entire board if, in the case of a board of 15 members or less, the quorum is at least one-third of the entire number of members, and, in the case of a board of more than 15 members, the quorum must be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction thereof) in excess of 15. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="707">N-PCL &sect;707</cite>. See also <cite type="case">Desuzia v. Board of Directors of Concourse Village, Inc., 117 A.D.3d 426, 985 N.Y.S.2d 48 (1st Dep&apos;t 2014)</cite>, stating that a supermajority quorum requirement may be imposed through corporate bylaws.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="605">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;605</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.8.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Provision is made in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for informal action by directors. Unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken by the board or any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board or the committee consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail or other electronic means and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the board or committee. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="708" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;708(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>The act of a majority of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present will be the act of the board of directors, unless the act of a greater number is required by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="708" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;708(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="602, 605" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;602, 605</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.10.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, newly created directorships resulting from an increase in the number of directors elected or appointed at large, and vacancies among such directors for any reason may be filled by vote of a majority of the directors then in office, regardless of their number. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="705" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;705(a)</cite>. Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, a director elected or appointed to fill a vacancy in an unexpired term will hold office until the end of the term which the director was elected or appointed to fill, or for a term to be determined by the board which ends at an annual meeting, subject to the limitations on terms of office in N-PCL &sect;703(b) and until his or her successor is elected or appointed and qualified. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="705" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;705(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Construction and effect of corporate bylaws or articles relating to change in number of directors" volref="3" pageref="623">Construction and effect of corporate bylaws or articles relating to change in number of directors, 3 A.L.R.3d 623</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="550">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;550</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.11.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>A corporation may pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|105|30:97"><para.text>As to indemnification of officers, directors, employees, and agents, as well as insurance, see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="721 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;721 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
