Fed. 177</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="404 to 419" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;404 to 419</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.05.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602">N-PCL &dblsect;602</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="801">801</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802">802</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602">N-PCL &sect;602</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="127">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;127</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.06.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>If a disqualified person engages in self-dealing with a trust, that person is subject to a 10&percnt; tax that goes up to 200&percnt; if the self-dealing is not rectified. A disqualified person is one or more of the following: (See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="4946" subref="(a)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4946(a)</cite>.)</para.text>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>1)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>a substantial contributor;</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>2)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>a foundation manager;</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>3)</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>a person who owns more than 20&percnt; of a corporation, partnership, trust, or unincorporated enterprise which is itself a substantial contributor; and/or</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>4) a member of the family of any individual of the first three categories.</para.text></para></list.item>
</list></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>Self-dealing does not include a transaction between a private foundation and a disqualified person where the disqualified person status arises only as a result of the transaction. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="53.4941(d)-1" subref="(a)">26 C.F.R. &sect;53.4941(d)-1(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>Self-dealing includes any of the following acts, engaged in directly or indirectly by a &ldquo;disqualified person&rdquo; (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="exec-us-cfr" titleref="26" secref="53.4941(d)-2">26 C.F.R. &sect;53.4941(d)-2</cite>.)</para.text>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item><name.block><designator>a</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>sale or exchange, or leasing, of property between a private foundation and a disqualified person; (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="4941" subref="(d)" pararef="(1)" spararef="(A)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4941(d)(1)(A)</cite>.)</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>b</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>loan of money or other extension of credit between a private foundation and a disqualified person; (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="4941" subref="(d)" pararef="(1)" spararef="(B)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4941(d)(1)(B)</cite>.)</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>c</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>furnishing of goods, services, or facilities between a private foundation and a disqualified person; (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="4941" subref="(d)" pararef="(1)" spararef="(C)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4941(d)(1)(C)</cite>.)</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>d</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>payment of compensation, or payment or reimbursement of expenses, by a private foundation to a disqualified person; (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="4941" subref="(d)" pararef="(1)" spararef="(D)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4941(d)(1)(D)</cite>.)</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>e</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>transfer to, or use by or for the benefit of, a disqualified person of the income or assets of a private foundation; (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="4941" subref="(d)" pararef="(1)" spararef="(E)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4941(d)(1)(E)</cite>.) and</para.text></para></list.item>
<list.item><name.block><designator>f</designator></name.block><para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>agreement by a private foundation to make any payment of money or other property to a government official, other than an agreement to employ such individual for any period after the termination of his or her government service if such individual is terminating that service within a 90-day period. (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="4941" subref="(d)" pararef="(1)" spararef="(F)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4941(d)(1)(F)</cite>.)</para.text></para></list.item>
</list></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="722 et seq. and 726">N-PCL &dblsect;722 et seq. and 726</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="801 to 810" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;801 to 810</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>5.07.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|106|30:98"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that no loans, other than through the purchase of bonds, debentures, or similar obligations of the type customarily sold in public offerings or through ordinary deposit of funds in a bank, may be made by a not-for-profit corporation to its directors, officers or key persons or to any other corporation, firm, association, or other entity in which one or more of its directors, officers or key persons are directors, officers or key persons or hold a substantial financial interest, except a loan by one charitable corporation to another charitable corporation. The statute further provides that a loan made in violation of this provision constitutes a violation of the duty to the corporation of the directors or officers authorizing it or participating in it, but the obligation of the borrower with respect to the loan is not affected thereby. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="716">N-PCL &sect;716</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="719">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;719</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:99</designator><name>Bylaws<sep/>No members</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55229b01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>1</designator><name>PURPOSE</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> has been formed as a not-for-profit corporation under the New York Not-For-Profit Corporation Law. Its purpose is to <inline.instr>&lsqb;statement of purpose&rsqb;</inline.instr>, as set forth in the Certificate of Incorporation filed with the New York State Department of State on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of filing&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>2</designator><name>GOVERNANCE AND MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Management of Corporate Affairs. The governance and management of the affairs of the corporation shall be vested in a Board of Directors. All the powers of the corporation shall be exercised by the Board of Directors in such manner and upon such terms and conditions as it may determine.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Members. The corporation shall have no members with a right to vote as that term is defined in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" artref="6">ARTICLE 6 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite> of the State of New York.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2.3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Annual Meetings. The annual meeting of the corporation, for the election of Directors and for the transaction of such other business as may be set forth in the notice of meeting, shall be held at the principal office of the corporation or at such place as the Board of Directors shall determine each year by resolution.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2.4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Notices and Voting. Any notice required or permitted by law or under these bylaws may be given or sent via postal mail or through electronic means.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Any Director who provides the corporation with a valid e-mail address consents to receiving official notices via e-mail unless such member requests in writing to receive notices via postal mail.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>An electronic communication shall constitute a writing for all purposes of conducting the business of the corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Written and/or electronic consent thus given by all Directors entitled to vote shall have the same effect as a unanimous vote.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>3</designator><name>DIRECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Number. The number of Directors shall be determined from time to time by the Board of Directors, but in no event shall there be less than three.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Election of Directors. The Directors shall be elected by the Board of Directors at the annual meeting of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Term. Each Director shall serve a <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of year&rsqb;</inline.instr>-year term, or until their successors are duly elected and qualified. At the initial meeting of the Corporation, the Directors shall be divided into <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of classes&rsqb;</inline.instr> classes for terms of <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of lengths of terms&rsqb;</inline.instr>; thereafter all elections shall be for <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years&rsqb;</inline.instr>-year terms except for the filling of vacancies as provided in Section 3.4.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Vacancies. Vacancies on the Board of Directors occurring during the year for any reason, including an increase in the number of Directors, shall be filled for the unexpired term by a majority vote of the remaining Directors at any meeting called for that purpose.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Resignation. Any Director of the corporation may resign at any time by giving written notice of resignation to the Secretary. Unless otherwise specified in such notice, the resignation shall take effect upon receipt thereof, and the acceptance of the resignation shall not be necessary to make it effective.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Removal of Directors. Any Director may only be removed with cause, at any meeting of the Board of Directors, notice of which shall have referred to the proposed action, by the vote in person or by proxy of a majority of the Directors entitled to vote.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.7</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Meeting of Directors. There shall be regular meetings of the Board of Directors to make management decisions relating to the operations of the Corporation. Regular and special meetings of the Board of Directors shall be called and held at such times and at such places in New York or elsewhere as the Board of Directors or the President, or, in his or her absence, any Vice-President, may determine. A special meeting of the Board of Directors may also be called at the written request of any <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.8</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Responsibility to Attend Meetings. Every Director is expected to attend <inline.instr>&lsqb;amount of meetings&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the regularly scheduled Board meetings and no member shall miss <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of meetings&rsqb;</inline.instr> consecutive meetings without approval of the Board of Directors, failure of which shall be cause for removal.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.9</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Notice of Meetings of Board of Directors. Once duly called, notice of each meeting of the Board of Directors, stating the time and place and purposes thereof, may be given by any member of the board to each member of the board. Meetings of the Board of Directors may be held at any place and time without notice by unanimous consent of all the Directors. The notice of any meeting of the Board of Directors may be waived by a Director either before or after such meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.10</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Quorum. A quorum, equal to a majority of the entire Board of Directors, shall be required for the transaction of business. Unless otherwise provided, the vote of a majority of the Directors present shall decide any question that may come before the meeting. A majority of the Directors present at any meeting, although less than a quorum, may adjourn the same from time to time, without notice other than announcement at the meeting, until a quorum is present.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.11</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Procedure. The order of business and all other matters of procedure at every meeting of Directors may be determined by the presiding officer.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.12</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Attendance by Telephonic Means. Any Director may attend and participate in any meeting of the Board, the corporation, or a committee thereof by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.13</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Annual Report. The Directors shall prepare and present at the annual meeting of the corporation a balance sheet showing the financial and other affairs of such corporation during the preceding year.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.14</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Compensation of Directors. No Director of the corporation shall receive, directly or indirectly, salary, compensation, fee or profit from the corporation, either as a Director or in any other capacity, except reasonable compensation for services actually rendered in effecting one or more of its corporate purposes. No paid employee of the Corporation may act as Chair or presiding officer of the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.15</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Conflict of Interest. The Board of Directors shall adopt and maintain a conflict of interest policy.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>4</designator><name>COMMITTEES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>The Board of Directors, by resolution, may designate one or more committees, which to the extent provided in said resolution or resolutions, shall have and may exercise such powers as may be lawfully delegated by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>5</designator><name>OFFICERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Officers. The Board of Directors shall appoint or elect officers at the annual meeting of the corporation. The officers of the Board shall be a President, a Secretary, a Treasurer, and such other officers as it shall deem necessary; such additional officers to hold their offices for such terms and to exercise such powers and perform such duties as shall be determined from time to time by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Term of Office. The officers of the corporation specified above shall, unless otherwise determined by the Directors, hold office for <inline.instr>&lsqb;term of office&rsqb;</inline.instr> and until their successors are elected and have qualified. Any officer may be removed at any time with or without cause by the affirmative vote of a majority of the Board of Directors. If the office of any officer becomes vacant, such vacancy shall be filled by the Board of Directors. Removal of an officer, in their capacity as an officer, does not in itself constitute a removal of such person as a Director of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>President. The President shall preside at all meetings of the Board and the Corporation, shall have the general powers and duties of supervision and management of the corporation which usually pertain to such office, and shall perform all such other duties as are properly required by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Vice President. The Vice President shall assist the President in the discharge of his or her duties and preside at meetings of the Board and the Association in the absence of the President. In any case, where the President is unable to act, the Vice President shall perform the duties of the office of President.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Secretary. The Secretary, or the Secretary&apos;s designee, shall issue notices of all meetings required by law or these Bylaws. The Secretary shall attend meetings of the Board of Directors, keep the minutes thereof, and shall ensure that the minutes of the Board are prepared, distributed, amended as needed, and approved by the Board. The Secretary shall perform such duties as usually pertain to such office or as are properly required of the Secretary by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Treasurer. The Treasurer shall have the care and custody of all funds and securities of the corporation. The Treasurer shall cause to be entered in books of the corporation to be kept for that purpose full and accurate accounts of all moneys received and paid on account of the corporation. The Treasurer shall make and sign such reports, statements, and instruments as may be required of the Treasurer by law or the Board of Directors, and shall perform such other duties as usually pertain to the Treasurer&apos;s office or as are properly required of the Treasurer by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.7</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Officers Holding Two or More Offices. Any two of the above-mentioned offices, except that of President and Secretary, may be held by the same person.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.8</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Compensation of Officers. No officer of the corporation shall receive, directly or indirectly, any part of the income or earnings of the corporation nor any pecuniary profit from the operation of the corporation but each officer may receive reasonable compensation for services actually rendered in effecting one or more of the corporate purposes.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>6</designator><name>INDEMNIFICATION OF DIRECTORS ANDOFFICERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Indemnification. If a Director or officer of the corporation is made a party to any civil or criminal action or proceeding in any matter arising from the performance by such Director or officer of his or her duties for or on behalf of the corporation, then, to the full extent permitted by law, the corporation, upon an affirmative vote of the Board of Directors, a quorum of Directors being present at the time of the vote who are not parties to the action or proceeding, shall:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Advance to such Director or officer all sums found by the board, so voting, to be necessary and appropriate to enable the Director or officer to conduct his or her defense, or appeal, in the action or proceeding; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Indemnify such Director or officer for all sums paid by him or her in the way of judgments, fines, amounts paid in settlement and reasonable expenses, including attorneys&apos; fees actually and necessarily incurred, in connection with the action or proceeding, or appeal therein, subject to the proper application of credit for any sums advanced to the Director or officer pursuant to the previous subsection.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Such right of indemnification shall be a contract right that may be enforced in any manner desired by such Director or officer. Such right of indemnification shall not be exclusive of any other right that such Director or officer may have or hereafter acquire. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, such Director or officer shall be entitled to his or her rights of indemnification under any agreement, resolution of members, resolution of Directors, provisions of law or otherwise, as well as his or her rights under this Bylaw.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>7</designator><name>FINANCES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>7.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Finances. The funds of the corporation shall be deposited in its name with such bank or banks, trust company or trust companies as the Board of Directors may from time to time designate. All checks, notes, drafts and other negotiable instruments of the corporation shall be signed by such officers, agents, or employees as the Board of Directors from time to time by resolution may designate.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>7.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>Fiscal Year. The fiscal year of the corporation shall be the calendar year unless otherwise provided by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>8</designator><name>AMENDMENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|107|30:99"><form.text>These Bylaws maybe added to, amended, altered, or repealed at any meeting of Directors by the affirmative vote of two-thirds of the Board of Directors. Notice of any amendment and the substance thereof shall be given to the Directors at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days in advance of the meeting at which the proposed changes are to be considered.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:100</designator><name>Bylaws<sep/>No members<sep/>Not-for-profit compliance</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55277d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><designator>I</designator><name>OFFICES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Principal Office. The principal office of the Corporation shall be located in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Other Offices. The Corporation may also have offices at such other places, both within and without the State of New York, as the Board of Directors may from time to time determine or the business of the Corporation may require.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><designator>II</designator><name>MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>The Corporation shall have no members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><designator>III</designator><name>DIRECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Number, Qualification, Election and Term of Directors. The business of the Corporation shall be managed by its Board of Directors, which shall consist of at least three directors who shall each be at least 18 years of age. The number of directors may be changed by a majority vote of the entire Board, provided that no decrease shall shorten the tenure of any incumbent director. Except as hereinafter otherwise provided, directors shall be assigned to one of two classes and shall be elected for terms of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years&rsqb;</inline.instr> years by a plurality of the votes cast by the directors and shall hold office until their resignation or until the election and qualification of their respective successors. Directors may be reelected to serve consecutive terms but no director may serve more than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of terms&rsqb;</inline.instr> consecutive <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years&rsqb;</inline.instr>-year terms.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Resignation and Removal of Directors. Any director may resign from office at any time by delivering a written notice of resignation to the Board of Directors and the acceptance of the resignation, unless required by its terms, shall not be necessary to make such resignation effective. Any or all of the directors may be removed for cause by vote of the Board of Directors at any meeting, provided there is a quorum of not less than a majority present at such meeting of directors at which such action is taken.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Newly Created Directorships and Vacancies. Newly created directorships resulting from an increase in the number of directors and vacancies in the Board of Directors for any reason may be filled by a majority vote of the directors then in office regardless of their number. Newly-elected Directors shall be assigned to class and shall serve until the term of the selected class expires.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Quorum and Manner of Acting. A majority of the entire Board shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business or of any specified item of business. Action of the Board of Directors shall be authorized by the vote of a majority of the directors present at a meeting duly assembled at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at such time, unless otherwise provided by law or these bylaws. In the absence of a quorum, a majority of the directors present may adjourn any meeting to another time and place.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Action By Board of Directors or Committee Without a Meeting. Any action required or permitted to be taken by the Board of Directors or by any committee of the Board of Directors may be taken without a meeting if all of the members of the Board of Directors or of such committee consent in writing to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Written consents may be in the form of fax, e-mail or original documents. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the Board of Directors or such committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceeding of the Board of Directors or of such committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Participation in Board or Committee Meetings by Conference Telephone. Any one or more directors or members of any committee of the Board of Directors may participate in a meeting of the Board of Directors or of such committee by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.7</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Place of Meetings. Regular meetings of the Board of Directors may be held at any place within or without the State of New York. Special meetings may be held at other locations as determined by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.8</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Annual and Regular Meetings. The Board of Directors shall hold at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of meetings&rsqb;</inline.instr> regular meetings in each year: Annual meetings of the Board of Directors, for the election of officers and consideration of other matters, shall be held in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> in each year, or as soon thereafter as is practicable, or as determined by the Board of Directors and specified in the notice of a meeting as provided in Section 3.10 of these bylaws. Regular meetings of the Board of Directors may be held without notice at such times and places as the Board of Directors determines. If the day fixed for a regular meeting is a legal holiday, the meeting shall be held the next business day.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.9</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Special Meetings. Special meetings of the Board of Directors may be called at any time by any director upon written demand of not less than one-fifth of the entire Board or by the President.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.10</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Notice of Meetings; Waiver of Notice. Notice of the time and place of each special meeting of the Board of Directors, and of each annual meeting, shall be given to each director by mailing it to him or her at his or her residence or usual place of business at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days before the meeting or by fax, e-mail, telephone, or telegraph at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days before the meeting. Notice need not be given to any director who submits a waiver of notice before or after the meeting or who attends the meeting without protesting the lack of notice to him or her, either before the meeting or when it begins. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. Notice of any adjourned meeting need not be given, other than by announcement at the meeting at which the adjournment is taken.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.11</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Compensation. Directors shall not receive compensation for their services, but the Board of Directors may authorize reimbursement of their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses in connection with the performance of their duties.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3.12</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Presiding Officer. The President shall preside at all Board meetings. Otherwise, the Vice President, if also a director and present and acting, or any other director chosen by the Board, shall preside.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><designator>IV</designator><name>COMMITTEES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Executive Committee and Other Committees. The Board of Directors, by resolution adopted by a majority of the entire Board, may designate an Executive Committee or other committees, each consisting of three or more directors, and each of which shall have all the authority of the Board of Directors, except as otherwise provided in such resolution or by law, and each of which shall serve at the pleasure of the Board of Directors. All action of the Executive Committee and such other committees shall be reported to the Board of Directors at the Board of Directors&apos; next meeting. The Executive Committee and such other committees shall adopt rules of procedure and shall meet as provided by those rules or by resolutions of the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors shall have the power at any time to fill vacancies in, to change the membership of, or to discharge such Committees.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><designator>V</designator><name>OFFICERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Number; Security. The executive officers of the Corporation shall be the President, one or more Vice Presidents, a Secretary, and a Treasurer. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and Secretary.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Election; Term of Office. The executive officers of the Corporation shall be elected annually by the Board of Directors and each such officer shall hold office until the election and qualification of his or her successor.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Subordinate Officers. The Board of Directors may appoint subordinate officers (including assistant secretaries and assistant treasurers), as it may deem proper, each of whom shall hold office for such period and have such powers and duties as the Board of Directors determines. The Board of Directors may delegate to any executive officer or to any committee the power to appoint and define the powers and duties of any subordinate officers.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Resignation and Removal of Officers. Any officer may resign at any time by delivering a written notice of resignation to the Board of Directors. Any officer elected or appointed by the Board of Directors may be removed by the Board of Directors with or without cause.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Vacancies. A vacancy in any office may be filled for the unexpired term by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>President/Chief Executive Officer. The President shall be the chief executive officer of the Corporation with, subject to limitations expressly set forth in these Bylaws, such powers and duties as Presidents of corporations usually have as well as those which from time to time may be assigned to him or her by the Board of Directors. Subject to the direction of the Board of Directors, the President shall supervise and direct the daily management of the business, affairs and property of the Corporation. The President shall be charged with overseeing that all orders and resolutions of the Board of Directors are carried into effect. The President, together with any Vice President, may sign and execute documents in the name of the Corporation including, but not limited to, checks and bank authorizations.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.7</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Vice President. Subject to limitations expressly set forth in these Bylaws, each Vice President shall have such powers and perform such duties as the board of Directors or the President may from time to time assign to him or her.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.8</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>The Treasurer. The treasurer shall be the chief financial officer of the Corporation and shall be in charge of the Corporation&apos;s books and accounts. Subject to the control of the Board of Directors, he or she shall have such other powers and perform such other duties as the Board of Directors or the President may from time to time assign to him or her.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.9</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>The Secretary. The Secretary shall be the Secretary of, and keep the minutes of, all meetings of the Board of Directors, shall be responsible for giving notice of all meetings of the Board of Directors, and shall keep the seal and, when authorized by the Board of Directors, apply it to any instrument requiring it. Subject to the control of the Board of Directors, he or she shall have such other powers and perform such other duties as the Board of Directors or the President may from time to time assign to him or her. In the absence of the Secretary from any meeting, the minutes shall be kept by the person appointed for that purpose by the presiding officer.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.10</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>The Executive Director and Employees. An executive director may have the responsibility for conducting the day-to-day operations of the Corporation and such other duties as the Board may assign him or her. He or she may have such other powers as the chief operating officer of a not-for-profit corporation usually has. Compensation for the Executive Director and other employees of the Corporation shall be determined by the Board.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5.11</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Duties. All officers, as between themselves and the Corporation, shall have such authority and perform such duties in the management of the Corporation as may be provided in these Bylaws, or, to the extent not so provided, as may be provided by resolution of the Board of Directors or, as to all other officers, by the President. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in these Bylaws, in order to be effective and binding upon the Corporation contractual documents must be executed by two (2) executive officers of the Corporation, and checks and bank authorizations must be executed by two (2) executive officers of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><designator>VI</designator><name>NOT-FOR-PROFIT COMPLIANCE</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Purpose. The Corporation is organized to <inline.instr>&lsqb;statement of purpose&rsqb;</inline.instr> and to engage in other related activities permissible for organizations qualifying under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="50l" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">section 50l(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</cite>, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Restriction of Activities. No part of the net earnings of the Corporation shall inure to the benefit of, or be distributable to, its members, directors, officers, or other private persons, except that the Corporation shall be authorized and empowered to pay reasonable compensation for services rendered and to make payments and distributions in furtherance of the purposes set forth in Section 6.1. No substantial part of the activities of the Corporation shall be the carrying on of propaganda, or otherwise attempting to influence legislation, and the Corporation shall not participate in, or intervene in (including the publishing or distribution of statements) any political campaign on behalf of or in opposition to any candidate for public office. Notwithstanding any other provision of these bylaws, the Corporation shall not carry on any other activities not permitted to be carried on (a) by an organization exempt from federal income tax under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</cite>, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code, or (b) by an organization, contributions to which are deductible under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="170" subref="(c)" pararef="(2)">section 170(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code</cite>, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6.3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Conflicts of Interest. No member of the Board of Directors, officer, member, or, except as provided in section 5.10 of these Bylaws, employee, shall derive any personal profit or gain, directly or indirectly, by reason of his or her association with the Corporation. Each individual shall disclose to the Board of Directors any personal interest which he or she, a family member or close business associate may have in any matter pending before the Corporation. Each Individual shall refrain from participation in any decision on such matter. Exceptions to this Bylaw may be made by decision of the Board provided the individual having the direct or indirect personal interest discloses it fully to the Board and refrains from participation in the discussion and voting with respect to such matter.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6.4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Dissolution. In the case of the dissolution of the Corporation or the winding up of its affairs, the Corporation shall discharge all its liabilities. Any assets remaining after all liabilities have been discharged shall be distributed for one or more exempt purposes within the meaning of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)">section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</cite>, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code, or shall be distributed to the federal government, or to a state or local government for a public purposes. Any assets not so disposed of shall be disposed of by a court of competent jurisdiction exclusively for such purposes or to such organizations as said court shall determine, which are organized and operated exclusively for such purposes.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><designator>VII</designator><name>INDEMNIFICATION OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>7.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Right to Indemnification. The Corporation shall indemnify any person who was or is a party, or is threatened to be made a party, to any action or proceeding by reason of the fact that such person is or was an Officer, Director, employee, or agent of this Corporation, or is or was serving at the request of this Corporation as a director, officer, employee, or agent of another foreign or domestic corporation, partnership, joint venture, or other enterprise, against expenses, judgment, fines, settlements, and other amounts actually and reasonably incurred in connection with such proceeding, to the fullest extent permitted under the New York State Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. The indemnification provided herein shall not be deemed exclusive of any other rights to which those indemnified may be entitled, and shall continue as to a person who has ceased to be an agent and shall insure to the benefit of the heirs, executors, and administrators of such a person.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>7.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Insurance. This Corporation may, and to the fullest extent practicable shall, purchase and maintain insurance on behalf of any Director, Officer, employee, or agent of the Corporation, against any liability asserted against or incurred by the Director, Officer, employee or agent in any such capacity or arising out of the Director&apos;s, Officer&apos;s, employee&apos;s, or agent&apos;s status as such, whether or not the Corporation would have the power to indemnify the agent against such liability under Section 7.1 of these Bylaws; provided, however, that the Corporation shall have no power to purchase and maintain such insurance to indemnify any Director, Officer, or agent of the Corporation for any self-dealing transaction.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><designator>VIII</designator><name>MISCELLANEOUS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>8.1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Fiscal Year. The fiscal year of the Corporation shall be the calendar year, unless otherwise determined by the Board.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>8.2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Contracts, Checks, Bank Accounts. The funds of the Corporation shall be deposited in the Corporation&apos;s name with such banks, trust companies or other depositories as the Board may designate. The Board of Directors shall determine who shall be authorized from time to time to sign checks, drafts or other orders for the payment of money, acceptances, notes or other evidences of indebtedness, to enter into contracts or to execute and deliver other documents and instruments.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>8.3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Annual Reports. The Board of Directors shall direct the President and Treasurer of the Corporation to present at each annual meeting of the Board of Directors a financial report in accordance with the requirements of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>8.4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Amendment. These bylaws may be amended, added to, rescinded or repealed at a meeting by a majority of the entire Board, except that any amendment which changes or strikes any provision specifying the quorum requirement or the proportion of votes necessary for the transaction of business or of any specified item of business must be authorized by a vote of two-thirds of the entire Board.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>8.5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|108|30:100"><form.text>Definition of &ldquo;entire Board.&rdquo; As used in these bylaws, the term &ldquo;entire Board&rdquo; means the total number of directors entitled to vote which the Corporation would have if there were no vacancies.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
