<section.body>
<form uuid="Id552c5f01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator><name>MEETINGS OF MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Annual Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The annual meeting of the members of the Corporation shall be held as provided in section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the Certificate of Incorporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Special Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>Special meetings of members may be called and held as provided by section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the Certificate of Incorporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Order of Business.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>At the annual meeting of the members the following is the order of business: <inline.instr>&lsqb;Specification of order of business&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator><name>DIRECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The directors of this corporation are elected as provided by Section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the Certificate of Incorporation, and vacancies in the board are filled as provided in that section.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The Board of Directors may adopt any rules and regulations for the conduct of their meetings and management of the affairs of the corporation that they may deem proper, not inconsistent with the laws of the State of New York, the Certificate of Incorporation, or these Bylaws.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>Meetings of the directors are called and held as provided by Section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the Certificate of Incorporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>All committees are appointed by the President and, if not so appointed, are appointed by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The Board of Directors shall also act as a committee on admissions for election to membership. All nominations of candidates for election to the association must be submitted to the directors for approval. No candidate may be presented for election at a meeting of the members until ratified and approved by at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the directors as provided in the charter.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator><name>OFFICERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The board of directors, immediately after the annual meeting, shall choose one of their number by a majority vote to be President, and likewise one to be Vice President, and another to be Treasurer. They shall also appoint some suitable person to be Secretary. Each of these officers shall serve for a term of one year or until the next annual election.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The President shall preside at all meetings of the Board of Directors and shall act as temporary chairperson at, and call to order, all meetings of the members. The President shall appoint and discharge agents and employees, subject to the approval of the board of directors. The President shall have the general management of the affairs of the corporation and perform all the duties incidental to his or her office.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The Treasurer has the care and custody of all the funds and securities of the corporation and shall deposit these funds in the name of the corporation in a bank or trust company chosen by the directors; the Treasurer shall, when duly authorized by the board of directors, sign and execute all contracts in the name of the corporation when countersigned by the President; the Treasurer shall also sign all checks, drafts, notes, and orders for the payment of money, which must be duly authorized by the board of directors and countersigned by the President; the Treasurer shall at all reasonable times exhibit his or her books and accounts to any director or member of the corporation upon application at the office of the corporation during ordinary business hours. At the end of each corporate year, the Treasurer shall have an audit of the accounts of the corporation made by a committee appointed by the President and shall present this audit in writing at the annual meeting of the members, at which time the Treasurer shall also present an annual report setting forth in full the financial condition of the corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The Secretary shall keep the minutes of the board of directors and also the minutes of the members. The Secretary has the custody of the seal of the corporation and shall affix and attest the same to documents when duly authorized by the board of directors. The Secretary shall attend to the giving and serving of all notices of the corporation and shall have charge of any books and papers that the board of directors directs; the Secretary shall attend to such correspondence as may be assigned to him or her and perform all the duties incidental to his or her office. The Secretary shall keep a book containing the names, alphabetically arranged, of all persons who are members of the corporation, showing their places of residence and the time when they became members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator><name>INSPECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>Two inspectors of election shall be elected at each annual meeting of members to serve for one year. If any inspector refuses to serve or is not present, the meeting may appoint an inspector in his or her place.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>V</designator><name>SEALS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The seal of the corporation is as follows:</form.text></form.para>
<form.line align="c"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Seal&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VI</designator><name>MISCELLANEOUS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>At the beginning of each corporate year, all surplus income remaining unexpended and in any excess of any obligation then incurred shall be added to the principal of the corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>All accumulated capital not already invested in the stock of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall be so invested that it may readily be transformed into cash for the purpose of purchasing stock or bonds of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> as from time to time may be possible.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>It being one of the objects of corporation to receive and hold, collect and preserve family portraits and heirlooms of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of family&rsqb;</inline.instr> and matter connected with the history of that family, and documents and books relating to the family (the &ldquo;articles&rdquo;), with power to add to and publish the same and to designate and maintain a place of deposit for receiving, holding, collecting, preserving, and exhibiting these articles, as an undivided collection, these articles, as they may, from time to time, be received, shall be preserved and exhibited as an undivided collection. If it ever is necessary, pursuant to law and the provisions of the Certificate of Incorporation, to sell or transfer these articles, they shall be sold as an undivided collection and in such a manner as will preserve, as far as may be under the conditions which may then exist, the spirit and intent of the Certificate of Incorporation. These articles shall not be distributed among various persons and places either by sale, loan, or otherwise.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>The place of deposit, designated by the members of the corporation at the annual meeting for receiving, holding, collecting, preserving, and exhibiting the articles mentioned in ARTICLE II, Section 3, and ARTICLE VIII of the Charter, and in ARTICLE VI, Section 3 of the bylaws shall be a proper place for the management, maintenance, and inspection of the same by the board of directors. The directors shall keep an inventory of the articles and subject to due preservation of these articles shall in their discretion permit inspection of the same. The directors shall report in writing at the annual meeting the condition of the articles and shall in such report recommend for designation the place of deposit of the articles.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>Pursuant to the provisions of Section 5 of the &ldquo;Second&rdquo; division of the Certificate of Incorporation of the corporation, the directors of the corporation, by the concurring vote of all and at least seven directors, are expressly authorized to take any and all action which in their judgment may be necessary or desirable to effectuate the following purposes and enumerated objects for which the corporation is formed:</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>To support, maintain, and educate a person or persons other than a member or members of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of family&rsqb;</inline.instr> and to contribute towards the maintenance of educational institutions otherwise than for the education of members of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of family&rsqb;</inline.instr> and to contribute to charitable and benevolent uses and to religious purposes, as from time to time the Board of Directors deems proper and desirable.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VII</designator><name>AMENDMENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><form.text>These bylaws may be amended at any meeting of the members by a vote of a majority of all the members of the corporation, provided that the proposed amendment is inserted in the notice of such meeting. A copy of the amended bylaw shall be sent to each member within <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days after its adoption.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>A meeting of the members shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of other business on a date fixed by or under the bylaws. Failure to hold the annual meeting on the date so fixed or to elect a sufficient number of directors to conduct the business of the corporation will not work a forfeiture or give cause for dissolution of the corporation, except as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law provisions relating to judicial dissolution in the event of deadlock among directors or members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;603(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="908">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;908</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>Special meetings of the members may be called by the board of directors and by such person(s) as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;603(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="897">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;897</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that directors shall be elected or appointed in the manner provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="703" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;703(b)</cite>. There is no prohibition in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law against holding an election for directors by mail.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="544">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;544</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>Regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice if the time and place of such meetings are fixed by the bylaws. Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;711(a)</cite>. Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to any director who submits a waiver of notice, whether before or after the meeting, or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to such meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the director signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;711(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board, unless required by the bylaws. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;711(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="595 to 607" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;595 to 607</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>4.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="712" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;712(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="592 to 594" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;592 to 594</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, and a treasurer and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary or the offices corresponding to them. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;713(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;713(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="531">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;531</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>The Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that if the bylaws require inspectors at any shareholders&apos; or members&apos; meeting, such requirement is waived unless compliance therewith is requested by a shareholder or member present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at such meeting. Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the board, in advance of the meeting, may appoint one or more inspectors to act at the meeting or any adjournment thereof, and if inspectors are not so appointed, the person presiding at the meeting may, and on the request of any shareholder or member entitled to vote thereat must, appoint one or more inspectors. In case any person appointed fails to appear or act, the vacancy may be filled by appointment made by the board in advance of the meeting or at the meeting by the person presiding thereat. Each inspector, before entering upon the discharge of his or her duties, must take and sign an oath faithfully to execute the duties of inspector at the meeting with strict impartiality and according to the best of his or her ability. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="610" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;610(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="926, 927" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;926, 927</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VII.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|109|30:101"><para.text>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602">N-PCL &sect;602</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="127">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;127</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:102</designator><name>Bylaws<sep/>Youth center</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5533b201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>BYLAWS OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CORPORATION&rsqb;</inline.instr></name></form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator><name>MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Membership.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The members of the Corporation consist of those persons who are members of the Board of Directors. A person elected to the Board of Directors thereby becomes a member, and such membership continues during the period that the member is a duly qualified and acting Director. Any Director who dies, resigns, fails reelection to the Board of Directors, or is for any reason removed from the Board of Directors shall thereby cease to be a member of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Rights of Members.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Property Rights.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>No member of the Corporation is entitled to any right or interest in or to the property or assets of the Corporation. All property and assets of the Corporation are subject to the direction, control of, and expenditure by the Board of Directors. If the Corporation is liquidated or dissolved or otherwise ceases business, the property and assets of the Corporation shall be distributed in accordance with the direction of a majority of the then qualified and acting Directors present at any meeting duly called for that purpose and without other affirmative action by the members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Voting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Each member of the Corporation is entitled to one vote in person or by proxy at any annual or special meeting of the members of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator><name>MEETINGS OF MEMBERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Annual and Special Meetings of Members.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The annual meeting of the members of the Corporation shall be held at a time and place designated by the Board of Directors and specified in the notice of that meeting. Special meetings of the members shall be held at a time and place designated by the Board of Directors and specified in the notice of that meeting. A notice of any annual or special meeting is sufficient if deposited in the mails not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> nor more than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days prior to the meeting, addressed to the members at the respective addresses appearing on the records of the Corporation, and notice of any and all meetings may be waived by members, in writing, orally, or by attendance at the meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Quorum.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>At any annual or special meeting of the members, <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the members, but if <inline.instr>&lsqb;names of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> be <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members or more, <inline.instr>&lsqb;names of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members constitute a quorum to transact any and all business.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator><name>DIRECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Number, Qualification, and Powers of Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The Board of Directors of the Corporation is identical and coextensive with and consists of the members and shall be not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;minimum number of members of board&rsqb;</inline.instr> nor more than <inline.instr>&lsqb;maximum number of members of board&rsqb;</inline.instr> members as, from time to time, may be elected by the members of the Corporation at any annual or special meeting called for the purpose of electing Directors. All power and authority of the Corporation is vested in the Board of Directors and its committees, and all or any part of that power and authority, in addition to the power and authority delegated by these Bylaws to the Executive Committee, may be delegated to those committees of the Board of Directors that the Board from time to time determines.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Vacancies.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Any member of the Board of Directors may resign by delivering his or her written resignation to the Secretary of the Corporation, and any member of the Board may be removed at any time by action of the Board. In case of any vacancy in the Board of Directors through death, disability, resignation, removal, or other cause, the remaining directors may elect his or her successor, who shall take office immediately and hold office for the unexpired portion of the term of the Director to whose place he or she is elected. The Board of Directors serving at any time is entitled to elect other persons to the Board of Directors and thereby to membership in the Corporation, subject to the foregoing limitation as to maximum and minimum numbers. The power to fill vacancies in the Board may be delegated to the Executive Committee, and the action by the Executive Committee in filling a vacancy is as effective as though taken by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Terms of Office.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The term of office of all Directors is unlimited.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator><name>MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Regular and Special Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The Board of Directors shall hold meetings at times and places and in accordance with notice, if any, as from time to time is determined by the Board of Directors. In addition, any officer of the Corporation may call a meeting of the Board of Directors upon 24 hours&apos; notice, delivered either by mail, personally, or by telephone. Any Director may waive any notice required to be given to him or her by law or under these Bylaws and by attendance at any meeting the director is deemed to have waived notice of that meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Conduct of Meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Three-fifths of the Board of Directors constitutes a quorum for the transaction of any business of the Corporation, provided, however, that if three-fifths be <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> directors or more, <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr> Directors constitutes a quorum for the transaction of any and all business.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>If less than a quorum of the Board of Directors is present at any meeting, the meeting may be adjourned to a time and place as those present determine.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>V</designator><name>COMMITTEES</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Executive Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The Board of Directors may elect from its members an Executive Committee that shall consist of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> or more members, as the Board may determine, to serve during the pleasure of the Board. The Executive Committee shall exercise the powers of the Board of Directors in the interim between meetings of the Directors, with general power to discharge the duties of the Board of Directors, except as that power which, from time to time, may be limited by the Board. Three members of the Executive Committee or such number as the Board may determine constitute a quorum for the transaction of business, and at any meeting at which a quorum is present, a majority of those present and acting may bind the committee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The Executive Committee shall keep books of separate minutes and report their action at every meeting of the Board of Directors or as often as they may be required by the Board.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Other Committees.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The Board of Directors, from time to time, may elect from its members other committees, which shall consist of a number that the Board deems advisable. Each such committee has the powers and shall perform the duties that are delegated to it by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Technical Advisory Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The Board of Directors, if it so desires, may select a Technical Advisory Committee of persons who need not be members of the Corporation which may counsel with and make recommendations to the Board of Directors with respect to the activities of this Corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VI</designator><name>OFFICERS</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Officers Designated.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The officers of the Corporation shall be elected by the Board of Directors to serve at the will of the Board of Directors. The officers of the Corporation, in addition to such other officers as may, from time to time, be elected by the Board of Directors (all of which officers shall be members of the Board, except Assistant Secretaries, if any, and Assistant Treasurers, if any) consist of the following:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Honorary Chair of the Board of Directors</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Chair of the Board of Directors</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>President</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Executive Vice President</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Four or more Vice Presidents</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Secretary</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Such number of Assistant Secretaries as may be selected</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Treasurer</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>Such number of Assistant Treasurers as may be selected</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>All such officers have the authority and duties as are, from time to time, prescribed by the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors, in its discretion, may leave unfilled any office except that of President. One person may hold more than one office.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Election of Officers.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>The officers shall be elected at any meeting of the Board of Directors. The officers so elected at any such meeting shall take office immediately and shall hold office at the will of the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VII</designator><name>AMENDMENTS</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><form.text>These Bylaws may be amended, altered, repealed, or superseded, either in whole or in part, by the affirmative action of a majority of the members or Directors present at any meeting of the members or Directors, at which meeting a quorum of members or Directors is present and acting, provided that notice of the matter is included in the notice of the meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation may have one or more classes of members or, in the case of a charitable corporation, may have no members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;601(a)</cite>. If a corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation and characteristics of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;601(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>If the corporation has members, membership may be effected and evidenced by: (1) signature on the certificate of incorporation; (2) designation in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws; (3) membership certificate or card or capital certificate; or (4) such method, including, but not limited to the foregoing, as is prescribed by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;601(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="823">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;823</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>I</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2(b).</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide, either absolutely or contingently, that the members of any class shall not be entitled to vote or may limit or define the matters on, and the circumstances in, which a member or a class of members shall be entitled to vote, and, except as otherwise provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, such provisions of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws shall prevail, according to their tenor, in all elections and in all proceedings over the provisions of Chapter 6 of the Law which authorize any action by the members, but no such denial, limitation, or definition of voting rights shall be effective unless, at the time, one or more classes of members, singly or in the aggregate, are entitled to full voting rights. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="612">N-PCL &sect;612</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="916">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;916</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>Meetings of members may be held at such place, either within or outside the state, as may be fixed by or under the bylaws or, if not so fixed, at the office of the corporation in the state. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;603(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>Special meetings of the members may be called by the board of directors and by such person(s) as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;603(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="897, 908" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;897, 908</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>II</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>Members entitled to cast a majority of the total number of votes at a meeting will constitute a quorum at the meeting, provided that when a specified item of business is required to be voted on by a class of members, voting as a class, members entitled to cast a majority of the total votes entitled to be cast by such class will constitute a quorum for the transaction of such specified items of business. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="608" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;608(a)</cite>. The certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may provide for any lesser quorum not less than the members entitled to cast 100 votes or one-tenth of the total number of votes entitled to be cast, whichever is lesser, and may, under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="615">N-PCL &sect;615</cite>, provide for a greater quorum. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="608" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;608(b)</cite>. The members present may adjourn the meeting despite the absence of a quorum. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="608" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;608(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="912">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;912</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>Except as otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, each not-for-profit corporation must have a board of directors and the affairs of the corporation must be managed by or under the direction of the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="701" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;701(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that, in addition to any other liabilities imposed by law on directors of a corporation, directors who vote for, or concur in, any of certain enumerated actions will be jointly and severally liable to the corporation for the benefit of the corporation and its creditors, members, or other interested persons to the extent of any injury suffered by those persons as a result of the action. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="719">N-PCL &sect;719</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="71">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="683 et seq." secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;683 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>III</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>3.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>The bylaws provide that the term of office of all directors is unlimited. This provision grows out of the requirement that to be a member, one must be a member of the board of directors. However, this provision must be used cautiously because the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provides that the term of office of directors, other than those elected or appointed by virtue of their office or former office in the corporation or other entity, public or private, is not to exceed five years. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="703" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;703(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="550">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;550</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>Regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice if the time and place of such meetings are fixed by the bylaws. Special meetings of the board of directors must be held on notice to the directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;711(a)</cite>. Notice of a meeting need not be given to any alternate director nor to any director who submits a waiver of notice whether before or after the meeting or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior to such meeting or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director. Such waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the director signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;711(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>The bylaws may prescribe what will constitute notice of a meeting of the board. A notice or waiver of notice need not specify the purpose of any regular or special meeting of the board, unless required by the bylaws. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="711" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;711(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="595 to 607" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;595 to 607</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>IV</designator></name.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>2.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, a majority of the entire board of directors constitutes a quorum, provided that the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may fix the quorum at less than a majority of the entire board if, in the case of a board of 15 members or less, the quorum is at least one-third of the entire number of members, and, in the case of a board of more than 15 members, the quorum must be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction thereof) in excess of 15. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="707">N-PCL &sect;707</cite>. See also <cite type="case">Desuzia v. Board of Directors of Concourse Village, Inc., 117 A.D.3d 426, 985 N.Y.S.2d 48 (1st Dep&apos;t 2014)</cite>, stating that a supermajority quorum requirement may be imposed through corporate bylaws.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="605">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;605</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference></item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>V.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="712" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;712(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="592 to 594" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;592 to 594</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VI.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;713(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers or some of them subject to approval by the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;713(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="531">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;531</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>ARTICLE</label><designator>VII.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|110|30:102"><para.text>The board of directors has the power to make, alter, and repeal the bylaws unless that power is reserved to the members in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, but bylaws made by the board may be altered or repealed and new bylaws may be made by the members. The members may prescribe in the bylaws that any bylaw made by them shall not be altered or repealed by the board. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602">N-PCL &sect;602</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="127">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;127</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:103</designator><name>Bylaws<sep/>Nonprofit trade association</name></outline.name.block>

<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>

<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
