<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|115|30:107"><para.text>A club organized for pleasure, recreation, and other nonprofitable purposes will not be exempt from taxation for any taxable year if, at any time during such taxable year, the charter, bylaws, or other governing instrument of the organization or any written policy statement of the organization contains a provision that provides for discrimination against any person on the basis of race, color, or religion. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(i)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(i)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|115|30:107"><para.text>If the corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation and characteristics of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;601(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3401">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3401</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:108</designator><name>Corporate membership program</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55536f01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>There is hereby established a corporate membership on the following terms and conditions:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>A corporation or other legal business entity may apply through its authorized officer or agent to the board of directors for membership of the entity itself, with the privilege of designating certain of its officers and/or employees as entitled to make use of the corporate membership.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>A corporation or other legal business entity shall make application for corporate membership on a form to be provided by <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> for this purpose. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: Neither a proposer nor a seconder shall be required.&rsqb;</inline.instr> The application form shall inquire as to how many officers and/or employees of the applicant entity the applicant proposes to designate as users of the membership. A minimum number of designated users as set forth in Subsection (i) of this <inline.instr>&lsqb;Article/Section&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall be required.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>The applicant entity shall submit with the application for corporate membership the following items:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(1)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>A completed <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> membership application form for each corporate officer or employee it proposes to designate as a user of the membership. The sponsor portion of the form shall be executed by the corporation. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: A seconder shall not be required.&rsqb;</inline.instr> That portion of the form regarding membership classification requested shall be answered with the word &ldquo;Corporate.&rdquo;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(2)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>The corporation&apos;s check in payment of the initiation fee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>The board of directors shall fix the corporate membership initiation fee and/or the component factors of it and may raise or lower the same at any time, with or without advance notice or posting. The Board may also at its discretion offer any discount in connection with such corporate membership initiation fees.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(e)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>An application for corporate membership shall not be acted upon by the board of directors until notice of the application, including the names and positions of the proposed users of the corporate membership shall have been posted on the <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> bulletin board for not less than two (2) weeks. During such time, any member may file in writing with the secretary a signed protest against the application in any particular, and the secretary shall present such protest to the board of directors before the application is acted upon.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(f)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>Board approval of an application for corporate membership shall be subject to the same provision respecting other applications for membership contained in these bylaws <inline.instr>&lsqb;citation of bylaw&rsqb;</inline.instr>; that is, three (3) negative votes shall reject an applicant, and no rejected applicant shall again apply for membership within one (1) year after the date of such rejection.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(g)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>Upon approval of the application, the secretary shall promptly notify the corporation of the same and shall request payment of the first full month&apos;s dues for the proposed number of users of the corporate membership. On receipt of such dues, the secretary shall promptly issue individual membership cards in the name of the corporate member on which the name of the designated user of the membership shall be stated.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(h)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>Corporate membership dues, exclusive of any tax, will be fixed by the board of directors. Changes shall not become effective until the proposed new schedule of dues has been posted for 30 days on the <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> bulletin board and published at least once in the <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> bulletin.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(i)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>A corporate member shall not be liable for dues for the entity itself, but only for its designated users. At all times, however, the corporate member must have designated at least three (3) users of the membership, whose dues are paid by the corporate member or by the user individually; if less than the minimum number of users is designated, the corporate member shall be liable for the difference in dues. The minimum number of designated users required under this agreement may be raised or lowered prospectively by the board of directors without notice.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(j)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>A corporate member may change a designated user of the membership at any time by written notice and request to the Secretary, which request must include a completed <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> membership application form as provided in Subsection (c)(1) of this Section. No request for change of a designated user of the corporate membership will be acted upon by the board of directors until the name and position of the proposed user shall have been posted on the <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> bulletin board for not less than two (2) weeks. During such time, any member may file in writing with the Secretary a signed protest against the proposed designated user, and the Secretary shall present such protest to the Board before the request is acted upon. If no written protest is received during the two-week posting period, no Board action on the request shall be necessary. In either event, when the change in designated user is authorized or permitted, the Secretary shall inform the corporate member of the change and request that the membership card of the person whose designated membership is to be terminated be delivered to the <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> business office. Upon receipt of such card, a corporate membership card bearing the name of the newly designated user will be issued. A charge may be imposed for this procedure.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(k)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>At the option of the corporate member, dues assessed and charges incurred by its designated users may be billed to the corporate member or to the designated users of the membership individually, but, in the latter event, the corporate member shall be responsible for payment of the account of any of its designated users that becomes delinquent.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(l)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>Designated users of corporate membership shall have all the rights and privileges of, and shall be subject to all responsibilities of, individual <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> membership. For purposes of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> elections and general and special membership meetings, each designated user of a corporate membership shall have one vote, provided such person is otherwise qualified to vote. The corporate member as an entity shall have no voting rights. If a designated user is ordered expelled pursuant to the disciplinary procedures set forth in these bylaws, the corporate member must promptly designate another user or forego designating a user in such person&apos;s place for the time being and must take steps to insure as best it can that the expelled party does not subsequently make use of the corporate membership.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(m)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>A person who has been a corporate member&apos;s designated user for at least one (1) year and whose designated use of such membership is thereafter terminated by the corporate member may, at any time within six (6) months of the date of such termination, apply for individual <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of incorporated club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of incorporated association&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> membership in the classification for which such person is then qualified by submitting a completed membership application to the board of directors. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: Neither a proposer nor a seconder shall be required, but the fact that the applicant was previously a designated user of a corporate membership (which shall be identified) must be noted on the face of the application.&rsqb;</inline.instr> The applicant may either attach the appropriate initiation fee to the application or request waiver of such fee, which request may be granted in whole or in part in the discretion of the board of directors at the time the application is acted upon. The application shall not be subject to posting requirements. Upon acceptance, the individual&apos;s dues rate shall be adjusted according to the person&apos;s new membership classification, and a new membership card shall be issued upon receipt of the appropriate initiation fee, if any.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(n)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><form.text>The provisions set forth in this <inline.instr>&lsqb;Article/Section&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall prevail with respect to corporate membership over any conflicting provisions of these bylaws respecting membership generally.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|116|30:108"><para.text>If the corporation has two or more classes of members, the designation and characteristics of each class and the qualifications and rights of, and limitations upon, the members of each class may be set forth in the certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or, if the bylaws so provide, a resolution of the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="601" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;601(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3401">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3401</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="823">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;823</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:109</designator><name>Entrance fees, dues, and assessments</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5555e001b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>ENTRANCE FEES AND DUES ARTICLE</name></form.name.block>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>The Governing Committee may fix the entrance fees of regular members and the time of payment of these fees from time to time in such amounts as it may determine or to waive these fees.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>The yearly dues of regular members are:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>For those who are <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years old&rsqb;</inline.instr> years of age or more, &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of annual dues&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>For those who are <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years old&rsqb;</inline.instr> years of age or more and less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years old&rsqb;</inline.instr> years of age, &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of annual dues&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>For those who are <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years old&rsqb;</inline.instr> years of age or more and less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years old&rsqb;</inline.instr> years of age, &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of annual dues&rsqb;</inline.instr>; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>For those who are less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years old&rsqb;</inline.instr> years of age, &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of annual dues&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>The age of a member on the <inline.instr>&lsqb;ordinal number of day&rsqb;</inline.instr> of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> of each year determines the amount of dues payable by the member for that year. Dues for the year are due on the first day of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> and, at the option of a member, may be paid either in full in that month or in four equal quarterly installments on the first days of <inline.instr>&lsqb;names of months&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>Officers of the Army and Navy on active service are exempted from the payment of entrance fees and, when stationed or residing in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of place&rsqb;</inline.instr>, shall pay quarterly dues of &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of quarterly dues&rsqb;</inline.instr>, and when stationed or residing more than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of miles&rsqb;</inline.instr> miles from <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of place&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall pay quarterly dues of &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of quarterly dues&rsqb;</inline.instr>. These quarterly dues are payable in advance on the first days of <inline.instr>&lsqb;names of months&rsqb;</inline.instr> of each year. The station or residence of an Army or Navy member on the first day of each of these months determines that member&apos;s status as to the amount of dues he or she must pay for the succeeding three months. Upon retirement from active service, officers shall pay dues as provided in Section 2 of this Article, provided that the Governing Committee may in its discretion remit in whole or in part the dues of an officer. Officers of the Regular Army and Navy of the United States elected prior to <inline.instr>&lsqb;identification of year&rsqb;</inline.instr> are exempt from the payment of dues.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>Members called for training or service in the Armed Forces of the United States may, upon application to the Secretary, be granted during their term of service the same reduction in dues enjoyed by officers of the Army and Navy when on active service.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>The Governing Committee may, upon request, grant to members engaged in a civilian capacity by the government for defense work the same reduction in dues enjoyed by members in the Armed Forces of the United States when on active service.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>Candidates elected between the dates for the payment of dues shall pay, in addition to the entrance fee, dues pro rata from the first of the month in which he or she shall be elected until the next following date fixed for the payment of dues.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>The Governing Committee may remit, in whole or in part, the dues of regular members who are members of the diplomatic corps of the United States while on foreign service.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>The entrance fees shall be reserved and accumulated as a separate fund and shall be applied only as the Governing Committee, by a three-quarter vote of those present at a meeting, shall determine.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.line align="l">ASSESSMENTS ARTICLE</form.line>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><form.text>It is the duty of the Governing Committee, from time to time, to determine the necessity for and the amount of assessments, if any, and present the same to the members for approval, in accordance with Article <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of article&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the Certificate of Incorporation.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><para.text>Dues, fees, assessments, and similar payments made to a social or recreational club are not deductible. This applies whether the club is used for personal purposes (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="262">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;262</cite>) or business purposes. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(a)(3)</cite>. This is an exception to the general rule that ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the operation of a business are deductible. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="162" subref="(a)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;162(a)</cite>. The prohibition applies to clubs organized for &ldquo;business, pleasure, recreation, or other social purpose.&rdquo; It applies even to clubs used solely for the benefit of employees. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(e)" pararef="(4)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(e)(4)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><para.text>A possible exception may exist for payments to &ldquo;clubs&rdquo; that are really associations directly organized for the furtherance of a business purpose. If such an association does not offer the customary amenities of a club&mdash;dining and recreational facilities&mdash;the costs should be deductible as business expenses.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><para.text>Contributions to a club do not qualify as deductible donations for income tax purposes. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(a)(3)</cite>. An exception may also exist here if the organization is not really a social or recreational club but is devoted to some purpose for which a charitable contribution is permitted under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="170" subref="(b)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;170(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|117|30:109"><para.text>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated therein, a corporation may levy initiation fees, dues, and assessments on its members, whether or not they are voting members, and may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;507(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3400">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3400</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3401">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3401</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="828, 829" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;828, 829</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:110</designator><name>Entrance fees, dues, and assessments<sep/>Penalties on failure to pay</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55585101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>PENALTIES ARTICLE</name></form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"><form.text>Any member who fails to pay the second installment of his or her entrance fee when due, or the dues for the current quarter year, or an assessment, within <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days after the amount due becomes payable, shall cease to be a member, subject to the provisions of Article <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of article&rsqb;</inline.instr>, Section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"><form.text>Any member who fails to pay any other amount due the Club exceeding &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of sum due&rsqb;</inline.instr>, for <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days after notice of the indebtedness and a request to pay the amount due has been given to that member shall cease to be a member, subject to the provisions of Article <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of article&rsqb;</inline.instr>, Section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"><form.text>In default of a member inscribing in a book, to be kept in the office, a mail address for forwarding notices prescribed or directed by the Constitution or the Rules, notices may be addressed to the member at the Club. The member is deemed to have received any notice <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days after it was mailed or deposited.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"><para.text>Dues, fees, assessments, and similar payments made to a social or recreational club are not deductible. This applies whether the club is used for personal purposes (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="262">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;262</cite>) or business purposes. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(a)(3)</cite>. This is an exception to the general rule that ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the operation of a business are deductible. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="162" subref="(a)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;162(a)</cite>. The prohibition applies to clubs organized for &ldquo;business, pleasure, recreation, or other social purpose.&rdquo; It applies even to clubs used solely for the benefit of employees. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(e)" pararef="(4)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(e)(4)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"><para.text>A possible exception may exist for payments to &ldquo;clubs&rdquo; that are really associations directly organized for the furtherance of a business purpose. If such an association does not offer the customary amenities of a club&mdash;dining and recreational facilities&mdash;the costs should be deductible as business expenses.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"><para.text>Contributions to a club do not qualify as deductible donations for income tax purposes. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="274" subref="(a)" pararef="(3)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;274(a)(3)</cite>. An exception may also exist here if the organization is not really a social or recreational club but is devoted to some purpose for which a charitable contribution is permitted under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-code" titleref="26" secref="170" subref="(b)">26 U.S.C.A. &sect;170(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|118|30:110"><para.text>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated therein, a corporation may levy initiation fees, dues, and assessments on its members, whether or not they are voting members, and may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;507(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3400">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3400</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3401">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3401</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="828, 829" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;828, 829</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:110.90</designator><name>Dues</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>The annual dues for the next calendar year for each membership classification shall be established by a vote of the members at the preceding <inline.instr>&lsqb;identification of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr> meeting of members. Statements for dues will be issued on or before <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of issuance&rsqb;</inline.instr> of each year, due on or before <inline.instr>&lsqb;due date of payment&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the statement year. Dues for new members shall be due upon acceptance into membership, in such amount as shall be set by the Executive Board, but not to exceed the amount set by the membership for the applicable class of member.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3400">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3400</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3401">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3401</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:111</designator><name>Disciplinary proceedings against members</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id555d3301b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|120|30:111"><form.text>Any member may at any time be expelled without cause assigned by the vote of two-thirds of the remaining members of the association at any regularly called meeting of the members.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|120|30:111"><para.text>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;507(a)</cite>. Additionally, the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;507(c)</cite>. See also <cite type="case">Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep&apos;t 2011)</cite>, holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation&apos;s bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507">N-PCL &sect;507</cite> requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members&apos; voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|120|30:111"><para.text>Generally, members will be held bound by the corporate regulations and bylaws respecting disciplinary action or expulsion. <cite type="case">Kendrick v. Watermill Beach Club, Inc., 8 Misc. 2d 798, 165 N.Y.S.2d 1009 (Sup 1957)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|120|30:111"><para.text>A possible alternative to a noticed hearing conducted by the corporation is a bylaw that requires binding arbitration. For discussion and forms concerning arbitration, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="12A:1 et seq." secrange="y">&dblsect;12A:1 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3402">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3402</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="830 et seq." secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;830 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:112</designator><name>Disciplinary proceedings against members<sep/>Suspension and expulsion</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id555fa401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>ARTICLE <inline.instr>&lsqb;NUMBER OF ARTICLE&rsqb;</inline.instr> DISCIPLINE OF MEMBERS</name></form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.1</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Any member who shall violate any provision of these Bylaws, the House Rules, or any other rule or regulation duly adopted by the Board of Directors, or who shall do anything calculated to disturb the order, peace, or harmony of the Club or to impair the good name of the Club shall be deemed guilty of conduct unbecoming a member and may be reprimanded, suspended, fined, and/or expelled. Such action shall affect all persons deriving Club privileges through such member.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.2</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Filing Charges.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.2(a)</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>A Club member in whose presence another member engages in conduct unbecoming a member may file with the House Committee a charge in writing designating the time, place, and circumstances of such unbecoming conduct.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.2(b)</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>The General Manager may file with the House Committee a written charge of unbecoming conduct against a member when he or she is informed of facts constituting a breach of Section 2.1 of this ARTICLE.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.2(c)</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>The Board of Directors may direct the House Committee to determine whether there exists reasonable cause to believe that a member has engaged in unbecoming conduct. If the House Committee so finds, it shall proceed as provided in Section 2.3 of this ARTICLE.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.3</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Hearing and Procedure.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.3(a)</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Whenever a complaint is filed charging conduct unbecoming a member and is determined to be sufficient by the House Committee or whenever the House Committee determines that a written complaint shall issue, the House Committee shall give written notice to the accused, stating the substance of the charge in concise terms and requesting the accused member to appear at a hearing before the Committee to be held not sooner than three (3) days and not later than thirty (30) days from the date of the notice. At such hearing, the accused shall have the right to appear, to have counsel, to have the complaint read in his or her presence, to confront witnesses against him or her, to produce witnesses on his or her own behalf, and to testify. In making its evidentiary determination, the Committee shall find the charge of conduct unbecoming a member either proven or not proven, and, if proven, it shall recommend to the Board of Directors, in accordance with Section 2.4 of this Article, such punishment of the member as, in its judgment, may be proper.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.3(b)</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>The hearing need not be conducted in accordance with legal rules of evidence, and any relevant evidence, whether or not admissible in a court of law, shall be admissible at a House Committee hearing.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.3(c)</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>A verbatim record of the proceedings before the House Committee may be caused to be made by the accused member at his or her own expense.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.4</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Within fifteen (15) days after the meeting at which the House Committee has found the charge of conduct unbecoming a member proven, the Committee shall make a report and recommendation to the Board of Directors, a copy of which will be given to the accused member in person or by certified mail.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.5</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Within five (5) days of the receipt by the accused member of the report and recommendation of the House Committee, the accused member may appeal in writing to the Club Secretary and request that the Board of Directors review the report and recommendation. Failure to request such a review within the five-day period shall constitute a waiver of any right to a review before the Board of Directors, which shall then implement the recommendation of the House Committee. In the event a Board review is requested by the accused member, the Board of Directors shall set a date and time certain for the same and shall notify the accused member thereof in writing. The accused member shall have the right to be represented by counsel. The Board of Directors shall render its final determination within fifteen (15) days following its review, and the report of such determination shall be made in writing to the House Committee, with a copy given to the accused member in person or by certified mail. The action of the Board of Directors shall be final and not reviewable, provided that no member shall be expelled, nor shall he or she be suspended for a period in excess of sixty (60) days, except on the affirmative vote of nine (9) or more members of the Board. Any member who fails to comply with the decision of the Board shall ipso facto cease to be a member of the Club.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.6</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Failure of the accused member to appear at the designated hearing of the House Committee, as provided in Section 2.3(a) of this Article, shall be deemed a voluntary confession and a plea of guilty to the charges set forth in the complaint.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.7</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Each member of the Club waives any right to personal redress against the House Committee or against the Board of Directors for disciplinary action taken under this ARTICLE.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.8</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>In grave and unusual cases, where immediate action must be taken to protect the welfare of any member of the Club, the President, the Chairperson of the House Committee, or any person specifically designated by either one of them may summarily suspend a member&apos;s Club privileges. In such cases, the suspended member may request a hearing before the House Committee to be held within seventy-two (72) hours to determine whether such suspension should be continued.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.9</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>A member suspended under this Article remains liable for all dues and other charges for which he or she would be liable were the suspension not imposed.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.10</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Any nonmember who shall, in the opinion of the House Committee, commit a breach of Section 2.1 of this Article may be dealt with summarily by the House Committee in such manner as it may deem appropriate. The action of the House Committee under this section shall be final and not reviewable.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>1.11</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><form.text>Discipline of any member shall be only as described in this ARTICLE. No member shall be immune from the disciplinary procedures and sanctions set forth in this ARTICLE because of office or position in the Club or because of the type of membership held.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><para.text>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;507(a)</cite>. Additionally, the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;507(c)</cite>. See also <cite type="case">Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep&apos;t 2011)</cite>, holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation&apos;s bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507">N-PCL &sect;507</cite> requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members&apos; voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><para.text>Generally, members will be held bound by the corporate regulations and bylaws respecting disciplinary action or expulsion. <cite type="case">Kendrick v. Watermill Beach Club, Inc., 8 Misc. 2d 798, 165 N.Y.S.2d 1009 (Sup 1957)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|121|30:112"><para.text>A possible alternative to a noticed hearing conducted by the corporation is a bylaw that requires binding arbitration. For discussion and forms concerning arbitration, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="12A:1 et seq." secrange="y">&dblsect;12A:1 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3402">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3402</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="830 et seq." secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;830 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:113</designator><name>Disciplinary proceedings against members<sep/>Member&apos;s indebtedness</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55648601b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>INDEBTEDNESS ARTICLE</name></form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><form.text><inline.instr>&lsqb;On the first day of each month/As soon after that day as may be practicable&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a notice with request for payment of the member&apos;s indebtedness to the Club on the last day of the preceding month shall be sent to each member with a request to pay the same at the member&apos;s earliest convenience.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><form.text>Any member whose indebtedness by the foregoing Section exceeds &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of debt&rsqb;</inline.instr> and who fails to pay the indebtedness in full for <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days after notice and a request to pay has been given to the member shall incur the penalty imposed by Article <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of article&rsqb;</inline.instr>, Section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the Constitution.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><form.text>Any member whose indebtedness exceeds &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of debt&rsqb;</inline.instr> on the expiration of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days after the first day of any month between <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month 2&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall have his or her credit and supplies suspended by the House Committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><form.text>If a member becomes indebted to the Club in the sum of &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of debt&rsqb;</inline.instr> or over, his or her further credit and supplies shall be suspended until the entire amount due is paid in full.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><form.text>No vouchers shall be delivered to members for inspection or otherwise until members have paid their bills.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><form.text>A member of the Club in good standing may obtain from the Club a sum not exceeding &dollar;<inline.instr>&lsqb;dollar amount of check&rsqb;</inline.instr> in one day on a check drawn or endorsed by that member and presented in person by him or her after or on the date of the check. The <inline.instr>&lsqb;Treasurer/Assistant Treasurer&rsqb;</inline.instr>, whenever he or she deems it advisable, may suspend this privilege as to any one or more members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><para.text>If authorized by its certificate of incorporation or bylaws and subject to any limitations stated in such documents, a corporation may impose reasonable fines or other penalties upon its members for violations of its rules and regulations. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;507(a)</cite>. Additionally, the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may contain such provisions as are deemed necessary to enforce fines or other penalties, including provisions for the termination of membership, upon reasonable notice, for nonpayment of such fines or other penalties. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;507(c)</cite>. See also <cite type="case">Abraham v. Diamond Dealers Club, Inc., 80 A.D.3d 461, 914 N.Y.S.2d 152 (1st Dep&apos;t 2011)</cite> holding that nonprofit diamond-trading corporation&apos;s bylaw providing for automatic suspension of board members for failure to pay dues was inconsistent with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="507">N-PCL &sect;507</cite> requiring reasonable notice of suspension, and thus members&apos; voting rights could not be automatically suspended for nonpayment of dues.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><para.text>Generally, members will be held bound by the corporate regulations and bylaws respecting disciplinary action or expulsion. <cite type="case">Kendrick v. Watermill Beach Club, Inc., 8 Misc. 2d 798, 165 N.Y.S.2d 1009 (Sup 1957)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|122|30:113"><para.text>A possible alternative to a noticed hearing conducted by the corporation is a bylaw that requires binding arbitration. For discussion and forms concerning arbitration, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="12A:1 et seq." secrange="y">&dblsect;12A:1 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
</note.group>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:113.50</designator><name>Suspension or termination of membership</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>In the event the Board elects to initiate proceedings to suspend a member&apos;s privileges or terminate a membership, it must notify the member, in writing, of its intention to suspend or terminate and the alleged cause therefore. If the member, within <inline.instr>&lsqb;text number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> (<inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr>) days of the date of the notice, makes a written request for a hearing to contest the proposed suspension or termination, the Board President must set a time for hearing, which must be within <inline.instr>&lsqb;text number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> (<inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr>) days of the date of receiving the request for hearing. The hearing must be open to all members. The Board President or a member appointed by the Board President must preside over the meeting and establish the meeting procedures. The affirmative vote of a <inline.instr>&lsqb;text fraction of Board&rsqb;</inline.instr> (<inline.instr>&lsqb;fraction of Board&rsqb;</inline.instr>) majority of the full Board will be required in order to effect a suspension or termination of a membership and its privileges.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3402">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3402</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:114</designator><name>Meetings</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5566f701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>MEETINGS OF MEMBERS</name></form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>One</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Annual Meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><form.text>An annual meeting of the members shall be held at <inline.instr>&lsqb;location of annual meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr> on the <inline.instr>&lsqb;ordinal number of day&rsqb;</inline.instr> in the month of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> in each year, beginning with the year at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of annual meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, for the purpose of electing directors and for the transaction of other business that may come before the meeting. If the day fixed for the annual meeting is a legal holiday in the State of New York, the meeting shall be held on the next succeeding business day. If the election of directors is not held on the day designated for the annual meeting or at any adjournment of the annual meeting, the board of directors shall cause the election to be held at a special meeting of the members as soon after the annual meeting as conveniently maybe.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Two</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Special Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><form.text>Special meetings of the members may be called by the President, the board of directors, or not less than one-tenth of the members having voting rights.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Three</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Place of Meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><form.text>The board of directors may designate any place, either within or without the State of New York, as the place of meeting for any annual meeting or for any special meeting called by the board of directors. If no designation is made or if a special meeting is otherwise called, the place of meeting shall be the principal office of the corporation in the State of New York, but, if all of the members meet at any time and place, either within or without the State of New York, and consent to the holding of a meeting, that meeting shall be valid without call or notice, and at that meeting any corporate action may be taken.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Four</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Notice of Meetings.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><form.text>Written or printed notice stating the place, day, and hour of any meeting of members shall be delivered, either personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at the meeting, not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> nor more than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days before the date of the meeting, by or at the direction of the President, the secretary, the officers, or persons calling the meeting. In case of a special meeting or when required by statute or by these bylaws, the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called shall be stated in the notice. If mailed, the notice of a meeting shall deemed to be delivered when deposited in the United States mail addressed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the records of the corporation, with postage on the notice prepaid. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member&apos;s fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>One.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><para.text>A meeting of the members shall be held annually for the election of directors and the transaction of other business on a date fixed by or under the bylaws. Failure to hold the annual meeting on the date so fixed or to elect a sufficient number of directors to conduct the business of the corporation will not work a forfeiture or give cause for dissolution of the corporation, except as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law provisions relating to judicial dissolution in the event of deadlock among directors or members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;603(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3409 to 3413" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3409 to 3413</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="908">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;908</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Two.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><para.text>Special meetings of the members may be called by the board of directors and by such person(s) as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. In any case, a special meeting of members entitled to vote may be called by such members having one-tenth of the votes entitled to be cast at such meeting. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;603(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="897">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;897</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Three.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><para.text>Meetings of members may be held at such place, either within or outside the state, as may be fixed by or under the bylaws or, if not so fixed, at the office of the corporation in the state. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="603" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;603(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="908">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;908</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Four.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><para.text>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member&apos;s fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="605" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;605(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|123|30:114"><para.text>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member&apos;s authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting, shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="606">N-PCL &sect;606</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="901 to 907" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;901 to 907</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:114.50</designator><name>Annual and special meetings</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text><underscore>Annual Meetings</underscore>. An annual meeting of the members shall be held once each year for the election of Directors and the transaction of other business, if any, on a date to be determined by the Members. No notice is required.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para><form.text><underscore>Special Meetings.</underscore> The members may, at any time, call a special meeting on a date to be determined by the members to fill a vacancy or vacancies on the Board of Directors, to remove one or more Directors with or without cause, to elect new directors, or to transact other business, if necessary, on a date to be determined by the members. No notice is required.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3409 to 3413" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3409 to 3413</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:115</designator><name>Voting agreements</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55696801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|124|30:115"><form.text>Any number of members may enter into a written agreement providing that, in exercising any voting rights, the votes they are entitled to cast as members of the club shall be voted as provided in the agreement, or as they may agree, or as determined in accordance with a procedure agreed on by them.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|124|30:115"><para.text>This provision is based on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="619">N-PCL &sect;619</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|125|30:116"><form.text>Any vote of the Members may be conducted by mail or electronic communications, if and when legally permitted, as determined by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:116.50</designator><name>Proxies</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>Every proxy must be executed in writing by the member or by his or her attorney-in-fact. No proxy shall be valid after the expiration of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of months&rsqb;</inline.instr> months from the date thereof, unless otherwise provided in the proxy. Every proxy shall be revocable at the pleasure of the member executing it.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3413">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3413</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:117</designator><name>Appointment of inspectors of elections</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55732c01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"><form.text>At any members&apos; meeting or any adjournment of such meeting, not more than <inline.instr>&lsqb;maximum number of inspectors&rsqb;</inline.instr> nor less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;minimum number of inspectors&rsqb;</inline.instr> inspectors of election shall be duly appointed to act at such meeting by the <inline.instr>&lsqb;President/acting chairperson of the meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>. Such inspectors shall be appointed from among <inline.instr>&lsqb;the members present at the meeting/&lsqb;number of members&rsqb; members&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"><form.text>Each inspector so appointed, before entering upon the discharge of his or her duties, shall take and sign an oath faithfully to execute the duties of inspector at such meeting with strict impartiality and according to the best of his or her ability. The oath shall be administered by the <inline.instr>&lsqb;President/acting chairperson of the meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"><form.text>The inspectors shall determine the number of votes represented at the meeting; the existence of a quorum; and the authenticity, validity, and effect of proxies for such votes. They shall receive votes, ballots, or consents and shall hear and determine all challenges and questions in any way arising in connection with the right to vote at such meeting. They shall count and tabulate all votes or consents, determine the results, and perform such further services as may be proper to insure fairness to all members. The decision, act, or certificate of a majority of the inspectors shall be effective in all respects as the decision, act, or certificate of all.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"><form.text>On request of <inline.instr>&lsqb;the chairperson of any meeting/any member or his or her proxy&rsqb;</inline.instr>, the inspectors shall make a report in writing of any challenge on matters determined by them and shall execute a certificate of any fact found by them. Any report or certificate made by any such inspector shall be prima facie evidence of the facts stated in it.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"><para.text>Unless the bylaws otherwise provide, the board may, in advance of a members&apos; meeting, appoint one or more inspectors to act at the meeting or any adjournment of such meeting. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="610" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;610(a)</cite>. The above form provides for appointment of inspectors by the presiding officer from among those members present at the meeting. The oath faithfully to execute the duties of inspector at such meeting with strict impartiality and according to the best of his or her ability is required by statute. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="610" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;610(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"><para.text>If inspectors are not appointed pursuant to the bylaws or fail to qualify, the person presiding at a members&apos; meeting may and on the request of any member entitled to vote thereat must make the appointment. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="610" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;610(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|126|30:117"><para.text>The duties of inspectors are set forth in the statute. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="610" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;610(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3410">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3410</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="926, 927" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;926, 927</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:118</designator><name>Approval of executive compensation</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
