</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55759d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|127|30:118"><form.text>No salary or other compensation for services to the <inline.instr>&lsqb;club/association/corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> as an officer of the <inline.instr>&lsqb;club/association/corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall be paid unless and until such salary or other compensation has been approved by affirmative <inline.instr>&lsqb;majority/&lsqb;fraction of votes&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> vote <inline.instr>&lsqb;of members present/of the entire voting membership&rsqb;</inline.instr> at a duly held meeting of the members.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|127|30:118"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation is permitted to pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3390">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Payment of premiums by corporation on corporate officer&apos;s life insurance policy as affecting right to policy" volref="56" pageref="1086">Payment of premiums by corporation on corporate officer&apos;s life insurance policy as affecting right to policy, 56 A.L.R.3d 1086</cite> (secs. 3(a), 3(b) superseded in part by <cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr7" titlename="Construction and Application of &ldquo;Key Man&rdquo; Life Insurance" volref="12" pageref="Art. 6">Construction and Application of &ldquo;Key Man&rdquo; Life Insurance, 12 A.L.R.7th Art. 6</cite>).</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Test in stockholders&apos; actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation" volref="53" pageref="358">Test in stockholders&apos; actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation, 53 A.L.R.3d 358</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:118.50</designator><name>Provision against discrimination in selection of directors</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>Members of the Board of Directors will be selected without regard to gender, race, color, culture, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender expression or mental or physical disability.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3421">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3421</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

The Board may adopt such rules and regulations, not inconsistent with the Certificate of Incorporation or the Bylaws or applicable laws, as it may deem proper for the conduct of its meetings and the management of the Corporation.</form.text></form.para>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:119.50</designator><name>Powers of directors<sep/>Execution of contracts</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>The Board of Directors, except as otherwise provided in these Bylaws, may authorize any officer(s) or agent(s) in the name of and on behalf of the Corporation, to enter into any contract or execute and deliver any instrument and such authority may be general or confined to specific instances but, unless so authorized by the Board of Directors or expressly authorized by these Bylaws, no officer, agent or employee shall have any power or authority to bind the Corporation by any contract or engagement or to pledge its credit or to render it liable pecuniarily in any amount for any purpose.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:120</designator><name>Staggered terms of office</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id557f6101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|129|30:120"><form.text>The board of directors of the club shall consist of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members divided into <inline.instr>&lsqb;two/three&rsqb;</inline.instr> classes, each class to be as nearly equal in number as is possible. The term of office of directors of the first class shall expire at the first annual meeting of members after their election, <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: and&rsqb;</inline.instr> that of the second class shall expire at the second annual meeting after their election <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: and that of the third class shall expire at the third annual meeting after their election&rsqb;</inline.instr>. At each annual meeting after such classification, the number of directors equal to the number of the class whose terms expire at time of such meeting shall be elected to hold office until the <inline.instr>&lsqb;second/third&rsqb;</inline.instr> succeeding annual meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|129|30:120"><para.text>The minimum number of directors of a not-for-profit corporation is set by statute at three. Subject to that limitation, the bylaws must specify the number of directors or make provision to enable the members or the board to fix the number. In the absence of such a provision, the number of directors will be three. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="702" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;702(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|129|30:120"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that directors elected or appointed at large shall be divided into either two, three, four, or five classes for the purpose of staggering their terms of office and that all or some of the directors elected or appointed otherwise than at large shall be divided into the same or a different number of classes, not exceeding five, for the same purpose. All classes shall be as nearly equal in number as possible and, if provision has been made for cumulative voting, no class shall include less than three directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="704" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;704(a)</cite>. The terms of office of the directors initially classified shall be as follows: (1) that of the first class shall expire at the next annual meeting of members if there be members or of the board if there be no members; (2) the second class at the second succeeding annual meeting; or (3) the third class, if any, at the third annual meeting, and so on. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="704">N-PCL &sect;704</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3420">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3420</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="537, 541" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;537, 541</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:120.50</designator><name>Conflict of interest</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>Whenever a director has a financial or personal interest in any matter coming before the board of directors, the affected person must fully disclose the nature of the interest and withdraw from discussing. lobbying. and voting on the matter. Any transaction or vote involving a potential conflict of interest will be approved only when a majority of disinterested directors determine that it is in the best interest of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of organization&rsqb;</inline.instr> to do so. The minutes of meetings at which such votes are taken must record such disclosure, abstention, and reasons for approval.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3420">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3420</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:121</designator><name>Participation in directors&apos; meeting by conference telephone or electronic communication</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5581d201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|130|30:121"><form.text>Members of the board of directors or of any committee of the board of directors <inline.instr>&lsqb;may participate and act/are prohibited from participating and acting&rsqb;</inline.instr> at any meeting of the board or such committee through the use of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|130|30:121"><para.text>Unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any one or more members of the board or of any committee thereof who is not physically present at a meeting of the board or a committee may participate by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means will constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="708" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;708(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3423">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="602">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;602</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:122</designator><name>Informal action by directors</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55844301b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|131|30:122"><form.text>With the exceptions subsequently noted, any action required to be taken at a meeting of the board of directors or a committee of the board may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing or electronic, setting forth the action so taken, is signed or transmitted by all of the directors entitled to vote with respect to the subject matter under consideration or by all the members of such committee, as the case may be, provided that such procedure shall not be employed and shall not be effective to <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;amend/enlarge/repeal&rsqb; these bylaws/elect any officer/to fill any vacancy on the board of directors/&lsqb;specification of other event&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|131|30:122"><form.text>The consent shall be evidenced by one or more written approvals, each of which sets forth the action taken and bears the signature of one or more directors. All the approvals evidencing the consent shall be delivered to the secretary to be filed in the corporate records. The action taken shall be effective when all the directors have approved their consent unless the consent specifies a different effective date.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|131|30:122"><para.text>Unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken by the board or any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board or the committee consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail or other electronic means and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the board or committee. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="708" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;708(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3423">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="602">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;602</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:122.50</designator><name>Action by unanimous consent</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>Any action required or permitted to be taken by the Board of Directors, or any committee thereof (&ldquo;Committee&rdquo;), may be taken without a meeting if all members of the Board or the Committee consent in writing to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the Board or Committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the Board or Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3423">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:123</designator><name>Directors&apos; meetings</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5586b401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|132|30:123"><form.text>Every action or decision done or made by the board of directors shall be done or made at a meeting duly called and held as provided in the certificate of incorporation and these bylaws, and no action or decision shall be done or made by unanimous written consent in lieu of a meeting.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|132|30:123"><para.text>This provision is based on <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="708" subref="(b)">N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;708(b)</cite>, which provides that unless otherwise restricted by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken by the board or any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board or the committee consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means including, but not limited to, facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail or other electronic means and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the board or committee.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3423">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="595">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;595</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:123.40</designator><name>Removal</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>A member of the Board of Directors who is deemed to be no longer fit to serve on the Board of Directors will be removed by a <inline.instr>&lsqb;percentage of vote&rsqb;</inline.instr>&percnt; vote of the entire Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3420">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3420</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3421">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3421</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:123.50</designator><name>Vacancies</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Vacancies on the Board may be temporarily filled by Presidential nomination and elected by the Board. Directors elected under this provision will serve until the next annual meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>Vacancies of Elected Director seats will be permanently filled by election at the next annual meeting. Directors elected to fill a vacancy will serve the remaining term of the seat vacated.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3422">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3422</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

<analytical.level>
<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator><name>Officers</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:124</designator><name>Powers and duties of officers</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id558e0701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><name>President</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>The President shall be the principal executive officer and, subject to the control and direction of the Board, shall in general supervise and control all of the day-to-day social, charitable and business affairs of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>. He or She shall preside at all meetings of the directors. The President shall have authority, subject to such rules as may be prescribed by the Board, to appoint such agents and employees of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> as he or she shall deem necessary, to prescribe their powers, duties, and compensation, and to delegate authority to them. Such agents and employees shall hold office at the discretion of the President and the Board. The President shall have authority to sign, execute, and acknowledge, on behalf of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>, all deeds, mortgages, bonds, contracts, leases, and all other agreements, documents, and instruments necessary or proper to be executed in the course of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>&apos;s regular activities or business, or which shall be authorized by the Board.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><name>Vice Presidents</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>In the absence of the President, or in the event of the President&apos;s death, inability, or refusal to act, or in the event for any reason it shall be impracticable for the President to act personally, a Vice President (or in the event there be more than one Vice President, the Vice Presidents in the order designated by the Board, or in the absence of any designation, then in the order of their appointment) shall perform the duties of the President, and when so acting, shall have all the powers of and be subject to all the restrictions on the President. Any Vice President may sign, with the Secretary or Assistant Secretary, certificates representing interests in <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>, if the issuance thereof shall have been authorized by the Board; and shall perform such other duties and have such authority as from time to time may be delegated or assigned to him or her by the President or the Board. The execution of any agreement, document, or instrument of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> by any Vice President shall be conclusive evidence, as to third parties, of the Vice President&apos;s authority to act in the stead of the President.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><name>Secretary</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>The Secretary shall:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(i)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>keep (or cause to be kept) regular minutes of all meetings of the Board and all resolutions adopted by action of the directors or the Board in one or more books provided for that purpose;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(ii)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>use his or her best efforts to ensure that all notices are duly given in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement or as required by law;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(iii)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>be custodian of the records of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(iv)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>sign with the President, or a Vice President, certificates representing interests in <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>, if the issuance thereof shall have been authorized by the Board; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(v)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>in general perform all duties incident to the office of Secretary and have such other duties and exercise such authority as from time to time may be delegated or assigned to him or her by the President or by the Board.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><name>Treasurer</name></name.block></head>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>The Treasurer shall:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(i)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>have charge and custody of and be responsible for all funds and securities of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(ii)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>receive and give receipts for moneys due and payable to <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> from any source whatsoever, and deposit all such moneys in the name of <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> in such banks, trust companies, or other depositaries as shall be selected by <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of social organization&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(iii)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><form.text>in general perform all of the duties incident to the office of Treasurer and have such other duties and exercise such other authority as from time to time may be delegated or assigned to him or her by the President or by the Board.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|133|30:124"><para.text>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more vice-Presidents, a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;713(a)</cite>. The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;713(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3423">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:125</designator><name>Powers and duties of Vice Presidents</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id559a3c01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|134|30:125"><form.text>The Vice Presidents of the club, in the order of their seniority and rank, shall be <inline.instr>&lsqb;titles of officers&rsqb;</inline.instr>. Each Vice President shall have the authority and duties and shall perform the functions consonant with his or her department and area of interest, specified by the <inline.instr>&lsqb;board of directors/executive committee/&lsqb;title of entity&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>. In case of the inability of the President to act on account of absence, illness, or for any other reason, the President&apos;s power shall be assumed and duties discharged during the period of such inability or absence by the senior Vice President available, and the acts of the Vice President, duly authorized and performed under such conditions, shall be the acts of and shall be binding on the club. If a Vice President who has temporarily assumed the duties of the President is unable for any reason to continue to perform such duties, the same shall be performed by the Vice President next in seniority who is available for the purpose. A Vice President who acts as President under this bylaw shall report fully to the President and to the <inline.instr>&lsqb;board of directors/executive committee/&lsqb;title of entity&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> on the President&apos;s return to duty with respect to all actions taken and transactions accomplished by him or her during the absence or disability of the President.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|134|30:125"><para.text>The board may elect or appoint a chair or President, or both, one or more Vice Presidents, a secretary, a treasurer, and such other officers as it may determine or as may be provided in the bylaws. These officers may be designated by such alternate titles as may be provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;713(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|134|30:125"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation or a bylaw adopted by the members may provide that all officers or that specified officers shall be elected by the members instead of by the board, or it may authorize the President to appoint the other officers, or some of them, subject to approval by the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;713(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<form uuid="Id559f1e01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"><form.text>The Secretary shall keep or cause to be kept in permanent form an accurate record of all transactions of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"><form.text>The Secretary shall send due notice of all meetings to members; notice of at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days shall be provided prior to <inline.instr>&lsqb;type of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr> meetings.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"><form.text>The Secretary shall notify all committee members of their appointments and the duties assigned to them.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"><form.text>The Secretary shall notify all applicants for membership of the action taken by <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"><form.text>The Secretary shall keep a correct list of members, together with their current addresses and shall supply application forms to prospective members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|135|30:126"><form.text>The Secretary shall act as custodian of all papers of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> and its committees.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>

<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:127</designator><name>Salary</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>

</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55a40001b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|136|30:127"><form.text>No officer of the corporation shall receive, directly or indirectly, any salary, compensation, or emolument from the corporation, either as an officer or in any other capacity unless authorized by the concurring vote of two-thirds of all the directors or by the vote or written consent of not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the Executive Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|136|30:127"><para.text>A corporation may pay reasonable compensation to its members, directors, and officers for services rendered. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>

<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Test in stockholders&apos; actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation" volref="53" pageref="358">Test in stockholders&apos; actions as to reasonableness of compensation of corporate officers who as directors determine own compensation, 53 A.L.R.3d 358</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:128</designator><name>Duties of officers</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55a67101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>OFFICERS ARTICLE</name></form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"><form.text>The Officers of the Club consist of a President, a Vice President, a Secretary, an Assistant Secretary, a Treasurer, and an Assistant Treasurer. The Governing Committee shall elect the Officers annually from its own body. The Officers shall hold office until the second <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> in <inline.instr>&lsqb;identification of year&rsqb;</inline.instr>, next succeeding, and until their successors are respectively elected and assume their duties of office.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"><form.text>The President, or in the President&apos;s absence, the Vice President, shall preside at all meetings of the Club and of the Governing Committee. In the absence of both, those present at a meeting shall elect their own presiding officer.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"><form.text>The Secretary, or in the Secretary&apos;s absence, the Assistant Secretary, shall keep the records of the Club. The Secretary shall give notice of all meetings of the Club and of the Governing Committee, shall keep minutes of such meetings, and shall notify persons elected to membership of their election.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"><form.text>The Treasurer, or in the Treasurer&apos;s absence, the Assistant Treasurer, shall collect all monies payable to the Club, shall keep the accounts of the Club, shall report on these accounts monthly to the Governing Committee, and prepare the annual report to be presented by the Governing Committee at the annual meeting of the members. The Treasurer shall pay all bills incurred in the operation of the Club on the approval of the House Committee or of such other Committee as the Governing Committee may, from time to time, designate. The Treasurer&apos;s accounts shall be audited annually.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"><form.text>The President, or the Vice President, shall, with the Secretary or the Assistant Secretary, or the Treasurer or the Assistant Treasurer, sign all written contracts and obligations of the Club and, when so authorized by the Governing Committee, shall execute under their hands and seals, notes, bonds or other evidences of indebtedness, and shall sign, execute, and deliver deeds, conveyances, bills of sale, mortgages, or other pledges of any or all Club property, real or personal.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"><para.text>Directors, officers and key persons must discharge the duties of their respective positions in good faith and with the care an ordinarily prudent person in a like position would exercise under similar circumstances.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"><para.text>The factors set forth in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="552" subref="(e)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &sect;552(e)(1)</cite> (Standard of conduct in managing and investing an institutional fund), if relevant, must be considered by a governing board delegating investment management of institutional funds pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="514">N-PCL &sect;514</cite> (Delegation of investment management). <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="717" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;717(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|137|30:128"><para.text>In discharging their duties, directors, officers and key persons acting in good faith may rely on information, opinions, reports, or statements, including financial statements and other financial data, in each case prepared or presented by: (1) one or more officers or employees of the corporation whom the director believes to be reliable and competent in the matters presented; (2) counsel, public accountants, or other persons as to matters which the directors, officers or key persons believe to be within such person&apos;s professional or expert competence; or (3) a committee of the board upon which they do not serve, duly designated in accordance with a provision of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, as to matter within its designated authority, which committee the directors, officers or key persons believe to merit confidence, as long as in so relying they shall be acting in good faith and with the proper degree of care. Persons shall not be considered to be acting in good faith if they have knowledge concerning the matter in question that would cause such reliance to be unwarranted. Persons who so perform their duties shall have no liability by reason of being or having been directors, officers or key persons of the corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="717" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;717(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3426">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3426</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="683 et seq." secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;683 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:129</designator><name>Duties of officers<sep/>Two or more offices held by the same person</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55a8e201b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|138|30:129"><form.text>Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of <inline.instr>&lsqb;titles of officers&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|138|30:129"><para.text>Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and secretary, or the offices corresponding to them. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;713(a)</cite>. This restriction apparently is imposed so that no officer may execute, acknowledge, or verify any instrument in more than one capacity if the instrument is required by law or by the bylaws to be executed, acknowledged, or verified by two or more officers.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3424">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3425">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3425</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="531">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;531</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:129.50</designator><name>Term of office</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text><underscore>Officers shall be elected at the first meeting of the Board of Directors and thereafter at each</underscore> Annual Meeting of the Board of Directors. Unless a longer or shorter term is provided in the resolution of the Board of Directors electing an Officer, the term of office of each Officer shall extend to the next Annual Meeting and until the Officer&apos;s successor is elected.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3424">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3425">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3425</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:130</designator><name>Limitation of terms</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55ab5301b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|139|30:130"><form.text>No officer may be elected for more than two successive terms.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|139|30:130"><para.text>Each officer shall hold office for the term for which he or she is elected or appointed and until his or her successor has been elected or appointed and qualified. Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, all officers shall be elected or appointed annually. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="713" subref="(c)">N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;713(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3424">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3425">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3425</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="531">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;531</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:131</designator><name>Removal of officers</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55adc401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|140|30:131"><form.text>All Executive Officers are subject to removal at any time by the affirmative vote of a majority of the authorized directors then in office. All other officers and all heads of departments, managing directors, managers, assistant managers, agents, and employees of the association may be removed at any time by the officer appointing them or by any other superior officer or any committee or board authorized by the Board of Directors or Executive Committee.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|140|30:131"><para.text>Any officer elected or appointed by the board may be removed by the board with or without cause. An officer elected by the members may be removed, with or without cause, only by vote of the members, but the authority to act as an officer may be suspended by the board for cause. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="714" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;714(a)</cite>. The removal will be without prejudice to the contract rights, if any, of the person so removed. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="714" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;714(b)</cite>. Election or appointment of an officer will not of itself create any contract rights. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="714" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;714(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3424">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="566 to 568" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;566 to 568</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:131.50</designator><name>Resignation of officers</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form>
<form.para><form.text>Any officer may resign at any time by giving written notice to the Chairperson or the <inline.instr>&lsqb;title of other officer&rsqb;</inline.instr>. Any such resignation will take effect at the time specified therein or, if no time be specified, then upon delivery.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3424">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3424</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|141|30:132"><form.text>A vacancy in any office, because of death, resignation, removal, disqualification or otherwise, may be filled by the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para>

<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>(5)</designator><name>Governing Committee</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:133</designator><name>Powers and duties of governing committee</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55b78801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.unit>
<form.item><head><name.block><name>GOVERNING COMMITTEE</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>The Governing Committee consists of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the Club and is divided into <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of classes&rsqb;</inline.instr> equal classes, and the terms of office of those constituting the oldest class expire on the second <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> of each <inline.instr>&lsqb;identification of year&rsqb;</inline.instr> or when their successors are elected.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>The Governing Committee is entitled to fill all vacancies in the Committee until the next annual election.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>At each annual meeting of the Club, or at an adjourned annual meeting of the Club, there shall be elected to the Governing Committee <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members to replace the out-going class, who shall hold office for <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of years&rsqb;</inline.instr> years, and any further members necessary to fill vacancies in unexpired terms, who shall hold office until the end of those terms.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>At the monthly meeting of the Governing Committee held in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of month&rsqb;</inline.instr> in each year, the President shall, with the approval of the Governing Committee, appoint a Committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of which <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> may be a member of the Governing Nominating Committee, to nominate candidates for election to the Governing Committee at the next annual meeting of the Club. The Nominating Committee shall post its nominations on the bulletin board in the Office of the Club at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days before the date of the annual meeting. Other nominations may be made on the petition of not less than <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members, and these other nominations shall be posted on the bulletin board in the Office of the Club at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of days&rsqb;</inline.instr> days before the annual meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>The election of members of the Governing Committee is held by ballot, and for that purpose, the polls are open from <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of opening&rsqb;</inline.instr> to <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of closing&rsqb;</inline.instr> on the day of the annual meeting. The President shall appoint <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of inspectors&rsqb;</inline.instr> inspectors of election who shall receive and canvass the ballots and certify the result to the Secretary. The candidates receiving the largest number of votes up to the number of candidates required to fill vacancies in the outgoing and any other class are elected. In case the certificate of the inspectors shows that all the vacancies in the Governing Committee have not been filled at the election, the meeting shall be adjourned for <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of weeks&rsqb;</inline.instr> weeks at which adjourned meeting the election to fill those vacancies shall proceed as in this Constitution provided.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>Any member of the Governing Committee who is absent from <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of regular meetings&rsqb;</inline.instr> consecutive regular meetings, unless he or she previously obtained permission from the Committee or presents at the next regular meeting an excuse for his or her absence satisfactory to the Committee, will be removed from the Committee and ceases to be a member of the Committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>7</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>The Governing Committee shall meet once a month except during the months of <inline.instr>&lsqb;names of months&rsqb;</inline.instr>. Special meetings may be called by order of the President or of the House Committee or at the request of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of the Governing Committee. A majority of its members constitutes a quorum of the Governing Committee at its meetings.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>8</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>The Governing Committee of the Club shall present at the annual meeting of the members a report, verified by the President and Treasurer, or by a majority of the Governing Committee, showing the whole amount of real and personal property owned by it, where the property is located, and where and how it is invested, the amount and nature of the property acquired during the year immediately preceding the date of the report, and the manner of the acquisition, the amount applied, appropriated, or expended during the year immediately preceding the date of the report, and the purposes, objects, or persons to or for which applications, appropriations, or expenditures have been made, and the names and places of residence of the persons who have been admitted to membership during the year. This report shall be filed with the records of the association and an abstract of the report shall be entered in the minutes of the proceedings of the annual meeting at which the report is presented.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><head><name.block><name>POWERS OF THE GOVERNING COMMITTEE</name></name.block></head>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>The Governing Committee has general charge, control, and management of the affairs, funds, and property of the Club. It is entitled and shall carry out the purposes of the Club according to law and as provided in this Constitution, and, specifically, it is entitled to construe this Constitution and sole power to authorize the borrowing or investing of money on behalf of and for the purposes of the Club and to authorize and direct the execution of any documents necessary to that end.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>The Governing Committee shall elect annually from its own body the officers as provided in Article <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of article&rsqb;</inline.instr>, Section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>The Governing Committee shall appoint annually the following Committees:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>A</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>A House Committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members, at least <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members of whom, including the Chairperson, must be members of the Governing Committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>B</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>A Library Committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>C</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>An Art Committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>D</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>A Squash Committee of <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of members&rsqb;</inline.instr> members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>E</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>Any other committees as the Governing Committee may, from time to time, in its discretion, deem advisable.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>Without in any way limiting the general powers of the Governing Committee, the Committee&apos;s powers include the following power and authority:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>A</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To admit rules for their own government.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>B</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To admit members and to expel or to suspend them by ballot; a two-thirds vote of the entire Governing Committee expelling, and a majority vote of those present at a meeting suspending.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>C</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To prescribe rules for the admission of strangers.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>D</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To prescribe rules for the use of the Club by the members and for their conduct in the Club House.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>E</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To fix penalties for violation of the rules and to enforce the same.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>F</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To expel, suspend, or otherwise discipline a member for cause, including any conduct which in the opinion of the Governing Committee is improper and prejudicial to the Club. Any action under this section may be revoked or modified by subsequent vote of the Governing Committee.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>G</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To remit penalties and to suspend the operation of the penalties provided in Article <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of article&rsqb;</inline.instr> by extending the time within which a member&apos;s indebtedness must be paid.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>H</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To call special meetings of the Club, the purposes of which shall be stated in the call for the meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>I</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To fix from time to time initiation fees and dues.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>J</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><form.text>To alter or rescind any rule.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit></form.item></form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><para.text>The &ldquo;Governing Committee&rdquo; is in effect the board of directors of this club.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|142|30:133"><para.text>The certificate of incorporation, the bylaws, or the board may create committees of the board, each consisting of three or more directors. The board will appoint the members of such committee of the board, except that in the case of any executive committee or similar committee however denominated, the appointment will be made by a majority of the entire board, provided that in the case of a board of 30 members or more, the appointment will be made by at least three-quarters of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time. In addition, the bylaws may provide that directors who are the holders of certain positions in the corporation must be ex-officio members of specific committees. To the extent provided in the resolution or in the certificate of incorporation or in the bylaws, each committee will have and may exercise all the authority of the board, with certain important exceptions enumerated in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="712" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;712(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3423">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3423</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="592 to 594" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;592 to 594</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
</section.block>
</analytical.level.body>
</analytical.level>
<analytical.level>
<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>(6)</designator><name>Adoption of Bylaws</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:134</designator><name>Resolution adopting bylaws<sep/>By directors</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55bedb01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"><form.text>No bylaws having been adopted governing the conduct of the internal affairs of this club, and the set of bylaws presented to this meeting being suitable for the purpose and their adoption being in the best interests of the club,</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"><form.text>It is therefore resolved on this <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of resolution&rsqb;</inline.instr>, that the bylaws presented to this meeting become the bylaws of this club effective immediately.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"><form.text>It is further resolved that the bylaws be authenticated as such by the certificate of the secretary of this club and placed in the club&apos;s minute book. It is further resolved that a full and true copy of the bylaws, certified by the secretary, be kept at the principal office of the club for inspection by shareholders at all reasonable times during business hours.</form.text></form.para>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Names of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"><para.text>The initial bylaws may be adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting and, if no so adopted by the incorporators, by the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;602(a)</cite>. The power to alter, amend or repeal the bylaws or to adopt new bylaws is vested in the members and, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, also in the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;602(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|143|30:134"><para.text>For purposes of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, the initial bylaws of a corporation adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting (or by the board if not so adopted by the incorporators) will be deemed to have been adopted by the members. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;602(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="118">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;118</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:135</designator><name>Resolution adopting bylaws<sep/>By members</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id55c3bd01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|144|30:135"><form.text>It is resolved that the members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of resolution&rsqb;</inline.instr>, approve and adopt the bylaws presented to this meeting of the members as the bylaws of the corporation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|144|30:135"><form.text>It is further resolved that the bylaws be authenticated as such by the secretary of this corporation and placed in its minute book and that a full and true copy of the bylaws, certified by the secretary, be kept at the principal office of the corporation for inspection by members at all reasonable times during business hours.</form.text></form.para>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Names of members&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|144|30:135"><para.text>The initial bylaws may be adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting and, if no so adopted by the incorporators, by the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;602(a)</cite>. The power to alter, amend, or repeal the bylaws or to adopt new bylaws is vested in the members and, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, also in the board of directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;602(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|144|30:135"><para.text>For purposes of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law, the initial bylaws of a corporation adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting (or by the board if not so adopted by the incorporators) will be deemed to have been adopted by the members. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;602(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="118">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;118</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
