<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Corporate seal&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>A corporation, when authorized by the board of directors, may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation without making any amendment or change thereby, except that it may include any one or more of the amendments or changes which may be authorized by the board without a vote of shareholders or members. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;805(a)</cite>. In the alternative, a corporation may restate in a single certificate the text of its certificate of incorporation as amended by the restated certificate, to effect any one or more of the amendments or changes authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, when authorized by the statutory provision (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="802">N-PCL &sect;802</cite>) governing amendment or change. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;805(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>Any amendment or change under these sections of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law (<cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805">N-PCL &sect;805</cite>) is subject to any other section, not inconsistent with these sections, which would be applicable if a separate certificate were filed to effect the amendment or change. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;805(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>The fee for filing a restated certificate of incorporation, which is subject to change, is currently &dollar;30. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104-A" subref="(h)">N-PCL &sect;104-A(h)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>The Department of State will make, certify, and transmit electronically a copy of the restated certificate of incorporation to the county in which the office of the corporation is located. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="104" subref="(g)">N-PCL &sect;104(g)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>Upon filing by the Department of State, the original certificate of incorporation will be superseded, and the restated certificate of incorporation, including any amendments and changes made to it, will be the certificate of incorporation of the corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(f)">N-PCL &sect;805(f)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>For form drafting principles drafting principles for a restated certificate of incorporation, see <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:42">&sect;30:42</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3374">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Paragraph</label><designator>4.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>If the restated certificate restates the text of the certificate of incorporation as amended or changed thereby, then the restated certificate should include a statement that the certificate of incorporation is amended or changed to effect one or more of the amendments or changed authorized by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, specifying each such amendment or change and that the text of the certificate of incorporation, as amended previously, is thereby restated as further amended or changed to read as therein set forth in full. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(b)" pararef="(4)">N-PCL &sect;805(b)(4)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>A restated certificate of incorporation need not include statements as to the incorporator(s) or as to the first directors. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="805" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;805(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|202|30:191"><para.text>See <cite type="case">Nathan Littauer Hospital Ass&apos;n v. Spitzer, 287 A.D.2d 202, 734 N.Y.S.2d 671 (3d Dep&apos;t 2001)</cite> (reservation of enumerated powers contained in not-for-profit hospital&apos;s restated certificate of incorporation to its newly created parent corporation was not a change in, elimination of, or addition to corporate powers, such as would trigger Supreme Court review and approval of proposed affiliation of corporation with another corporation under newly created common parent).</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3374">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="156, 157" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;156, 157</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
</section.block>
</analytical.level.body>
</analytical.level>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:192</designator><name>Members&apos; resolution to amend bylaws</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id5690d101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"><form.text>Whereas, Article <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of article&rsqb;</inline.instr>, Section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the Bylaws of this corporation provides as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;recitation of bylaw&rsqb;</inline.instr>; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"><form.text>Whereas, it is deemed to be in the best interest of the corporation to amend the above-quoted bylaw in order that <inline.instr>&lsqb;description of reasons for amendment&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"><form.text>Resolved, by <inline.instr>&lsqb;majority/&lsqb;fraction of votes&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> vote of the members, that Article <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of article&rsqb;</inline.instr>, Section <inline.instr>&lsqb;number of section&rsqb;</inline.instr> of the Bylaws of this corporation be and hereby is amended so as to read as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;recitation of amended bylaw&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"><para.text>Subject to any limitations on the right to vote specified in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="612">N-PCL &sect;612</cite>, bylaws of a not-for-profit corporation may be adopted, amended, or repealed by the members at the time entitled to vote in the election of directors and, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws adopted by the members, by the board. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="602" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;602(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|203|30:192"><para.text>Where the board of directors has not been precluded from amending the bylaws, the above resolution may be adapted for use in such a situation.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="127">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;127</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:195</designator><name>Directors&apos; resolution to amend bylaws</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>

<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56982401b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"><form.text>WHEREAS, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> is a New York not-for-profit corporation subject to the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"><form.text>WHEREAS, the Nonprofit Revitalization Act, which was signed into law on December 18, 2013, made several changes to the provisions of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law relating to corporate governance of New York not- for-profit corporations, including but not limited to authorizing notice and waiver of notice of Board meetings by electronic means, prohibiting employees from serving as Board chair, and requiring that the Board or a designated audit committee comprising independent directors oversee accounting and financial reporting processes and annual audits; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"><form.text>WHEREAS, in light of the foregoing, the Board wishes to amend its Bylaws to reflect the changes to the Nonprofit Revitalization Act;</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"><form.text>NOW THEREFORE, it is hereby</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the Amended and Restated Bylaws in the form attached hereto as Exhibit <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of exhibit&rsqb;</inline.instr> be, and hereby are, approved, ratified and adopted as and for the Bylaws of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> (the &ldquo;Bylaws&rdquo;), and that the Secretary of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> be, and hereby is, instructed to file a copy of such Bylaws in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>&apos;s minute book; and it is further</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|206|30:195"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the officers of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> be, and each of them hereby is, authorized and directed to take any and all further action and to execute, deliver and file any and all instruments and documents in the name and on behalf of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, and to pay any and all fees and expenses, as in his or her judgment may be necessary or advisable in order to carry out the intent and purpose of the foregoing resolutions.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3384">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>6</designator><name>Merger or Consolidation</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:197</designator><name>Plan of merger</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MRG</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id569f7701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>PLAN OF MERGER</name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>Plan of merger of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>One</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>The names of the constituent corporations are <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr>. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: If the name of any constituent corporation has been changed add the following: The name under which &lsqb;&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;&rsqb; was formed is &lsqb;name of corporation when formed&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>The name of the surviving corporation is <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of surviving corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Two</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>As to each constituent corporation, the membership and holders of any certificates evidencing capital contributions or subventions, including their number, classification, and voting rights are as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of required information for each constituent corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Three</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>The terms and conditions of the proposed merger, including the manner and basis of converting membership or other interest in each constituent corporation into membership or other interest in the surviving corporation, or the cash or other consideration to be paid or delivered in exchange for membership or other interest in each constituent corporation are as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of terms and conditions of merger&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Four</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>The certificate of incorporation of the surviving corporation will contain the following amendments or changes after the merger: <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;Specification of amendments&rsqb;/&lsqb;Specification of changes&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Five</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>This plan shall become effective on approval by the members of the corporation, either by unanimous written consent, in compliance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614">Section 614 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, or by affirmative vote of at least two-thirds of the members of the corporation, in compliance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="613" subref="(c)">Section 613(c) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Six</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>The proposed merger shall become effective upon the filing of the certificate of merger by the Department of State, unless, prior to delivery of such certificate to the Department of State for filing, it is agreed between the boards of directors of the constituent corporations that a later effective date is advisable, in which event the certificate of merger shall contain a provision specifying such later effective date as is agreed upon between such boards, but which date under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="905" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;905(a)</cite> may not exceed 30 days subsequent to the filing of the certificate of merger by the Department of State.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Seven</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><form.text>Notwithstanding authorization of this plan by the members of either of the constituent corporations, if at any time prior to the filing of the certificate of merger by the Department of State it becomes the opinion of the board of directors of either of the constituent corporations that events or circumstances have occurred which render it inadvisable to consummate the merger, this plan of merger may be abandoned. The filing of the certificate of merger by the Department of State shall conclusively establish that this plan has not been abandoned.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of certificate of merger&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l">By:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of authorized representative 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Title of authorized representative 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Attested:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Corporate seal 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l">By:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of authorized representative 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Title of authorized representative 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Attested:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Corporate seal 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><para.text>The board of directors of each corporation proposing to participate in a merger or consolidation must adopt, by a vote of two-thirds of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time, or by a vote of the number of directors required under the certificate of incorporation, bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any other applicable law, a plan of merger or consolidation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="902" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;902(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3470 to 3479" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3470 to 3479</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1288">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;1288</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>One.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><para.text>The optional provision is required if the name of any constituent corporation has been changed from the name under which the corporation was originally formed. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="902" subref="(a)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &sect;902(a)(1)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Seven.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|208|30:197"><para.text>At any time prior to the filing of the certificate of merger or consolidation, the plan of merger or consolidation may be abandoned pursuant to a provision for such abandonment, if any, contained in the plan of merger or consolidation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="903" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;903(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1291">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;1291</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>

<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56a1e801b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>PLAN OF CONSOLIDATION</name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>Plan of consolidation of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>One</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>The names of the constituent corporations are <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr>. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: If the name of any constituent corporation has been changed add the following: The name under which &lsqb;&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;/&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;&rsqb; was formed is &lsqb;name of corporation when formed&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para>
<item.selection.group type="choice">
<instruction>&lsqb;EITHER:&rsqb;</instruction>
<item.selection>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>The name of the consolidated corporation is <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of consolidated corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
</item.selection>
<instruction>&lsqb;OR:&rsqb;</instruction>
<item.selection>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>The name of the consolidated corporation has not yet been determined. The name of the consolidated corporation shall be determined in the following manner: <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of method for determining name of consolidated corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
</item.selection>
</item.selection.group></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Two</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>As to each constituent corporation, the membership and holders of any certificates evidencing capital contributions or subventions, including their number, classification, and voting rights are as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of required information for each constituent corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Three</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>The terms and conditions of the proposed consolidation, including the manner and basis of converting membership or other interest in each constituent corporation into membership or other interest in the surviving corporation, or the cash or other consideration to be paid or delivered in exchange for membership or other interest in each constituent corporation are as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of terms and conditions of consolidation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Four</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>The certificate of incorporation of the consolidated corporation shall contain the following statements required to be included in a certificate of incorporation for a corporation formed under the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law: <inline.instr>&lsqb;description of required statements&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>Other statements as to facts not available at the time of adoption by the board of the Plan of Consolidation may also be included.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Five</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>This Plan shall become effective on approval by the members of the corporation, either by unanimous written consent, in compliance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614">Section 614 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, or by affirmative vote of at least two-thirds of the members of the corporation, in compliance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="613" subref="(c)">Section 613(c) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Six</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>The proposed consolidation shall become effective upon the filing of the certificate of consolidation by the Department of State, unless, prior to delivery of such certificate to the Department of State for filing, it is agreed between the boards of directors of the constituent corporations that a later effective date is advisable, in which event the certificate of consolidation shall contain a provision specifying such later effective date as is agreed upon between such boards, but which date under <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="905" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;905(a)</cite> may not exceed 30 days subsequent to the filing of the certificate of consolidation by the Department of State.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Seven</designator></name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><form.text>Notwithstanding authorization of this Plan by the members of either of the constituent corporations, if, at any time prior to the filing of the certificate of consolidation by the Department of State, it becomes the opinion of the board of directors of either of the constituent corporations that events or circumstances have occurred which render it inadvisable to consummate the consolidation, this Plan of Consolidation may be abandoned. The filing of the certificate of consolidation by the Department of State shall conclusively establish that this Plan has not been abandoned.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of certificate of consolidation&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>

<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>

<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>

</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><para.text>The board of directors of each corporation proposing to participate in a consolidation must adopt, by a vote of two-thirds of the directors present at the time of the vote, if a quorum is present at that time, or by a vote of the number of directors required under the certificate of incorporation, bylaws, the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any other applicable law, a plan of consolidation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="902" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;902(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3470 to 3479" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3470 to 3479</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1288">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;1288</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>One.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><para.text>The optional provision is required if the name of any constituent corporation has been changed from the name under which the corporation was originally formed. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="902" subref="(a)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &sect;902(a)(1)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><para.text>Unlike a merger, where the name of the surviving corporation is known, it may be in the case of a consolidation, where the two corporations consolidate into a new corporation, that the corporate name will not be determined at the time the plan for consolidation is drafted. The statute allows for this by permitting the method to be used for determining the name of the consolidated corporation to be stated rather than the name itself. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="902" subref="(a)" pararef="(1)">N-PCL &sect;902(a)(1)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Seven.</designator></name.block>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|209|30:198"><para.text>At any time prior to the filing of the certificate of consolidation, the plan of consolidation may be abandoned pursuant to a provision for such abandonment, if any, contained in the plan of consolidation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="903" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;903(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1291">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;1291</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>

</online.view>

<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56a6ca01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"><form.text>Whereas, in the opinion of the board of directors, it is deemed to be in the best interests of this corporation that the corporation be merged with <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of other corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"><form.text>Therefore, be it resolved, that the board of directors of this corporation adopt the Plan of Merger; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"><form.text>Resolved further, that the board of directors of this corporation recommend that the corporation be merged; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"><form.text>Resolved further, that the officers and directors of this corporation submit to a vote at the <inline.instr>&lsqb;annual/special&rsqb;</inline.instr> meeting of the members the adoption of the Plan of Merger. Such meeting of the members shall be held at <inline.instr>&lsqb;location of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"><para.text>The board of each constituent corporation, upon approving the plan of merger or consolidation, must submit such plan to a vote of the members. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="903" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;903(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|211|30:199"><para.text>If any merging corporation has no members entitled to vote on the plan of merger, the plan of merger is deemed approved by the members of the corporation when it is adopted by the board of that corporation pursuant to &sect;902. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="903" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;903(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3470 to 3479" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3470 to 3479</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|212|30:200"><form.text>Whereas, in the opinion of the board of directors, it is deemed to be in the best interests of this corporation that the corporation be merged with <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of other corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|212|30:200"><form.text>Therefore, be it resolved, that the board of directors of this corporation recommend that the corporation be merged; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|212|30:200"><form.text>Resolved further, that the officers and directors of this corporation submit to a vote at the <inline.instr>&lsqb;annual/special&rsqb;</inline.instr> meeting of the members the adoption of the Plan of Merger. Such meeting of the members shall be held at <inline.instr>&lsqb;location of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, in <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>

See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="903" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;903(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:201</designator><name>Notice of special meeting of members to consider directors&apos; recommendation to merger</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MRG</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56abac01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.line align="l">To: The members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"><form.text>Notice is hereby given that a special meeting of the members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> will be held at the principal office of the corporation at <inline.instr>&lsqb;office address of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr>, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr> for the following purposes:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(1)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"><form.text>To consider and act on a recommendation of the board of directors that the corporation be merged. A copy of <inline.instr>&lsqb;the plan of merger/an outline of the material features of the plan&rsqb;</inline.instr> accompany this notice. Please review it carefully.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(2)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"><form.text>To consider and act on any other business that may come before the meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"><form.text>By order of the board of directors.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of notice of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of person issuing notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Title of person issuing notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"><para.text>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member&apos;s fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="605" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;605(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|213|30:201"><para.text>Notice of meeting must be given to each member whether or not the member is entitled to vote. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="903" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;903(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3470 to 3479" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3470 to 3479</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="901 to 907, 1290" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;901 to 907, 1290</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:202</designator><name>Members&apos; resolution approving merger or consolidation</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MRG</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56ae1d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|214|30:202"><form.text>Whereas, the board of directors of the corporation, at a meeting held on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;address of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr>, adopted resolutions recommending the <inline.instr>&lsqb;merger/consolidation&rsqb;</inline.instr> of this corporation and ordering that the issue of <inline.instr>&lsqb;merger/consolidation&rsqb;</inline.instr> be submitted to a vote of members at this meeting; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|214|30:202"><form.text>Whereas, more than two-thirds of the members present and voting have voted to authorize such <inline.instr>&lsqb;merger/consolidation&rsqb;</inline.instr>; it is</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|214|30:202"><form.text>Resolved, that <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation, be <inline.instr>&lsqb;merged/consolidated&rsqb;</inline.instr> as proposed in the Plan of <inline.instr>&lsqb;Merger/Consolidation&rsqb;</inline.instr>; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|214|30:202"><form.text>Further resolved, that the appropriate officers of the club are directed to execute and file the requisite certificate of <inline.instr>&lsqb;merger/consolidation&rsqb;</inline.instr> with the New York Department of State and to take such further action as may be necessary or appropriate to carry out the intent of this resolution.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|214|30:202"><para.text>The plan of merger or consolidation must be approved at a meeting of the members by two-thirds vote as provided in <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="613" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;613(c)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3470 to 3479" numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3470 to 3479</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1290">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;1290</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56b08e01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>CERTIFICATE OF MERGER OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CORPORATION 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> AND <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CORPORATION 2&rsqb;</inline.instr> UNDER <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="904">SECTION 904 OF THE N.Y. NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW</cite></name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"><form.text>Pursuant to the provisions of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="904">Section 904 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, the undersigned corporations adopted the following certificate of merger for the purpose of merging them into one corporation:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"><form.text>The names of the constituent corporations are <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr>. <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: &lsqb;Name of corporation 1&rsqb; was originally formed under the name &lsqb;name of corporation 1 at formation&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr> <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: &lsqb;Name of corporation 2&rsqb; was originally formed under the name &lsqb;name of corporation 2 at formation&rsqb;.&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"><form.text>The name of the surviving corporation is <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of surviving corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"><form.text>The certificate of incorporation of the surviving corporation is amended or changed as follows: <inline.instr>&lsqb;&lsqb;Specification of amendments&rsqb;/&lsqb;Specification of changes&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"><form.text>The effective date of the merger is <inline.instr>&lsqb;effective date of merger&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"><form.text>The date when the certificate of incorporation of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> was filed by the Department of State is <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of filing&rsqb;</inline.instr>. The date when the certificate of incorporation of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr> was filed by the Department of State is <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of filing&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>5</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"><form.text>The merger of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr> was authorized with respect to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> by <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of manner of authorization&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>6</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|215|30:203"><form.text>The merger of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr> was authorized with respect to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr> by <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of manner of authorization&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of certificate of merger&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporation 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l">By:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of authorized representative 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Title of authorized representative 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Attested:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Corporate seal 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporation 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l">By:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of authorized representative 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Title of authorized representative 1&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Attested:</form.line>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Corporate seal 2&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>

</note.group>

<analytical.level>
<front>
<outline.name.block>
<designator>7</designator><name>Dissolution</name></outline.name.block>
</front>
<analytical.level.body>
<section.block>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:205</designator><name>Directors&apos; resolution recommending dissolution</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56c1a501b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"><form.text>Whereas, in the opinion of the board of directors, it is deemed to be in the best interests of this corporation that the corporation be dissolved;</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"><form.text>Therefore, be it resolved, that the board of directors of this corporation recommend that the corporation be dissolved; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"><form.text>Resolved further, that the officers and directors of this corporation submit to a vote at the <inline.instr>&lsqb;annual/special&rsqb;</inline.instr> meeting of the members the adoption of this resolution. Such meeting of the members shall be held at <inline.instr>&lsqb;location of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, in the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, State of New York, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"><para.text>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation has the power to cease its corporate activities and terminate its existence by voluntary dissolution. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1001 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|217|30:205"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law also makes provision for the dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation by an action for dissolution brought by the Attorney General based on one or more specified, statutory grounds. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1101 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1101 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3390">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3480 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3480 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr4" titlename="Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club" volref="70" pageref="897">Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution" volref="51" pageref="1318">Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution, 51 A.L.R.3d 1318</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1328 to 1336" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1328 to 1336</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:206</designator><name>Directors&apos; resolution authorizing and recommending approval of dissolution</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56c68701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|218|30:206"><form.text>The undersigned, being all the directors of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, do hereby consent, pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="708" subref="(b)">Section 708(b) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite> of the State of New York, to the adoption of the following resolutions in lieu of a meeting of the Board of Directors.</form.text></form.para>
<form.line align="c">Authorization and Recommended Approval of Corporate Plan of Dissolution</form.line>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|218|30:206"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the Plan of Dissolution, a copy of which is annexed hereto, is approved by the Board of Directors and recommended to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of member&rsqb;</inline.instr>, the <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>&apos;s sole member, for approval; and it is further</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|218|30:206"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the Board of Directors authorizes the filing of a Certificate of Dissolution in accordance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1003">Section 1003 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|218|30:206"><form.text>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned do authorize and agree to the foregoing resolutions as of the dates shown below.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;specification of date&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Names of directors&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:207</designator><name>Notice of special meeting of members to consider directors&apos; recommendation to dissolve</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56d2bc01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.line align="l">To: The members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><form.text>Notice is hereby given that a special meeting of the members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;</inline.instr> will be held at the principal office of the club at <inline.instr>&lsqb;office address of club&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr>, on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;time of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr> for the following purposes:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(1)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><form.text>To consider and act on a recommendation of the board of directors that the club be dissolved.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(2)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><form.text>To consider and act on any other business that may come before the meeting.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><form.text>By order of the board of directors.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of notice of special meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of person issuing notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<form.line align="l"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Title of person issuing notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><para.text>Written notice must state the place, date and hour of the meeting, the means of electronic communication, if any, by which members may participate in the proceedings of the meeting and, unless it is an annual meeting, indicate that it is being issued by or at the direction of the person or persons calling the meeting. Notice of a special meeting must also state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called. A copy of the notice of any meeting must be given, personally, by mail, or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, to each member entitled to vote at such meeting. If the notice is given personally, by first class mail or by facsimile telecommunications or by electronic mail, it must be given not less than 10 nor more than 50 days before the date of the meeting; if mailed by any other class of mail, it must be given not less than 30 nor more than 60 days before such date. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail, with postage thereon prepaid, directed to the member at his or her address as it appears on the record of members, or, if he or she has filed with the secretary of the corporation a written request that notices to him or her be mailed to some other address, then directed to him of her at such other address. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the member&apos;s fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the record of members, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the secretary of the corporation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such notice shall not be deemed to have been given electronically (1) if the corporation is unable to deliver two consecutive notices to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail; or (2) the corporation otherwise becomes aware that notice cannot be delivered to the member by facsimile telecommunication or electronic mail. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="605" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;605(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><para.text>Notice of a meeting need not be given to any member who submits a waiver of the notice, in person or by proxy, whether before or after the meeting. Waiver of notice may be written or electronic. If written, the waiver must be executed by the member or the member&apos;s authorized officer, director, employee, or agent by signing such waiver or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such waiver by any reasonable means, including, but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the waiver must be sent by electronic mail and set forth, or be submitted with, information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the member. The attendance of any member at a meeting, in person or by proxy, without protesting prior to the conclusion of the meeting the lack of notice of the meeting, shall constitute a waiver of notice by that member. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="606">N-PCL &sect;606</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><para.text>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation has the power to cease its corporate activities and terminate its existence by voluntary dissolution. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1001 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|219|30:207"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law also makes provision for the dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation by an action for dissolution brought by the Attorney General based on one or more specified, statutory grounds. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1101 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1101 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3390">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3411">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3411</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3480 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3480 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr4" titlename="Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club" volref="70" pageref="897">Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution" volref="51" pageref="1318">Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution, 51 A.L.R.3d 1318</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="901 to 907, 1328 to 1336" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;901 to 907, 1328 to 1336</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:208</designator><name>Members&apos; resolution approving dissolution of club</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>

<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56d52d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"><form.text>Whereas, the board of directors of the club, at a meeting held on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>&lsqb;address of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of county&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of state&rsqb;</inline.instr>, adopted resolutions recommending the dissolution of this club and ordering that the issue of dissolution be submitted to a vote of members at this meeting; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"><form.text>Whereas, more than two-thirds of the members present and voting have voted to authorize such dissolution; it is</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"><form.text>Resolved, that <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation, be dissolved; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"><form.text>Further resolved, that the appropriate officers of the club are directed to execute and file the requisite certificate of dissolution with the New York Secretary of State, and to take such further action as may be necessary or appropriate to carry out the intent of this resolution.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"><para.text>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation has the power to cease its corporate activities and terminate its existence by voluntary dissolution. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1001 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law also makes provision for the dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation by an action for dissolution brought by the Attorney General based on one or more specified, statutory grounds. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1101 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1101 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|220|30:208"><para.text>For statutory provisions concerning procedure for voluntary, nonjudicial dissolution, see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1001 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
</note.group>

<form uuid="Id56def101b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|221|30:209"><form.text>WHEREAS, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of member&rsqb;</inline.instr> is the sole member of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation formed on <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of formation&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|221|30:209"><form.text>WHEREAS, the board of directors of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> has approved by unanimous written consent a plan of dissolution for <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> and recommended such plan to the Board of Directors of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of member&rsqb;</inline.instr> for approval;</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|221|30:209"><form.text>NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, that the Board of Directors hereby approves and consents to the Plan of Dissolution of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a copy of which is annexed hereto; and it is further</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|221|30:209"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the Board of Directors approves the filing of a Certificate of Dissolution by <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> in accordance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1003">Section 1003 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>; and it is further</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|221|30:209"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the board of directors of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> is authorized to take all action necessary to effectuate the dissolution of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:210</designator><name>Members&apos; unanimous written consent to voluntary dissolution</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56e8b501b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>UNANIMOUS WRITTEN CONSENT OF MEMBERS TO VOLUNTARY DISSOLUTION OF <inline.instr>&lsqb;NAME OF CORPORATION&rsqb;</inline.instr>, A NEW YORK NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION</name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"><form.text>We, the undersigned, being all of the members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation, do hereby consent to the voluntary dissolution of such club and do authorize and direct the appropriate officers of the club to take all steps necessary or appropriate to carry out the intent of this resolution.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"><form.text>In assent to the above, each of the undersigned members has signed his or her name and dated the signing.</form.text></form.para>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Names of members&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"><para.text>This form is based on the provisions of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614">N-PCL &sect;614</cite>. That section provides that, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken at any meeting of the members by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may be taken without a meeting if all the members entitled to vote thereon consent thereto in writing or electronically. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;614(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"><para.text>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"><para.text>A not-for-profit corporation has the power to cease its corporate activities and terminate its existence by voluntary dissolution. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1001 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"><para.text>The N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law also makes provision for the dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation by an action for dissolution brought by the Attorney General based on one or more specified, statutory grounds. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1101 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1101 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|222|30:210"><para.text>For statutory provisions concerning procedure for voluntary, nonjudicial dissolution, see <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001 et seq." secrange="y">N-PCL &dblsect;1001 et seq.</cite></para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3390">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3480 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3480 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr4" titlename="Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club" volref="70" pageref="897">Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution" volref="51" pageref="1318">Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution, 51 A.L.R.3d 1318</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="894, 1328 to 1336" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;894, 1328 to 1336</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
