<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:211</designator><name>Resolution approving plan of dissolution and asset transfer</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56ed9701b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>WHEREAS, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> has assets consisting of real property, buildings, equipment, furniture, records, investments and cash and such assets include certain temporarily restricted assets that are legally required to be used for a particular purpose; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>WHEREAS, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> has liabilities; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>WHEREAS, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> shall sell the buildings and real property, equipment, furniture and other tangible personal property for fair market value and upon terms that are fair and reasonable to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, provided that certain records and other tangible personal property important to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>&apos;s purposes shall be distributed to <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of distributee&rsqb;</inline.instr> (the &ldquo;Distributee&rdquo;), which is of substantially similar purpose as <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> and which qualifies as an exempt organization pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-irc" titleref="26" secref="501" subref="(c)" pararef="(3)" date="1986">Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986</cite>, as amended, and has agreed to only use the temporarily restricted assets in accordance with the terms of the gift instrument restricting each such asset; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>WHEREAS, the sale of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>&apos;s buildings and real property shall be authorized by a majority of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>&apos;s Board of Directors pursuant to <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="509" subref="(b)">Section 509(b) of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite> which requires the sale of real property to be approved by a majority of a corporation&apos;s board of directors; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> to dissolve under the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>NOW, THEREFORE, it is hereby</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the Plan of Dissolution and Distribution of Assets, a form of which is attached hereto as Exhibit <inline.instr>&lsqb;designation of exhibit&rsqb;</inline.instr>, is approved in all respects and is adopted as the Plan of Dissolution of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the proper officers of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> are instructed and authorized to obtain the consent of the members of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the proper officers of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> are instructed and authorized to make any necessary changes to the Plan of Dissolution and Distribution of Assets and to execute and deliver any and all documents necessary to effectuate the dissolution of the Corporation, including the filing of a Certificate of Dissolution in accordance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1003">Section 1003 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>; and</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|223|30:211"><form.text>RESOLVED, that the proper officers of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> are hereby authorized to take any further action and execute and deliver any agreements, instruments and documents, in the name of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, as in their judgment shall be necessary, proper or advisable in order to carry out the intent and accomplish the purposes of the resolutions adopted hereby.</form.text></form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3390">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3480 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3480 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:212</designator><name>Plan of complete liquidation and dissolution</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56f4ea01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>PLAN OF COMPLETE LIQUIDATION AND DISSOLUTION</name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><form.text>Plan of complete liquidation and dissolution of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation, subsequently called the Corporation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>One</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>APPROVAL OF PLAN</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><form.text>This plan shall become effective on approval by the members of the corporation, either by unanimous written consent, in compliance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="614">Section 614 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, or by affirmative vote of at least two-thirds of the members of the corporation, in compliance with <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(a)">Section 1002(a) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Two</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>COLLECTION OF ASSETS AND PAYMENT OF OBLIGATIONS</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><form.text>After approval and adoption of the plan by the members, the corporation shall proceed to collect its assets and to sell, exchange, convey, or otherwise dispose of or reduce to cash all of such assets, except such assets as may be distributed in kind to the members in pro rata distributions, and to pay, satisfy, and discharge or make provision for payment, satisfaction, and discharge of its liabilities and obligations, including unascertained or contingent liabilities and obligations. Such sale, exchange, conveyance, or other disposition of the assets of the corporation shall be completed as quickly as possible after the approval and adoption of the plan by the members.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><label>Section</label><designator>Three</designator></name.block><form.para><form.text>DISTRIBUTION OF ASSETS</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><form.text>As soon as practicable, the corporation shall:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(a)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><form.text>Make one or more pro rata distributions to members, in cash or in kind, of assets of the corporation legally available for distribution in accordance with the provisions of the corporation&apos;s certificate of incorporation <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: and bylaws&rsqb;</inline.instr> governing the distributive rights of members <inline.instr>&lsqb;OPTIONAL: and classes of members&rsqb;</inline.instr>, specifically <inline.instr>&lsqb;recitation of sections of certificate of incorporation and/or bylaws&rsqb;</inline.instr>;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(b)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><form.text>All assets held by the corporation for a <inline.instr>&lsqb;charitable/eleemosynary/benevolent/educational/&lsqb;specification of usage of assets&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr> use, consisting of <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of assets&rsqb;</inline.instr>, which assets are not held upon a condition requiring return, transfer, or conveyance by reason of the dissolution of the corporation, shall be transferred or conveyed to <inline.instr>&lsqb;list of one or more domestic or foreign corporations, societies, or organizations engaged in activities substantially similar to those of dissolving corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, pursuant to the plan of distribution to be subsequently adopted by the corporation;</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(c)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><form.text>All assets held by the corporation upon a condition requiring return, transfer, or conveyance by reason of the dissolution of the corporation shall be returned, transferred, or conveyed in accordance with the requirements appertaining thereto; and</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>(d)</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><form.text>Dissolve and file a formal certificate of dissolution in compliance with the provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit></form.item></form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><para.text>A nonjudicial dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation must be initiated by the adoption by its board of directors of a plan for its dissolution and the distribution of its assets. This plan must implement any provision in the certificate of incorporation prescribing the distributive rights of its members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1001(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><para.text>On dissolution, a not-for-profit corporation may make distributions to its members as permitted by the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="515" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;515(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><para.text>If the corporation is a charitable corporation and has no assets to distribute and no liabilities at the time of dissolution, the plan of dissolution shall include a statement to that effect. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1001" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;1001(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><para.text>The board must submit its plan to the members of the corporation for approval. The dissolution is deemed authorized when the plan is approved by the statutory two-thirds vote of the members. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1002(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|224|30:212"><para.text>The plan of dissolution must also be approved by any governmental body or officer whose approval was required for the formation of the corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(c)">N-PCL &sect;1002(c)</cite>. Moreover, the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets must have annexed thereto the approval of the Attorney General in the case of a charitable corporation, and in the case of any noncharitable corporation which at the time of dissolution holds assets legally required to be used for a particular purpose. Application to the Attorney General for such approval must be by verified petition, with the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets and certified copies of the consents prescribed by statute annexed thereto. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1002" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;1002(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3390">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3480 et seq." numrange="y">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3480 et seq.</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr4" titlename="Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club" volref="70" pageref="897">Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr3" titlename="Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution" volref="51" pageref="1318">Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution, 51 A.L.R.3d 1318</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1328 to 1336" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1328 to 1336</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56f9cc01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<form.name.block><name>Plan of Dissolution of <inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of Corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr></name></form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"><form.text>The Board of Directors (&ldquo;Directors&rdquo;) of <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr> does hereby resolve and recommend to its sole member for approval that the corporation be dissolved. The Directors considered the advisability of voluntarily dissolving the corporation. All of the Directors determined that dissolution was advisable and in the best interest of the corporation and agreed to this resolution by unanimous written consent without a meeting. They adopted the following plan:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"><form.text>Following resolution of the Board of Directors adopting a Plan of Dissolution, the board shall submit the plan to its sole member for approval.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"><form.text>No approval of the dissolution of the corporation by any governmental body or officer is required.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"><form.text>The corporation has no assets or liabilities.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"><form.text>A Certificate of Dissolution shall be signed by an authorized director or officer and all required approvals shall be attached thereto.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|225|30:213"><para.text>See Notes following <cite type="secondaryxref" secref="30:212">&sect;30:212</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>

<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3390">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3390</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:214</designator><name>Notice to creditor of known claim</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56fc3d01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-214_001">
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="1*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="19*"/>
<tbody>
<row><entry>To: <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of creditor&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of creditor&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"><form.text>Pursuant to the provisions of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1007">Section 1007 of the Not-for-Profit Corp. Law</cite>, you are hereby notified as follows:</form.text></form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item><name.block><designator>1</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"><form.text>The undersigned corporation has been dissolved effective <inline.instr>&lsqb;effective date of dissolution&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>2</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"><form.text>If you have a claim against the dissolved corporation, you must send your claim, including <inline.instr>&lsqb;description of required information about claim&rsqb;</inline.instr>, to the following address: <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>, Attention: <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of individual&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;address of individual&rsqb;</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of city&rsqb;</inline.instr>, New York <inline.instr>&lsqb;zip code of individual&apos;s address&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>3</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"><form.text>Your claim package must be received by the dissolved corporation no later than <inline.instr>&lsqb;due date of receipt&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
<form.item><name.block><designator>4</designator></name.block><form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"><form.text>IF YOUR CLAIM IS NOT RECEIVED ON OR BEFORE THE DEADLINE SPECIFIED IN PARAGRAPH 3, ABOVE, IT WILL BE FOREVER BARRED PURSUANT TO <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1007">Section 1007 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.</form.text></form.para></form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of person issuing notice&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"><para.text>At any time after the plan of dissolution and distribution of assets has been authorized or approved pursuant to statute, and prior to filing the certificate of dissolution, the corporation may give a notice requiring all creditors and claimants to present their claims in writing and in detail at a specified place and by a specified day, which shall not be less than six months after the first publication of such notice. The notice must be published at least once a week for two successive weeks in a newspaper of general circulation in the county in which the office of the corporation was located on the date of authorization of its plan of dissolution and distribution of assets as provided in the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1007" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1007(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"><para.text>On or before the date of the first publication of such notice, the corporation must mail a copy thereof, postage prepaid, to each person believed to be a creditor of or claimant against the corporation whose current name and address are known to or can with due diligence be ascertained by the corporation. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1007" subref="(a)">N-PCL &sect;1007(a)</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|226|30:214"><para.text>Any creditor who does not file a claim as provided in the notice published in the newspaper and/or mailed to known creditors will be forever barred from suing on the claim or otherwise realizing upon or enforcing it, with certain exceptions. See <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1007" subref="(b)">N-PCL &sect;1007(b)</cite>.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3482">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3482</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="alr4" titlename="Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club" volref="70" pageref="897">Right to assets of voluntarily dissolved lodge or club, 70 A.L.R.4th 897</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1328 to 1336" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1328 to 1336</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block><label>&sect;</label><designator>30:215</designator><name>Rejection by dissolved corporation of creditor&apos;s claim</name></outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CRD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>AMT</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Id56feae01b6411e684899cfd92da4eb0">
<tbl ident="NYLB:30-215_001">
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="1*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="19*"/>
<tbody>
<row><entry>To: <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of creditor&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry><inline.instr>&lsqb;address of creditor&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
<row><entry>Re: <inline.instr>&lsqb;description of claim of creditor&rsqb;</inline.instr></entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|227|30:215"><form.text>With regard to the above-referenced claim, you are hereby notified that <inline.instr>&lsqb;name of club&rsqb;</inline.instr>, a dissolved not-for-profit corporation, rejects such claim <inline.instr>&lsqb;in its entirety/&lsqb;specification of portion of claim rejected&rsqb;&rsqb;</inline.instr>.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|227|30:215"><form.text>You are further notified that, pursuant to the provisions of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1007" subref="(b)">Section 1007(b) of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>, any claim(s) disputed by a dissolved not-for-profit corporation may be submitted for determination to the Supreme Court in the judicial district where the office of the dissolved corporation was located at the date of its dissolution. A special proceeding in the Supreme Court may be instituted upon the petition of the corporation or that of a creditor, claimant, and certain others.</form.text></form.para>
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">Dated: <inline.instr>&lsqb;date of rejection&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y"><inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporate officer&rsqb;</inline.instr></form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|227|30:215"><para.text>The above form is based on the provisions of <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1007">N-PCL &dblsect;1007</cite>, <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1008">1008</cite>.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|227|30:215"><para.text>If, after sending the notice to the creditor, the dissolved corporation rejects the claim, in whole or in part, the dissolved corporation should notify the creditor of such rejection and explain what remedies exist in the situation.</para.text></para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="topic.key" normalpub="key" sub="Corporations and Business Organizations" numref="3482">West&apos;s Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3482</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><cite type="secondary" normalpub="nyj2" topicname="Business Relationships" secref="1328 to 1336" secrange="y">N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1328 to 1336</cite></ref.text></reference.entry>

<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|230|30:218"><para.text>The above form, revised 3/16, is available from the New York State Department of State, <cite type="url" normalpub="webref">http://www.dos.ny.gov</cite>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.</para.text></para>
<para ct.id="f2fd26a0b92511efa75bc0a5c2da1858|230|30:218"><para.text>The post office address to which the Secretary of State must mail a copy of any process against it served upon him or her may be changed by delivering to the Department of State a certificate, entitled &ldquo;Certificate of amendment of certificate of surrender of authority of <leaveout size="small"/> (name of corporation) under section <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1311">1311 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</cite>.&rdquo; The certificate must be signed and set forth information required by statute. <cite type="lrre" normalpub="statute-us-ny-law-notforprofitcorp" secref="1311" subref="(d)">N-PCL &sect;1311(d)</cite>.</para.text></para>
